items.title: ES6, TypeScript, Angular 2 Developer; South America Only at Custody X Change Inc. () (allows remote)
items.content:
ES6, TypeScript, Angular 2 Developer; South America Only

Custody X Change Inc.

Job Description

I'm hiring an experienced ES6 / TypeScript / Angular 2 developer who will have a big impact in my tiny company. My company embraces 100% remote work and flexible hours. This is a full-time position.

I'd like to hire you if you:

  • Love JavaScript (ES6+) and TypeScript
  • Have 3+ months experience with Angular 2
  • Are self-motivated and can solve problems independently
  • Have excellent written and verbal English skills
  • Live in South America
  • Want to work from home in a long-term, full-time position
  • And we get along; to see the team you'll be joining, visit our about us page

My company is called Custody X Change. I've been working on this business since 2004. We sell software that creates child custody schedules and parenting plans. This software has helped thousands of people in their child custody situations, by reducing their conflict and saving them money in legal fees.

We care deeply about creating amazing customer experiences. This means that we solicit feedback from users and run moderated usability studies. Then we go back and make changes to our interface and our code to make it easier to use. It's exciting when you make a change and see it positively impact our customers.

In February of this year we launched a beta of our new product, a web/mobile Angular 2 application that will make it easy for families to communicate about custody scheduling, children's activities, and shared expenses.

We need your help writing Angular 2 code, building components, and tackling a lot of challenges. As this is a small, distributed team, it's important that you can work independently and find solutions to the challenges you'll face.

Our stack is built with Angular 2 on the frontend, Node.js on the backend and Amazon DynamoDB for the database. We're running everything on Amazon Web Services. We're writing all of the code in JavaScript (ES6+) and TypeScript.

If you want to build a genuinely helpful product that lots of people will use, build it on Angular 2 and other new technologies, and join a small, distributed team, then we should talk.

To apply, email me at careers@custodyxchange.com, and:

  • Include your resume in PDF format
  • Somehow use the word "lime" in the subject of your email
  • Answer the following 4 questions in your email, in this order:
  1. Where do you live?
  2. Tell me about a project you've worked on: what was your role, team size, project length, technologies used, testing methodology, etc.?
  3. How much have you used angular 2, and what do you think about it?
  4. What salary would you be happy making, for this long-term, full-time, remote position?

Note: agencies need not apply; I'm looking for an employee to join our team.

Thanks,
-Ben

P.S. I want you to be happy working for me. I'll pay you a good salary and you can work normal hours. I care about results, not bureaucracy

items.title: Spring Boot/Java Software Engineer-Pizza and Wine at Granbury Solutions (Grapevine, TX) (allows remote)
items.content:
Spring Boot/Java Software Engineer-Pizza and Wine

Granbury Solutions

Job Description

Granbury Solutions is building a next generation technology stack for our restaurant and winery management platforms and we need your help.  We're looking for Java Developers of all experience levels to help change the world of food and wine forever.  If you're hip to Spring Boot and wish the higher ups would give you a chance to use it, it might be time to get some new higher ups.

We have a number of positions available on our restaurant point-of-sale and direct to consumer wine teams.  Our new tech stack is Spring Boot on top of Couchbase, Rabbit MQ and Elastic Search.  

You'll work with people who are as nice as they are smart.  You'll get the guidance you need and you won't be shamed when you stumble across a problem you don't know how to solve on your own.  You'll deal with a minimum of corporate nonsense and get the freedom to do things right.  

And you'll do all this from the comfort of your own home.  This is a remote position, but you'll keep in touch with your team with daily virtual standups.  We'll pick a spot on the map every so often and get together for a technical conference or in person design confab.  But most importantly, you'll give hard working locally owned businesses a real chance in their struggle against the empire.  Seriously.

Skills & Requirements

Required Qualifications

  • A bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
  • At least 3 years experience developing Java web applications.
  • At least 2 years with the Spring Framework.
  • Experience with and fanatical belief in Test Driven Development with JUnit or TestNG.
  • Experience with build tools like Maven and Gradle.
  • At least 5 years experience with developing applications for Linux web servers.  (CentOS preferred.)
  • At least 5 years experience building Java applications on relational databases. (MySQL or Postgres preferred.)
  • A working knowledge of AWS services like EC2, Route 53, S3, RDS, and Elastic Load Balancing.
  • At least one project in production on a NoSQL database. (Couchbase preferred.)
  • Exposure to at least one modern Javascript SPA framework like Backbone, Ember, or Angular.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • A desire to do things right and the ability to take ownership of difficult problems.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Continuous integration platforms like Bamboo or Jenkins (Jenkins preferred).
  • Enough experience with JPA or Hibernate to know why they need to be phased out.
  • Experience with a configuration management system like Chef, Puppet, Ansible or AWS Cloud Formation.
  • Enough experience with Agile development methodologies to see their strengths and weaknesses.
  • Payment card industry experience or experience building PCI compliant systems.
  • Experience with asynchronous messaging systems like MQ Series, JMS, or Rabbit MQ.
  • Experience with custom PXE based hardware imaging techniques. (Anaconda, kickstart, etc.)
  • Experience building and deploying software as RPM's.  (You've created an RPM build spec.)
  • Experience with embedded development on Verifone or Ingenico payment devices. (Long shot, we know.)
  • Mixed martial arts or dungeon master experience.

You must have the right to work in the US legally.  Offshore applicants will not be considered, but this isn't for political reasons.  It's for we're-not-big-enough-to-make-offshore-work-effectively reasons.

About Granbury Solutions

We're Granbury Solutions.  We make software for malls, wineries, and pizza shops.  Our vinSuite family of winery management products and Napa Valley POS systems are used by wineries all over the world to satisfy the needs of classy drunkards everywhere.  Our Pizza point-of-sale systems are used wherever fine pies are sold.

We work from home and we get together every day for a virtual stand up.  We go to at least one conference a year and we sometimes fly in for design sessions or project war rooms.  We try to take cool nerdy field trips.  Last time we went to the Hanford LIGO Observatory and saw how giant lasers can detect gravity waves.  It was cool.

The Joel Test is a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

items.title: Senior Java Developer at Recordsure (London, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Java Developer

$24k - 36k
Recordsure

Job Description

You will work remotely for us, probably from your home in Eastern Europe or the APAC region, and we will do everything possible to make you feel part of the team... including a trip to London once or twice a year.

You will be expected to work 8 hours per weekday. To ensure effective communication with the rest of the team, and also to take part in required agile ceremonies and meetings, your working day must include the hours 10:00 to 14:00 in the London time zone.

We are a team of highly motivated and dedicated developers with an eye for details. As such you must be at the top of your Java 8 services game and consistently deliver high quality and forward thinking results that are resilient and maintainable.

Our core systems make up a highly available and secure system for the storage, management and processing of customer assets including, documents, audio, video, metadata and more.

Your responsibility is for the onward development of new core functionality in the product, ensuring scalability, stability, security and support of those business critical systems.

Additionally you will have the opportunity to with with our science team productising AI systems for highly available and scalable deployment.

Skills & Requirements

Java 8, Gradle, GIT, REST, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, RabbitMQ, core algorithms and strategies.

About Recordsure

Genuinely the leader in providing face-to-face recording solutions in Financial Services, we have also now started providing solutions to government.


Our new approach to evaluating sales conversations and interviews using Artificial Intelligence is gathering steam - and has enough wow factor to start taking on the $billion companies that provide 'customer contact analytics' - as we have a world class speech, language and data science team and some amazing developers, testers and technical operations experts to wrap it all with product.

items.title: Senior Full Stack Magician at Avant8 Pty Ltd () (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Full Stack Magician

$65k - 100k
Avant8 Pty Ltd

Job Description

We are looking for a developer well versed in HTML, CSS, Javascript, and PHP. While these are required as foundational languages, being the first and primary developer for the projects you will be working on, you can enjoy the flexibility of working with any framework. We’re flexible, so even if you primarily work with C# or any other languages, but have experience developing web applications, send us your CV! :)

Although based in Australia, Avant8 has presence in the US and leverages it to deal with domestic brands and investors, specializing in turning around their distressed digital assets. Our team creates innovative solutions that work well under pressure allowing for new business models to tested rapidly in any market.

We’re looking for A-players, and part of that involves autonomy. You will be assigned tasks, both small and large, and a general time frame, but given the autonomy and freedom to schedule your own daily tasks as long as you complete what needs to get done. We understand and respect that you know development better than we do and it’s not our place to call unnecessarily strict or irrational deadlines and ways of completing tasks. This may be a good place to add that you should, when applying, mention in the cover letter your favorite food and, if you’re feeling ambitious, include a picture: this is to weed out applicants who mindlessly apply en masse to listings.

Given the above mentioned autonomy and freedom, you will be expected to debrief with a daily summary of what was accomplished, problems you ran into, what’s planned for the coming days, and maybe a joke or two. :)

We are a fun, friendly, and closely knit team, and although geographically distant, we have a strong work ethos and communicate regularly allowing for a very friendly and efficient work environment. Being a part of a new division within an established company, you get the best of both worlds in terms of job security and company culture. We work hard and expect the same from all of our team members.

We work hard, but we also play hard. You should come with a great sense of humor and a smile on your face, because you’ll have a few laughs and enjoy your time working with us. We reward hard work with a variety of perks incorporated in our flexible working environment.

Skills & Requirements

  • You are persistent, creative, and resourceful. As MacGyver said: “Any problem can be solved with a little ingenuity”
  • You “think like a user” to see the big picture and implement the product vision
  • You have a willingness to learn, we like to push the boundaries of possible and Innovation is key
  • You must have a passion for what you do, our passion drives our success your passion will power it!
  • Ideally you have a head for business as we will require forward thinking applications will help us all grow, I know we're not asking for much, right!?
  • Everyone loves planning right? You need to be able to plan the project's, workload and resources needed and communicate the plan with the team to ensure the business and technical goals stay inline.
  • Unit testing code is just how it’s done, no questions asked, we all like things that just work!
  • Last but not least we need you to have a respect for deadlines, we understand that you will be creating some awesome applications bit deadlines and communication is of the utmost importance to us.

What will set you apart:

  • Someone who cares more about getting the product right than being right
  • Be confident in a decision making role, but humble to seek advice beforehand
  • You have navigated the challenges of working remotely and are fully prepared to work within them and stay focused

About Avant8 Pty Ltd

We are Australia-based Avant8 Pty Ltd. and we are looking for a motivated full-stack developer to join a new sector in our company that focuses on building digital assets in high trafficked industries, including but not limited to medical (health, wellness), finance, and social.

items.title: Android Engineer at Wikimedia Foundation (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Android Engineer

Wikimedia Foundation

Job Description

Summary:

The Wikimedia Android team is a small but impactful group of engineers, product managers, and designers focused on the Wikipedia Android app. The team is looking for an experienced Android developer who wants the challenge of making our apps the most beautiful, groundbreaking, and collaborative applications in the Google Play Store. We’re passionate about our global community of users and want to leverage the strengths of the Android native platform to bring the Wikipedia experience to their fingertips. You will be joining a small, established team to enhance the Wikipedia reading experience, as well as create entirely new Wikipedia experiences with potential for adoption across multiple platforms.

This is a permanent full-time remote or San Francisco-based role.

Responsibilities:

As an engineer on the Android team, you will be responsible for developing new, exciting and beautiful ways to experience Wikipedia content on mobile devices. You will work with a product manager and designer to translate specs and designs into working features. Your contributions will enable millions of Android users to read and contribute to Wikipedia.

In addition to new features, you will work to Improve the quality and testability of our code. This includes fixing bugs, refactoring old code, and performing code review. You will also communicate and coordinate service requirements with back-end engineers.

Since most team members are remote, your day-to-day work will include discussions on Google Hangouts and IRC as well as our bug tracking system.

Skills & Requirements

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or related area) and 5 years of relevant experience; or 3 years and a Master’s degree; or equivalent work experience
  • 3+ years Android Java and UI experience
  • Familiarity with Android design guidelines, implementation and best practices
  • Passionate, hard-working professional committed to clean code and great app design
  • Proficiency in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

Pluses

  • Familiarity with at least one server-side language (preferably Node.js or PHP)
  • Experience with test driven development
  • Experience with databases on Android
  • Experience contributing to open source Android apps or libraries
  • Experience integrating third party libraries into Android projects
  • Experience contributing to Wikipedia or its sister projects
  • Experience developing a product for a global audience
  • Experience working in a remote work environment
  • Multilingual

We’d like to see your work!   

Please share any of your personal or collaborative project(s) or contributions you feel would be helpful to us in understanding your technical prowess. Links to your open source projects, GitHub, your technical blogs, shipped apps, StackExchange profile, and publications would be great.

Try it out! If you aren’t already using it, download the app and give it a try. We’d love to hear what you think.

About Wikimedia Foundation

About the Wikimedia Foundation

The Wikimedia Foundation is the non-profit organization that supports and hosts Wikipedia and several other Wikimedia free knowledge sites. Every month, the Wikimedia sites are accessed by more than a billion unique devices. Wikipedia consists of more than 40 million articles across hundreds of languages. Every month, more than 70,000 volunteer editors contribute to Wikipedia. Based in San Francisco, California, the Wikimedia Foundation is an audited, 501(c)(3) non-profit that is funded primarily through donations and grants. It currently employs over 240 staff members.

At the Foundation, we build technology to help people everywhere access Wikipedia, across devices and in nearly 300 languages. We engineer privacy for our readers and editors so they can safely and securely explore Wikipedia. We create programs and initiatives to make Wikipedia freely available to more people in more parts of the world. We build new tools for the community of editors so they can continue to improve and grow Wikipedia. Roughly a quarter of our budget goes to supporting the community that make the site possible, including through grantmaking programs that enable volunteers and enrich the information on the sites.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

Benefits & Perks *

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, massages, cooking classes and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

* for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by location

More Information

https://wikimediafoundation.org

https://blog.wikimedia.org

items.title: Senior Software Engineer - Full Stack at Olo (New York, NY) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer - Full Stack

Olo

Job Description

Olo’s software engineers develop the next-generation of digital ordering technologies for many of the country’s largest and fastest-growing restaurant brands. We are laser focused on continually improving ourselves and our products while prioritizing relationships at work and at home. We thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment, collaborating with some of the best engineers across the nation.

Our current technologies include modern versions of C#, F#, ASP.NET MVC, Ember, React, Javascript, HTML/CSS, Xamarin, and MSSQL. We also rely on tools such as AWS, GitHub, TeamCity, and Octopus.

As a part of Olo’s Engineering team, you will play a significant and visible role in helping us build one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the market. You will help us build new features and products, with responsibilities that span software design, test automation, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of our applications and services.

Any engineer may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, nearly half of our engineering team is remote!

Skills & Requirements

  • Leadership experience that spans technology selection, architecture and design oversight, and mentoring others.
  • Software development experience in object-oriented or functional programming.
  • Demonstrable understanding of the full web stack.
  • Superb problem solving skills with an emphasis on pragmatism, quality, and performance.
  • Passion for learning new skills and technologies.
  • Excellent collaboration skills.
  • BS degree in a technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English with a legal right to work in the U.S.

About Olo

Olo is the leading provider of digital ordering for today’s restaurants. We help restaurant brands maximize revenue per square foot by delivering faster, more accurate, and more personal service to their customers.

Olo is located at 26 Broadway in the historic Standard Oil Building, the former home of John D. Rockefeller.  We offer great benefits, such as 20 days of Paid Time Off, fully paid health, dental and vision care for employees and their families, stock options, a generous parental leave plan, and perks like FitBits, rotating craft beers on tap in our kitchen, and occasional food events (now you know why we give out FitBits!).

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Cloud Architect (Azure - Home Based) at KCOM (London, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
Cloud Architect (Azure - Home Based)

£60k - 75k
KCOM

Job Description

Cloud Architect (Microsoft Azure)

We are recruiting for a Cloud Architect with expertise in Microsoft Azure, to work in a home based role.

This role combines business facing consultancy, solution/application architecture to shape and drive Cloud adoption. Playing a key role on a range of high profile Cloud projects with our blue chip client base, our Cloud Architects are expected to be strong technologists first. You will therefore have extensive C#, ASP.NET, MVC and Web API application development experience and a proven track record in designing and delivering scalable, robust and secure enterprise Microsoft solutions.  With first class customer facing skills and a genuine passion for quality / professional delivery, you will be looking for a new challenge with a company that genuinely recognises and rewards its star performers.

What you’ll do and why you’ll be successful

The role will involve the design of architecture, definition of specifications and hands on development. Working closely with the customer to identify key drivers and communicate the rationale and benefits for will require excellent interpersonal skills at all levels within an organisation.

Some of the key tasks include:

  • Design and deliver complex n-tier, enterprise-scale Microsoft solutions
  • Assist customers in defining and implementing integration strategies; this may be as an individual or as an integral part of a multi-skilled team.
  • Build architectures based on Microsoft technologies including C#, ASP.NET, MVC, Web API and WCF
  • Design Azure based solutions, applying knowledge of Azure IaaS and PaaS features
  • Active involvement across the full project lifecycle (to successful deployment), utilising an excellent understanding of project management methodologies including both waterfall and agile
  • Apply experience with and knowledge of UML and design patterns
  • Gather business requirements and architect solutions based on those requirements
  • Leading a technical team

How we will ensure your success:

We appreciate that even great Architects need to be continuously learning, so if that means taking time out to learn from one of our subject matter experts in-house or attending tech talks and conferences, then you will have our full support.

As a Microsoft Gold Partner and Amazon Premier Consulting Partner, we work hard to ensure our staff are experts in the Cloud and we’ll get you certified to prove it!! 

Skills & Requirements

Your Technical Skill Set

We are looking for Cloud Architects from a development background, with experience in:

·Strong understanding and practical experience with Azure

·Good hands-on coding skills in C# and ASP.NET MVC

·Strong experience in SQL Server

·Experience of Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment using Team Foundation Server

·Experience of leading a technical team

·Strong understanding of industry trends (i.e. Web Services / REST / Service Oriented Architecture) (Desirable)

·Experience of SSIS, SSAS and/or SharePoint (Desirable)

·Broad understanding of architecture frameworks such as TOGAF / Zachman (Desirable)

About KCOM

KCOM understands that its people are its most valuable asset, so we go to great lengths to look after them both personally and professionally.

  • Bonus 15% bonus potential
  • Car Allowance and Private Medical
  • Holiday 25 days per year (option to buy additional holiday days).
               
  • Pension Scheme Contributory Pension Scheme
  • Healthcare Family friendly policies covering career breaks, paid maternity, adoption, paternity leave and paid time out for fostering and fertility treatment.
  • Training As a market leader within Cloud Computing, KCOM works closely with vendors such as Microsoft and Amazon, to ensure that all its staff have the relevant professional qualifications to ensure they are subject matter experts.
  • Progression We offer a clear competency framework in place that makes it easy for employees to see development opportunities across the business.

items.title: Full Stack Developer with strong front-end experience at BROWZZIN Pte. Ltd. (Singapore) (allows remote)
items.content:
Full Stack Developer with strong front-end experience

$30k - 60k | Equity
BROWZZIN Pte. Ltd.

Job Description

We're an early stage startup with the ambition to revolutionise retail and drive the convergence of offline and online retail with an influencer-driven shopping platform. The founder has experience and contacts in the retail sector and was the CEO and founder of an ecommerce company that was sold for 700 million EUR in 2015. 

We are looking for a passionate, world-class Full Stack Developer that can also take on important front-end projects to be part of our entrepreneurial development team and that helps bring high-level ideas to a scalable platform and live product that will scale and grow to millions of users worldwide.

What we're offering you:

  1. Autonomy and creative freedom – Help shape how the front-end tools and a high-performance content management platform work, including libraries and custom features. Also help us build our desktop version of the platform, as well as taking ownership of high impact projects needed for the back-end platform.
  2. Flexible Environment - You can help shape our culture and workflow as we are still a small team and open to innovative ways of working.
  3. Urban life or tropical Island – we will have an office in London and already have one in Singapore. We will help you relocate, but in the meantime, you can work from home.

Your responsibilities:

  • Develop our main website, making it responsive for desktop and mobile devices.
  • Develop back-office tools so we can manage our content.
  • Create unit tests to grant that everything works as expected.
  • You will also be responsible for working on cool special projects related to the back-end, such as integration with other platforms/services, analytic dashboards, etc.

How to apply (PLEASE READ THIS):

Email jobs@browzzin.com your CV and provide answers to the following questions – if you don’t your application will not be considered

Q1) How many years of front-end dev experience do you have? (should be at least 3). Please Share the site you’re the most proud of, that you have had a major contribution to.

Q2) What relevant experience do you have with the following technologies LAMP, ReactJS, AngularJS, RESTful APIs? Share examples.

Q3) Please share examples of responsive websites you have worked on

Q4) Provide an example of a web or data-driven system/program you've built, including source code (GitHub links or tarballs are fine). 

We have someone who will review your code and answers, and if it's good enough we'll contact you for a phone interview.

Skills & Requirements

  • Top-notch software engineering talent
  • At least 3 years of proven experience as a front-end developer with a great eye for design
  • Vast experience developing real-world web applications using HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
  • Demonstrable skills with frameworks such as ReactJS and/or AngularJS and experience designing responsive web sites.
  • Demonstrable familiarity with LESS or SASS and familiar implementing based on RESTful APIs.
  • Proven experience with relational databases and document-based databases.
  • Proven experience with at least two of the following programming languages: Python, PHP, Bash Scripting.
  • Proven experience managing at least one Linux distribution (preferably Debian, Ubuntu, or alike), understand how to install, configure and manage a LAMP stack.
  • A good feeling for customers UX/UI needs.
  • You are familiar with git.
  • Passion for performance debugging and benchmarking.
  • Self-directed, pragmatic, independent and has experience owning complete features/products: you are able to solve stuff on your own.
  • Disciplined to build things the right way and test them in an agile environment.
  • Code quality and unit tests mean something to you.
  • Ability to adapt to any technology, language, or development environment that we might need in the future.
  • Documentation - making sure that we can grow the team
  • Amazing ability to get stuff done. Hard working and dedicated
  • S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science or equivalent
  • Fluent in English, both speaking and writing. We are an international team but you need to be able to work in English on a day to day basis.

About BROWZZIN Pte. Ltd.

About BROWZZIN Pte. Ltd.

We're an early stage startup with the ambition to revolutionise retail and drive the convergence of offline and online retail with an influencer-driven shopping platform. The founder has experience and contacts in the retail sector and was the CEO and founder of an ecommerce company that was sold for 700 million EUR in 2015.

items.title: Backend Software Engineer at Marketcircle (Markham, ON, Canada) (allows remote)
items.content:
Backend Software Engineer

C$60k - 80k
Marketcircle

Job Description

Are you a software developer that loves the option of working from home, collaborating with a fun team, and enjoys solving challenging problems?  If so, we're looking for an experienced software developer to join our Backend Team. This team is primarily responsible for developing, maintaining and supporting the backend services for our apps. You will be a highly motivated team player, as well as creative and passionate about developing new technology that not only improves the way our apps work, but also helps small businesses world wide. You are a self-starter and aren’t afraid to jump in on the deep end. 

You are:

  • an experienced software developer, with some experience building backend services
  • comfortable working remotely
  • comfortable working independently or collaboratively
  • willing to participate in a rotating on-call schedule

You’ll be working on:

  • a HTTP/REST API written in Ruby (you will probably spend most of you time here)
  • an Authentication/Payment backend written in Python
  • a PostgreSQL database with a custom C extension to track changes

How to Apply:  We ask all applicants to participate in a small Coding Challenge before applying. Please go to https://github.com/Marketcircle/backend-software-developer-coding-exerciseand follow the instructions.

Skills & Requirements

You have:

  • a solid understanding of modern backend applications
  • experience with modern API design and ideally know your way around in a web framework such as Ruby on Rails, Django, or Sinatra
  • experience with a either Ruby, Python, or a similar scripting language
  • an appreciation for well written, tested and documented code
  • experience with Linux or a BSD
  • experience with Git and GitHub

Bonus Points for:

  • experience with infrastructure management tools (like Puppet, Ansible or Chef) (we use Ansible)
  • experience with cloud infrastructure providers (like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure or DigitalOcean)
  • knowing your way around the network stack, from HTTP to TCP to IP and have a solid understanding of security (TLS/ IPSec/Firewalls)

About Marketcircle

Why you’ll love working at Marketcircle:

  • Work remotely! No one likes having to battle the GTA traffic during rush-hour on a daily basis, so you don’t have to! 
  • Startup style company. You won’t find any of that corporate BS here!
  • Ownership. We give you the freedom and flexibility to take ownership of your work. In fact, we believe in this so much that its one of our core values. 
  • Learn. We invest in our employees both vertically and horizontally. Want to attend a conference? Great! Want to learn the latest language? We have unlimited Udemy courses. Prefer to learn in a group? Then join the learning curve - our answer to the book club. 
  • Team. Our team is like our second family. And why shouldn’t they be? We work, learn, eat and in some cases even live with each other!

items.title: Software Developer at wyDay (Newburyport, MA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Software Developer

$75k - 80k
wyDay

Job Description

Who we are: wyDay makes 2 big products: LimeLM and wyBuild. LimeLM is a licensing solution for Windows, macOS, and Linux. And wyBuild is an updating and installer solution exclusively for Windows. The languages these products are written in is varied (C/C++ are the biggest languages, C# probably the next biggest, PHP, and then a smattering of other languages depending on the tool, library, or need we have). Check out our website with an overview of the 2 products: https://wyday.com/

What we're looking for: A flexible, focused, creative and smart programmer with a strong sense of motivation. Specifically:

  1. You want to be a full-time employee and you’re comfortable with and efficient at working from home (and preferably has experience with working from home). Our company doesn’t have a centralized office – we might sometime in the future, but we’ll still work around employees that work from home.

  2. You’ll have a place to work consistently Monday – Friday (whether it’s a quiet apartment or a noisy coffee shop) that’s best environment for you to work comfortably and productively.

  3. You can be available by chat/slack/skype during the afternoon time on the East Coast of the U.S. (Note: you don’t necessarily have to live in the East Coast of the U.S.)

  4. You have experience in C/C++ and maybe some other languages (C/C++ is a great basis to learn other languages as you need them). You’ll be working mostly with LimeLM / TurboActivate / TurboFloat and any other spin-off products. So, you’ll primarily be writing in C/C++ and PHP. You’ll also need SQL experience (something that’s learnable on-the-job).

  5. You’re truly a self-starter (meaning we don’t have to feed you tasks to do) with common sense. We’ll have broad checklist of things to do, we’ll have short term goals and longer term goals, and we’ll have things that just need to get done but aren’t necessarily on any checklist. You’re the kind of person that doesn’t need to need to wait for direction, you’ll just move on to the next task at hand.

What’s great about working for wyDay:

  1. You’d have a large amount of latitude about how you choose to solve problems, the tools you use, the tools you create- our culture is flexible and freewheeling but still focused on a great end result.

  2. The code you write will immediately touch millions of end-users world-wide. No more toiling in obscurity, alone and unappreciated.

  3. You can retire your collection of Dockers or uncomfortable high heels. How and where you do your work- and what you wear- is up to you. Forget fancy offices that are designed to seem hip- we don’t make you go to work, we bring work to you.

If this sounds great to you, email us at employment@wyday.com and tell us a bit about yourself (i.e. experience, projects you’re proud of, any open source projects you’ve worked on if applicable, etc.). Please attach your resume so we know you’re real and not a robot or a really-accomplished zombie.

Skills & Requirements

Ability to program productively in at least one high-level c-based language (C, C++, C#, Java) with the ability to learn C/C++. See the job description for all the languages we use and what you would use depending on the things we need to get done.

Also, currently we're only hiring U.S. citizens. This requirement will be dropped in the future, but it's a necessity in the short term.

The Joel Test is a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

items.title: Senior iOS Developer at MultiTracks.com (Austin, TX) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior iOS Developer

$70k - 120k
MultiTracks.com

Job Description

We're looking for an experienced iOS Developer to join our fantastic development team for our MultiTrack app called Playback and some pre-launch products that are going to be exciting to be a part of. Our team is a fun group of highly creative, sharp, and innovative people working on a challenging suite of apps that push the boundaries as we blur the lines of creating, iterating and developing as a team. We're looking for motivated individuals that love to take initiative and write great code that will impact lots of people in meaningful ways.  Find out more about our flagship iOS product Playback.

We are a financially stable and rapidly growing tech company and we genuinely care about the products we build.  We're building an ecosystem of products for live performance that really make a difference in the lives of worship leaders that serve in their local churches. We work with the top record labels and artists in our industry and our website hosts the largest online catalog of Original Artist MultiTracks licensed and distributed to musicians around the world.  Our websites are MultiTracks.com, Secuencias.com and MultiTracks.com.br

items.title: Backend Engineer, Golang at Statement Campus () (allows remote)
items.content:
Backend Engineer, Golang

Statement Campus

Job Description

What you'll do
Your responsibilities will include the continuous development and improvement of the current backend and service architecture of the Statement companies. You will build robust, distributed and scalable products/services/tools written solely in Golang. You will conduct code reviews, write tests, documentation and care about code quality, while also iterating quickly. Researching and remaining up-to-date with the latest technologies will help you to implement scalability and redundancy in all parts of the application.

Skills & Requirements

Who we're looking for

  • Truly exceptional software engineers
  • B.S. or M.S. degree in a technical field such as Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Experience in at least one modern, object-oriented programming language, such as Golang, Java, C++, Python, Ruby, etc.
  • Experience working with distributed systems and Web services
  • Experience with Git and continuous integration, with a passion for benchmarking and optimisation
  • Excellent communication skills in English
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently

About Statement Campus

About Statement Campus
Statement Campus is a software development company bringing together exceptional and international talents to build the future of finance. We are building campuses all over the world which are designed to provide space to think and are intimately integrated within the city centers. Besides the physical campuses, we believe in remote work as the model for the future in regard to working in this globalised world. This position is remote.

Our Technology Stack

  • Java 8 and Go programming language
  • Elastically scalable Microservices
  • Hosted on AWS
  • More than 1 billion API requests
  • More than 100,000,000 new events daily
  • Thousands of concurrent users

What we offer

  • Technology - Only the most cutting-edge technologies are used and we are constantly innovating. Our technical architecture is based on the use of Microservices, a block chain technology, and a proprietary machine learning technology.
  • Remote work - Live and work from wherever makes you the happiest! Do great work from an environment that you are comfortable in.
  • Retreats - We have the legendary Statement retreats multiple times a year where we gather the whole team in a single location.
  • Education - We want you to have every opportunity to stay fresh and up to date on the trends and technologies in our industry. We provide a ‘Techsummit’ quarterly – an exclusive event for all our employees.
  • Self-development - We offer to our employees a clear career chances by offering an experts and manager career path that ensures equal development opportunities.
  • Work / life balance - Work/life balance is important to us, which is why we offer flexible work schedules.
  • Salary - We offer highly competitive salaries. Our salary formula adjusts to your experience and cost of living .
  • Health & Wellness - We provide online consultation with our personal trainer about nutrition and provide personalized workout plans and participation in our online bootcamps.
  • Equipment - We provide a Macbook to do your best work.

items.title: Full Stack Rails & JavaScript Engineer at BackNine Insurance and Financial Services, Inc. (Thousand Oaks, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Full Stack Rails & JavaScript Engineer

$80k - 140k
BackNine Insurance and Financial Services, Inc.

Job Description

Our primary task is furthering the development of Quote & Apply (demo is at http://www.inslock.com). Quote & Apply is a snippet of code that can be inserted into websites which allows that website's users to quote and apply for life insurance. It's the first multi-carrier quoting and eApplication for consumers. A consumer can purchase life insurance online from various insurance carriers without having to speak with an agent. We are distributing it to insurance agents/agencies, financial institutions, and anyone who wants to offer life insurance on their website. Quote & Apply is growing quickly and we want to expand its features and eventually apply it to other lines of insurance.

While we are moving forward with Quote & Apply, you will be making improvements to both Quote & Apply as well as our other product, BOSS. We are looking for someone to take over tasks such as:

  • Phone/technical support (for both internal and external persons)
  • System maintenance
  • Troubleshooting/bug fixing
  • Performance improvements
  • UI/UX
  • Code refactoring/styling
  • Creating and maintaining guides and documentation
  • Creating tests and maintaining our testing suites
  • Code review

This person would be a good developer who cares about their work, is proactive, likes working on both old and new projects, gets along well with others, enjoys a team atmosphere, has great writing skills, is a great communicator, and is able to work at least 30 hours/week.

We are built on:

  • Ruby & Rails 4
  • Heroku & AWS
  • Angular, Node, VueJS, jQuery, & Bootstrap
  • Git and GitHub
  • MySQL & Redis/Sidekiq
  • Lot of great gems

You will join a team of myself (Reid Tattersall - VP/product manager) and our lead developer. Both of us will assign tasks, but overall you will be guided by our lead developer in order to ensure that engineering runs smoothly.

We are open to remote and/or in house with the ability to work remote and then transition to in house. US residents only. Will not respond to recruiters.

The salary range is $41-$50/hour. BackNine provides health, disability, and life insurance.

Skills & Requirements

We are looking for someone who enjoys Ruby and Javascript.  

About BackNine Insurance and Financial Services, Inc.

BackNine helps companies market, sell, and service insurance products.  

BackNine has operated an insurance brokerage since 2001.  In 2013, we started building web applications that overhauled our processes and provided insurance agencies with better tools for their business.  In 2016 we launched Quote & Apply.

items.title: Front End Engineer (Remote - North America) at InFlight Corporation () (allows remote)
items.content:
Front End Engineer (Remote - North America)

$60k - 85k
InFlight Corporation

Job Description

Do you love using the Angular JavaScript framework to build responsive web applications? Do you want to work closey with a team to evaluate emerging technologies for use in solutions that maintain and modernize legacy enterprise applications?

InFlight is looking for a Front End Developer who has a proven ability to create robust, high quality and easily maintainable interfaces and applications. We want a Front End Developer who can build modular, reusable components. This is a role for an individual contributor who can also be a collaborative member of our team.

If this sounds like you, join our rapidly growing company and take your career to the next level.

What we do:

InFlight brings the user experience of aging enterprise applications into the future. We do things with legacy enterprise software that no one thought possible.

Our approach to modernization is so simple, yet so sophisticated, it dissolves all the technical and organizational hurdles that enterprises usually face during IT projects.

We enable blue chip brands to:

  • Enhance online and mobile service delivery to create emotional impact and engagement
  • Step outside disruptive and expensive cycle of software upgrades and migrations
  • Deliver a perpetually fresh user experience for the least cost

InFlight is a small software company that’s been able to transcend the hype usually associated with the industry. We’ve got all the perks and opportunities that start-ups have, plus all the advantages of being an established and profitable business.

What’s in it for you?

  • Make a difference: You will build interfaces that save people time and radically improve the experience they have using their enterprise applications.
  • Impact: InFlight is driving change across multiple industries and affecting the work lives of millions of end-users. Every day you will see the fruits of your labour.
  • Work and learn with the best: You will work alongside a growing team of designers and front-end developers who are talented and passionate about what they do.
  • Career growth: The work you do here will extend and deepen your skills. You will create an impressive portfolio of work that is yours to take.
  • Mentorship: You will be reporting to the Director of Engineering, Eric Hochmeister: https://www.linkedin.com/in/eric-hochmeister-21799ba.

So what do we need? Someone who wants to:

  • Work independently and with members of our engineering, design and accounts teams to build sites, apps and other digital products for our clients.
  • Collaborate with our UI Designer to build solutions that are technically sound.
  • Modernize front end systems to enable rapid UI development and iteration.
  • Push technology forward, challenge established thinking and discover new ways of approaching (and solving) problems.
  • Help scope and estimate work for business development teams.
  • Support current client implementations by fixing UI issues and underlying system integrations.

Skills & Requirements

You may be the person we’re looking for if you have:

  • The education. A university degree or a college diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field.
  • The technical expertise. You have hands-on experience using:
    • Several modern JavaScript frameworks—such as AngularJS, React.js, Backbone.js, jQuery—to architect and develop applications
    • HTTP/RESTful APIs
    • JavaScript unit tests
    • Popular UI libraries such as Bootstrap, Foundation and Semantic-UI to build semantic and responsive web pages
    • Fiddler or other in-browser developer tools to debug cross-browser/platform issues and solutions
  • The beneficial but not essential skills. You have an understanding of or hands-on knowledge of:
    • Windows and ASP.NET environments
    • Backbone.js and React.js
    • Microsoft IIS
    • SharePoint
  • The collaborative skills. You enjoy working closely with back-end developers and UI designers.
  • The passion. You have a true interest in people, solutions and technology. The ability to present a solution that will change the everyday lives of customers is personally and professionally satisfying to you.
  • The drive. You are self-motivated and can work under tight timelines. You are driven to do whatever it takes to exceed customer expectations by delivering easy-to-use solutions with unique user experiences.
  • The desire to be a champion. You want to work with and introduce best practices with a focus on mobile user experience.
  • The communication skills. You can work with internal and external groups at any level, relaying written or oral information in a clear and concise way.

About InFlight Corporation

More about us:

InFlight is a goal-oriented company. It’s not important where or how the work happens, so long as you’re delivering results on time.

We know that the office isn’t for everyone all of the time and encourage people to work from home or remotely. Nearly half of our employees are exclusively remote workers based all over North America.

For roles based near Kitchener-Waterloo—which is the heart of Canada’s Technology Triangle—we offer office space at Workplace One (51 Breithaupt Street, Kitchener), one of Canada’s premier co-working facilities where you will be surrounded by the brightest minds from local start-ups.

This provides our employees with the flexibility to do other things that are important to them—like picking the kids up from school, playing an impromptu round of golf, or going skiing when the snow is just right.

What’s the culture like at InFlight?

At InFlight every employee is asked to step up and lead by example.

Every day our employees are challenged to be at their best and to inspire their colleagues through their dedication to the common goal of becoming the number one modernization platform for enterprise systems.

We show grit and pursue our work with the determination to succeed while still having the humility to think of others before ourselves and put their needs first, whether they are a customer, a co-worker, a partner or a supplier.

InFlight employees are masters of their respective crafts who stubbornly pursue better solutions and continually raise the bar on performance and quality to stay ahead of customer needs. As a result, our work sets the standard by which other solutions are measured.

Does this sound good? Apply now.

Do you feel like we just described who you are and what excites and inspires you? You should probably apply now, because we want to talk to you too.

If it’s not for you but you know someone this would be perfect for, please pass it along or refer him or her.

You can stay on top of what’s new at InFlight by following us on LinkedIn or Twitter (@inflightcorp) or visit us at http://www.inflightintegration.com.

InFlight welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

items.title: Software Engineer at GLOBO (Wyncote, PA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Software Engineer

GLOBO

Job Description

About the Role:

When you're considering a career move, make sure you're focusing on the right things - the long-term objectives. While understanding the short term goals is important, the really meaningful aspects become evident when you look beyond the first year.  

A great example is our Software Engineer role. Beyond the first year you'll dig deep in a variety of technical areas, building innovative products that will revolutionize Translation Services. This path keeps you connected to the development work you love; you'll be able to hone your skills, work with a top-notch team, and build amazing technology (voice, video, chat, mobile, device, etc.). 

If you like this idea; here are some of the near term goals. 

As a Software Engineer reporting to our VP of Engineering you will integrate core technical aspects in the growth of GLOBO. This includes working closely with our internal development team to build/ modify features with a focus on stable scalability. Another is working on new product development to explore the ways GLOBO can innovate in the areas of product and service delivery.

About You:

You're a true technologist and an advocate for great engineering practices. Solving complex problems and building products that serve a valuable function in society gets you up in the morning. You like working with a smart team and enjoy collaborating with like-minded people to build truly useful technology. 

Stepping into this role, you'll leverage your 3+ years of software development experience to develop creative solutions to the task at hand, implement unit and integration testing, code reviews, stress testing etc. We believe that a skilled open-source polyglot, who's a creative problem solver is preferable to an expert in our specific stack. Your expertise lies in the backend, but you know enough to be dangerous across the rest of the stack. 

If you're intrigued, let us know! We'll happily share additional information and see where we can go together.  

Skills & Requirements

To summarize, we've built a high-availability system that enables real-time interpretation through voice, video and chat. On the back-end we provide visualized data that enables users to track changes in their customer base over time, eliminate administrative burden, and better understand their business. Our stack includes the following: 

  • Ruby on Rails 
  • MySQL 
  • AWS
  • Redis 
  • Twilio 
  • Objective-C/Swift
  • Android/Java
  • JavaScript
  • AngularJS

This isn't a comprehensive list and while we don't see any reason in the near term to do any major overhaul, we're always looking for the best tools, methodologies, and ideas. 

About GLOBO

Listed as the fastest growing Inc 5000 company in the Philadelphia market, GLOBO is building a world-class engineering team.  We are a cutting edge technology company and we’re making big moves in the language services space - Our platform, GLOBO HQ, enables real-time connection with best-in-class translation, interpretation, and transcreation services, 24/7 in over 200 languages. 

What’s it like to work here? Well, we’re a close knit team with big ideas and ambitions. We’re entrepreneurial, smart and successful – plus we’re just a lot of fun to work with. Our organization is flat, where everyone is invested in our mission and individuals are recognized for their contributions and achievements. We’re always on the hunt for people who bring energy, ideas, and personality to our growing organization.

items.title: Senior Cloud Engineer at Carbon Black (Waltham, MA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Cloud Engineer

Equity
Carbon Black

Job Description

Waltham,Boston or Remote

Why Carbon Black?

At Carbon Black, you’ll have the opportunity to make a huge impact while working alongside a global community of passionate people who are leading the way in cutting-edge technology. Our valued employees across the world have made Carbon Black a Top Place to Work, as named by the Boston Globe for three consecutive years.

Our Engineering team is moving at lightning speed on the breaking edge of technology. You’ll be pulling things apart and tinkering, building new platforms, or playing in the cloud. Here, the engineering opportunities are endless. With this fast-paced, synergetic group, you’ll be working together and across the organization to ensure customer success all while continuing to build a product that protects their dearest assets.

Why You Matter

There’s incredible excitement and urgency around cyber security software right now. Protecting the world’s Intellectual Property is an imperative and Carbon Black is at the forefront of this market.

We’re looking for a Senior Cloud Engineer who will perform operations and development support for our cloud product line. This individual will work with development and have responsibility for the health of our services.

What You’ll Do

  • Share responsibility for health, scalability and availability of our cloud services
  • Automate deployment of AWS infrastructure and services
  • Select, architect, and implement and maintain monitoring, alerting and reporting
  • Inject and maintain a healthy level of humor within the team
  • Ensure cloud architecture meets scalability, availability and cost requirements
  • Be a mentor to team members on good operational practices

Skills & Requirements

What You’ll Bring

  • B. S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • 2-8 years of experience managing cloud infrastructure, preferably AWS
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience with technical operations and software development
  • Experience with SaaS at scale
  • Experience with configuration management tools and cloud management automation, e.g. Cloud Formation, OpsWorks, Cloudstack EndFragment
  • Solid understanding of containerization services such as Docker or AMI
  • Working knowledge of monitoring such as AWS, Nagios, Logstash, Sensu

About Carbon Black

Who We Are

Carbon Black is the leading provider of next-generation endpoint security. Carbon Black’s Next-Generation Antivirus (NGAV) solution, Cb Defense, leverages breakthrough prevention technology, “Streaming Prevention,” to instantly see and stop cyberattacks before they execute. Cb Defense uniquely combines breakthrough prevention with market-leading detection and response into a single, lightweight agent delivered through the cloud. With more than 7 million endpoints under management, Carbon Black has more than 2,500 customers, including 30 of the Fortune 100. These customers use Carbon Black to replace legacy antivirus, lock down critical systems, hunt threats, and protect their endpoints from the most advanced cyberattacks, including non-malware attacks.

Carbon Black is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Carbon Black is an inclusive employer that believes in workplace equality, supports diversity, creates a welcoming environment, and respects the unique qualities each individual brings to the company.

items.title: iOS Engineer at StatMuse Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)

iOS Engineer

StatMuse Inc.

Are you passionate about cutting-edge voice apps and the future of sports entertainment? Are you an expert in Swift/Obj-C that gets excited about the latest iOS SDK?

items.title: Senior Java Software Engineer-100% Remote at Sonatype (Fulton, MD) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Java Software Engineer-100% Remote

Equity
Sonatype

Job Description

Sonatype has drawn from the global pool of software development talent, with engineering expertise in the Canada, Germany, the United Kingdom, and the United States.  Our product development teams lead the ongoing evolution of multiple market leading products -- Nexus Repository and Nexus Lifecycle -- used by hundreds of thousands of developers, application security professionals and legal staff across the world.

No one is going to tell you when to get up in the morning. Or dole out a bunch of small tasks for you to do every single day. Members of Sonatype's software development organization have to have the internal drive and initiative to make the product vision a reality. Flow should be the predominant state of mind.

We are looking for smart people, who get things done and that work well in a team environment. We have a deeply strong team technically, though many places probably claim this. If you love working on and solving some of the most difficult software engineering challenges, you will love working here

Skills & Requirements

Strong software development expertise in Java is required with experience in JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Ext, AngularJS, nodeJS).  Experience with and/or knowledge of NPM, Elastic Search, Nuget, and Groovy are major pluses.  

The ability to work in a highly distributed Agile environment, leveraging modern collaboration tools to facilitate team communication is critical.   Most importantly, we are looking for extremely smart people that have a bias towards making things happen and love the team sport aspect of product development. 

We are only able to consider candidates for employment who are citizens or permanent residents of the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, and Germany.

About Sonatype

A staggering volume and variety of open source and third-party component parts flow through every software development environment in the world. If properly sourced and managed, these components are a tremendous source of energy for accelerating innovation. If not, they can easily overwhelm your development efforts and lead directlyto security vulnerabilities, licensing risks, and enormous waste. We envisioned a better way to harness the power of open source, and in 2008, started a company to automate the modern software supply chain.

We are Sonatype, and we have assembled a world class team of employees, investors, and partners. We’re proud to be recognized as a Deloitte Technology Fast 500 company for 2016. With more than 100,000 installations and counting, Nexus products are helping modern development organizations intelligently source, manage, assemble, and maintain open source and third-party components, so they can improve the quality, security, and speed of their software supply chains.

We’re curious and we’re constantly innovating without fear of failure. We’re attacking a huge and emerging market and we’re looking for remarkably talented individuals to join us on our journey.

items.title: Junior | Intermediate PHP Developer (PHP | CakePHP | HTML5 | JS) at Allied Health Media () (allows remote)
items.content:
Junior | Intermediate PHP Developer (PHP | CakePHP | HTML5 | JS)

Allied Health Media

Job Description

We are growing! Join our Technology team of 14, and specifically support our lead developer for SimuCase (a division of Allied Health Media, LLC). SimuCase is an innovative technology platform allowing users to assess, diagnose and make recommendations for a library of virtual patients. It encourages critical thinking and facilitates interprofessional education in a no-risk learning environment. (www.simucase.com) 

ABOUT THE TECHNOLOGY TEAM

Our meetings are filled with sarcasm, laughter, and movie quotes. We share code on github whenever able and we try to contribute back to the open source community, on whose shoulders we stand. Though we are virtual, we communicate a lot and have a tight-knit group. We don’t pair most of the time, but we collaborate a fair amount and want to start pairing more. We have worked with the CakeDC core group and keep up to date via continuing education, conferences, etc. Travel is required for an annual company meeting, and may be required once or twice per year for team or project meetings.

ABOUT THE POSITION

We are seeking an innovative and engaged Junior/Intermediate PHP developer who is motivated, creative, and fun to assist in developing our custom CakePHP web applications for SimuCase:

  • Full Time, 8a-5p Mon-Fri in your time zone
  • Work from your home office
  • Company-provided MacBook Pro, Internet stipend, etc
  • Travel is required once or twice per year for team or project meetings
  • Must be located in the U.S. and legally eligible to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Minor and major application feature development for SimuCase platform
  • Assist stakeholders in developing SimuCase feature specifications
  • Plan, code, and deploy new features/applications/projects/modules/plugins
  • Troubleshoot application bugs and determine resolutions
  • Optimize and refactor existing code to improve performance and reliability [http://goo.gl/Kp3W3]
  • Suggest improvements, security needs, best practices, etc (your voice will be heard)

TO APPLY

Submit a cover letter with your resume that includes 1) why you would make a great addition to our team, 2) a link to your favorite movie clip on YouTube, 3) your favorite feature of PHP and what is one thing you wish you could change, and 4) your salary requirements. Submissions without this information will not be considered.

About Allied Health Media

We are fast-paced, nimble, and laugh a lot. We all work from home offices in various locations across the country. We are dynamic, engaged, highly motivated and highly skilled. We are passionate about our work and our professions. For more details see www.alliedhealthmedia.com.

Skills & Requirements

Self-management and time management are critical in this role. Without it, you will not be successful. Other requirements include:

  • 2+ years experience with PHP, CakePHP, HTML5, SASS & CSS
  • A communication pro – must be able to explain technical issues to a non-technical person, pleasantly (we are always on Skype with stakeholders)
  • Highly attentive to details, able to cross all the t's and dot all the i's
  • There is direct project oversight, but you are expected to take ownership of your work and your projects, establish deadlines, and communicate progress proactively
  • Eager to research and learn in a self-directed way (always improving)
  • Easygoing, fun, and a team player – must be able to comprehend highly-advanced forms of sarcasm
  • Working knowledge of xkcd comic strip or similar, is useful -- but not required

We prefer a great/interested/excited programmer with less experience to an unmotivated or unengaged programmer with tons of experience.

About Allied Health Media

A leader in subscription-based online services, Allied Health Media (AHM) is comprised of passionate individuals dedicated to enhancing patient care. AHM is a privately held company currently comprised of: AudiologyOnline, SpeechPathology.com, PhysicalTherapy.com and OccupationalTherapy.com.

items.title: Senior Frontend Engineer at LoveToKnow (Barcelona, Spain) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Frontend Engineer

€30k - 40k
LoveToKnow

Job Description

LoveToKnow, a fast growing online media company, is looking for an experienced Frontend Engineer who loves learning new technologies and is passionate about programming.

You should be an expert web developer and possess a broad knowledge of web development techniques and principles. This is a full time telecommuting position (work from your home office) with flexible working hours. We are looking for an individual who is highly productive at quickly delivering well-implemented, usable solutions. This is a small team, individual contributor role--not a management position.

Your initial task will be to enhance an established PHP website. Future tasks may include developing new, experimental websites and helping to refine and optimize high-traffic, existing websites. You will work with a variety leading-edge technologies and techniques.

LoveToKnow is a digital media company founded by serial entrepreneur, angel investor and author, Howard Love.  LoveToKnow has over 30 million monthly visitors to it's various media properties which include LoveToKnow.com, YourDictionary.com, Trails.com and GolfLink.com.


Advantages of working with LoveToKnow: 

  • Your work will be high impact and high visibility.
  • We have a flat organizational structure and you will work directly with the CTO and product managers.
  • You will be part of a superb team of professionals building one of the fastest growing brand names on the net.
  • You will work from home and hours are flexible.
  • Recognition and rewards for excellent work.

Responsibilities:

  • Full-stack web development, focused more on the frontend, but will also need to work some on the server-side
  • Coordinate with our product, graphic design, and content teams to understand requirements.
  • Deliver excellent user experiences on both mobile and desktop.

Required Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent degree.
  • 2 years minimum work experience:
    • implementing web UIs with CSS3, HTML5, and modern JavaScript
    • developing websites with MVC frameworks like Ruby on Rails, Symfony, Spring, etc.
    • with object-oriented PHP 5+
  • Expert knowledge of CSS and layout techniques including responsive web design, targeting hi-dpi screens, and utilizing vector graphics
  • Page speed optimization
  • Firm understanding and knowledge of object-oriented analysis, design, and programming.
  • Excellent English communication skills - written and oral.
  • History of excellence in school and career
  • Smart, dependable, very organized, detail oriented, high integrity and high energy.
  • Takes ownership, responsible and committed.
  • Displays a positive, can-do attitude and a passion for excellence.
  • Self-starter and ability to navigate projects with limited supervision.
  • Possesses home office environment with development PC and high speed Internet connection.

What's Next:

  • E-mail us your résumé, including work experience and education history, and reference "Senior Frontend Engineer" in the subject line to jobs@lovetoknow.com.
  • Also, please tell us: 1) about yourself; 2) why you think you'd be a good fit for this job; and 3) how best to reach you.
  • Please include links to or samples of prior work and indicate any portions that you did not implement yourself.

About LoveToKnow

LoveToKnow is a digital media company founded by serial entrepreneur, angel investor and author, Howard Love.  LoveToKnow has over 30 million monthly visitors to it's various media properties which include LoveToKnow.com, YourDictionary.com, Trails.com and GolfLink.com.

items.title: Senior/Lead Front-End Javascript Engineer (AngularJS) at Compucorp (London, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior/Lead Front-End Javascript Engineer (AngularJS)

£20k - 30k
Compucorp

Job Description

We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… for Art Galleries, Non-Profits and Charities. 

We’re an innovative bootstrapped startup based in London in the UK. We've grown to over 30 staff in the past 2 years based solely on the quality of the work we’ve been producing for our clients and we’re on the lookout for a talented Senior/Lead Front End Javascript Engineer (Angular JS) to join our team.

We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and a real team mentality. Our work covers web design, app development and branding for Charities, Art Galleries and Non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia, Amnesty and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but we’ve got a long client list that includes other companies, trade associations and government bodies.

Your principle focus will be on developing Angular JS single page applications as part of the CiviCRM and Drupal frameworks for the CiviHR project (https://civihr.org) but there's a lot going on at Compucorp so expect to be exposed to other technologies too! 

CiviHR is an ambitious project to develop a fully featured HR application designed for Non-Profit and Charitable organisations worldwide. It's based on the Drupal and CiviCRM frameworks and has been in development for around 24 months. We recently reached an exciting milestone and opened up for public beta.

We're looking for someone who can join a great team in mid-flight, have instant results and can help us to create a great product for Charities around the world. 

Skills & Requirements

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Expert Angular JS 1 experience
  • Expert Javascript experience
  • Expert JS Unit testing (Karma / Protractor)
  • Comfortable with CSS (Gulp / SASS / LESS)
  • Git experience (You know your submodules from your subtrees!)
  • Confidence in a PHP based environment
  • Confidence in a Linux based environment
  • Previous exposure to Drupal (especially Drupal 7) a plus

What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and most importantly loves a tech challenge. In short, we’re a team of self-confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right and are looking for someone who thinks and acts like us.

About Compucorp

We like to build stuff, sometimes complicated stuff, for people who like to make a difference. We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and a real team mentality. We're passionate about the platforms we work with and the communities which we are part of. Our work covers web design, app development and branding for Art Galleries, Charities and NGO organisations across the country.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer at Emplify (Indianapolis, IN) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer

Equity
Emplify

Job Description

Emplify is the world's leading measurement platform for gathering actionable employee engagement insights. We care deeply about forging stronger relationships between employers and employees. As the world’s leading employee engagement insights solution, Emplify provides companies with a new way to invest in their culture with confidence.

We are looking for Senior Software Engineers to help us create a platform to enable employers to create an environment for employees to become give more open and honest feedback to their employer. We believe the nature of work is changing and your effort will impact the way people view employment.

A Day In The Life

  • Start your day whenever is best for you
  • Grab a cup of coffee and trail mix then get settled at your desk
  • Meet with your product owner to work out the kinks in a design
  • Send a few messages back and forth with a backend engineer discussing potential changes to an endpoint
  • Fling a few nerf darts or share some laughs on Slack
  • Uninterrupted coding for a few hours
  • Stop for our stand up meeting
  • Review code of your peers

Skills & Requirements

What we look for

  • Smart people, with an unquenchable thirst to learn
  • You can recognize when to build it yourself versus leveraging existing frameworks and solutions.
  • You seek out and solve the big, hairy, audacious problems
  • You have a desire to work with a very modern tech stack (react-native, react, Sass & node)
  • Ability and passion to mentor junior engineers
  • Passion for learning new technologies and ideally write some code outside of work from time to time with an active presence on GitHub
  • You enjoy working in small, agile and somewhat distributed dev teams
  • Contributions to the open source community might make you extraordinary

About Emplify

Benefits 

The opportunity to change how employers engage their employees and make work more than just collecting a paycheck

The hardware and software necessary to do your job

The ability to work from wherever you are most productive

Catered lunch every Thursday

We believe rest Is necessary for excellence and trust our team to self manage PTO

We believe in celebrating wins & having transparency

Based in Fishers, IN with a rapidly-growing team of 50 employees, Emplify strives to be an employer of choice for people-focused, mobile-savvy professionals. Emplify helps customers like the NFL Trust, Medxcel Facilities Management,R.T. Moore, and Which Wich measure and improve their current levels of employee engagement.
