items.title: Senior Software Engineer--Python @ ThreatConnect
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer--Python @ ThreatConnect

2017-04-30 00:35

Description

Company Description

ThreatConnect, Inc. is the leading provider of advanced threat intelligence products and services including ThreatConnect®, the most comprehensive Threat Intelligence Platform (TIP) on the market. ThreatConnect delivers a single platform in the cloud and on-premises to effectively aggregate, analyze, and act to counter sophisticated cyber-attacks. Leveraging advanced analytics capabilities ThreatConnect offers a superior understanding of relevant cyber threats to business operations. To register for a free ThreatConnect account, or to learn more about our products and services, visit: www.threatconnect.com.

LOCATION IS FLEXIBLE. Strongly prefer East Coast.

Job Description

Want to build something fun? Us too. Our ideal team member would be able to work remotely, with no in-office supervision, and work closely with our development and engineering teams to manage development and releases for ThreatConnect. If you want to be a part of a smart and savvy team that builds a platform for Fortune 500 companies and government agencies, then check us out. We are looking for leaders to take our team to the next level.

We are seeking self-motivated engineers who can positively answer the following:

  • Do you get excited about challenging technical issues?
  • Do you want to work in a fast, growing, dynamic, startup environment?
  • Do you find yourself looking for solutions to near impossible challenges?
  • Do you enjoy being part of a talented Engineering team?
  • Do you work well as part of a remote team?

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Develop data integrations using ThreatConnect SDK’s
  • Be proactive, self-motivated, willing to learn and attentive to detail
  • Analyze and recommend technologies, solutions, toolkits, etc.
  • Verify, debug, and fix product defects
  • Provide leadership by driving features from design to release
  • Database, code, and system architecture and design
  • Provide remote customer support as needed
  • Assist with creation of product manuals and documentation
  • Ability to whiteboard and discuss ideas/concepts/process flows

Qualifications

  • 5+ years professional experience in Python development
  • RESTful API experience
  • SQL and NoSQL database experience
  • Experience with Java, JavaScript is a strong plus
  • Must possess effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Knowledge and understanding of threat intelligence analysis is a plus
  • Legally authorized to work in the United States (without sponsorship)

Additional Information

ThreatConnect offers a positive, collaborative culture and comprehensive, fully-paid benefits, as well as unique incentives and perks that encourage you to become an integral part of our success!

Meeting business requirements is always a top priority, but improving our abilities is just as important. We set aside time to foster a positive learning environment that further develops new skills, and we continually encourage team members to explore ideas & solutions that improve efficiency.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Country

United States

Location

LOCATION IS FLEXIBLE. Strongly prefer East Coast.

items.title: Ruby on Rails Developer (Part-Time) @ Paved
items.content:
Ruby on Rails Developer (Part-Time) @ Paved

2017-04-19 02:19

Description

DESCRIPTION

Paved, headquartered in New York City, matches engaged newsletter audiences with relevant advertisers. We have some of the largest brands in the world using our platform to reach targeted audiences.

We are looking for an entrepreneurial, smart, ambitious Full Stack Developer with a passion for pixel perfect front end code, to help add new features and grow our platform.

As an early member of the team you will have a direct and immediate influence on the technology choices, data architecture, and scalability of the platform. You will be building on a strong foundation - our total audience size is now over 70 million and we have enabled our advertisers to reach millions of people.

The ideal candidate is motivated by delivering high quality experiences, can work supremely well in a team context but can also function with some ambiguity, and cares a lot about learning, growth, and moving the needle.

You will be joining a fully remote team, so strong written communication skills and self-motivation are a must, as is the desire to continually improve our development processes.

REQUIREMENTS

items.title: Senior Full Stack Architect @ Modus Create
items.content:
Senior Full Stack Architect @ Modus Create

2017-04-13 07:15

Description

Are you ready to build great mobile and web-based applications and lead global teams with some of the brightest thought leaders, designers and technologists?

As a Sr. Full Stack Solutions Architect, whether you are faced with a brand new system with a full galaxy of choices to make about server stacks, front end frameworks and supporting tools, or you have to assess a project with 10 years of technical debt, connections to legacy systems and a nasty performance cliff that has to be solved, you have the chops to figure it out and help the team find a way to succeed.

A good Full Stack Solutions Architect will have had exposure to a broad variety of front end and back end frameworks and multiple software ecosystems and will be able to explain patiently to clients and prospects about where the source of their pain may originate: anything from the network, database, back end, middleware, API, or front end - to the human factors that influence an application’s success or failure. Whether you’re consulting across multiple projects and teams or rolling up your sleeves to dig into code on just one, your flexibility makes all the difference.

We’re looking for candidates with experience in the following areas:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related Engineering discipline or equivalent professional experience
  • 8-12 years of progressive experience in designing, building and maintaining software systems
  • Multiple operating system families and environments (Mac OS, Linux, Windows, Android, iOS, for example)
  • Wide variety of computer languages, including at least one from each of these buckets - Java, C#, C, C++, Objective C, Swift, Rust - Python, Ruby, Bash, Perl - JavaScript, TypeScript, Dart, Scheme, LISP, Haskell - SQL, GraphQL, NoSQL queries, Lucene queries
  • Designing and implementing APIs for systems, with both RESTful styles of communication and other legacy approaches (e.g. SOAP)
  • Track record of writing responses to requests for proposals (RFPs) and writing original proposals that win consulting work
  • Software estimation skills, including Agile estimation with Story Points and Scrum planning experience.
  • Agile team leadership and leading by example in mixed teams of clients and consulting staff

Highly qualified candidates will also have:

  • An advanced degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, a related field, or equivalent experience
  • Used software configuration management frameworks (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, or Salt) to configure both individual servers and fleets of machines
  • Entrepreneurial experience or experience as a lead consultant opening new client engagements
  • Hands-on experience developing native or hybrid HTML applications on iOS, Android, or other mobile platforms
  • Multiple publication credits in peer-reviewed scientific and technical journals or in technology industry publications
  • Designed and taught classes in an area of technical expertise
  • Active participation in the world wide development community, such as Open Source Software commits and social media involvement (Stack Overflow, programming language/ framework forums, Meetup groups, blogging, Twitter)

Let’s Talk about You

You value outcomes above all else: You have a proven track record shipping great mobile and web products. By understanding the big picture, you articulate strategy and vision with strong written and verbal communication.

You Lead by Doing: You realize that the big picture is worthless without getting your hands dirty in the technical details for strategic and tactical problem solving. You understand the value of situational leadership and can adapt to the needs and strength of your team.

You Love Work, Growth and Learning: You dream of working in a culture that values hard work, continued learning and innovation with a commitment to building amazing products for clients and their end users. You’ll stop learning when you are dead, and until then you desire to gain deeper knowledge in technology and business.

Let’s Talk About Us

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 60 people in 10 countries in 5 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

The perks:

  • Competitive compensation
  • 100% paid full family health insurance coverage, 401k and other benefits
  • Ability to work remotely
  • The best equipment and software necessary to get the job done
  • Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
  • Fun company sponsored events and activities to connect with team members
  • Ability to travel occasionally

Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech startup? Let’s start a conversation.

Country

United States

Location

Incumbent should be authorized to work within the United States

items.title: Front-End (React) Software Engineer @ StackShare
items.content:
Front-End (React) Software Engineer @ StackShare

2017-04-05 03:08

Description

STACKSHARE:

StackShare is a community that helps developers and engineers discover and compare software tools. Our vision is to transform how SaaS tools and infrastructure are bought and sold.

Choosing SaaS and cloud infrastructure tools is difficult. If you’re a developer looking for a hosting solution, you have hundreds of options and no clear way to sift through them all. We’ve built a community of developers, engineers, CTOs, and VPEs that recommend, review, and share their technology stacks. They have significant buying power and a need for tooling and infrastructure services, from startups to large enterprises. The options they have are confusing and increasing in number by the day - they’re desperate to get help choosing the right solutions. StackShare lets technologists see all the best tools and services, who’s using them, and why.

OUR TEAM:

We’re a small distributed team of five, with our main office in San Francisco, CA. We believe every member of the team should own the products they build and have a say in what gets built.

Our CEO, Yonas has seen Fortune 500 companies use Gartner PDF reports to make software buying decisions when he worked at Accenture; he’s also seen startups make these decisions after joining a YC-backed startup, where he worked on product design and marketing. Yonas then took StackShare through the 500 Startups accelerator and has been leading our growth and marketing efforts. You'll be working directly with Yonas on a daily basis as part of your role.

The rest of our team comes from companies like Digital Ocean and Citrix.

YOU:

As Front-End Engineer, you will influence everything you see on StackShare. You'll help to shape how hundreds of thousands, and eventually millions of developers and engineers build software.

You have experience building web applications with at least two years of experience using Rails in a production environment, and at least two years using a JavaScript MVC framework (React experience is a major plus). You have experience building APIs. You hate bureaucracies and want to work at an early stage company that has very little processes. You’re comfortable taking the initiative and just building products that you want to use. As an engineer, you should love using StackShare and if you don’t, you should be excited about making it better.

You’re comfortable working on something different every day as priorities shift. You view engineering as your strongest skill but you're open to doing whatever the company needs including blog posts, customer support, and email copy. You enjoy shipping code and you believe every new feature should be treated as an experiment and measured closely, and you have the experience to prove it. You build with the following in mind: make it work ➤ make it right ➤ make it fast.

Bonus Points:

  • You’ve got a good eye for design and UX.
  • You’re a StackShare user (include your profile URL in your application).
  • You’re familiar with almost every tool and service in StackShare’s stack (http://stackshare.io/stackshare).
  • You’re a tools geek; you sign up for new tools and services just to kick the tires and satisfy your curiosity.

Country

United States

items.title: Full Time: Healthcare-Improving Full Stack Engineer at PolicyStat in Indianapolis, Vancouver, or Remote
items.content:
Make An Impact On Healthcare

More than 250,000 Americans died last year as a result of medical error1. Sadly, many of these deaths could have been prevented with existing best practices for quality and patient safety. A hospital’s best tool for standardizing and implementing these life-saving improvements are their written policies and procedures.

PolicyStat’s mission is to improve healthcare delivery by making those policies and procedures easier to find, access, and enhance. Our clients (across 46/50 states) use our SaaS application to ensure that this critical information is correct, their staff can find it, and that it supports regulatory compliance.

You deserve an environment with clear goals, problems that are meaningful and challenging, the autonomy necessary for creativity, and the support/resources necessary to make a dent in the universe. We want to provide you with that environment so that together, we can improve healthcare.

Help Us Collaborate Towards Awesome

In this role as our 5th engineer, an experienced software engineering generalist, you will be a critical part of our product team. You will spend time on all aspects related to delivering a great web application to our users. We're a small team, so you'll sometimes be asked to wear hats ranging from API design to algorithms and libraries to front-end engineering. We’ve recently been freed from the tyranny of supporting Old IE, and we’re excited for the opportunity to improve interaction for the hundreds of thousands of people that rely on PolicyStat.

Our Development Culture

Our current technology stack and toolkit is focused around Django, Python, Javascript, GitHub, Vagrant and Trello. We use TDD, 100% code review, pair programming, Kanban (not sprints), monthly OKRs, and continuous delivery to manage our development process. We're jumping on the React + GraphQL bandwagon and testing the #serverless waters with Zappa. We really enjoy building things for people, so we deploy to production multiple times per day (~650 times in 2016). We're committed to contributing back to open source as both the right thing to do and the best way to do business.

We get excited about continual process improvement and helping each other become better engineers.

Totally Strict Job Requirements

There are none, though The Perfect Candidate™ will have:

  • Experience building real web applications for real people using a web framework like Django or Rails
  • Experience using React, Redux, and ES6
  • A passion for the craft of creating beautiful code
  • An understanding of the trade-offs involved with TDD and pairing
  • A GitHub profile with lots of code and experience contributing to open source projects
  • An innate hunger for information on the web, software engineering, and entrepreneurship

About PolicyStat

PolicyStat is a rapidly-growing SaaS company (~50% annual growth over the last 6 years) with a product our clients love (>99% renewal rate). Our company has been named one of the Best Places to Work in Indiana for the past 3 years and we’re on the INC 5000 list of America’s fastest-growing private companies.

This is a full-time, permanent position. We pay market rate, provide full benefits, equity, flexible hours/PTO, conference/travel budget, and excellent hardware/tools.

We welcome candidates of all genders, creeds, races, and sexual orientations!

Our collaborative professional development tools provide growth opportunities for educators that are rooted in discussion and creative, critical thinking.  You will help build innovative new features to provide our users the tools to develop their skills and collaborate with others in their field.Our team is extremely collaborative and supportive; we help each other to do our best work. As a talented and experienced software developer, youÃ¢Â Â d plug into the team and find a place to grow and learn, and help teach others so we can all continue to deliver functional and engaging software for our users.__You:__* Collaborate well with others, and generally say "We" instead of "I"* Effectively review code and enjoy the process of others reviewing yours* Strive to improve your coding practices and those of your team* Proactively chip away at technical debt, and identify opportunities for infrastructural improvements* Feel pain when repetitive tasks aren't automated* Are passionate about new technologies in software development* Manage your time effectively, and recognize the line the denotes "good enough"* Passionate about empowering teachers__Technical skills:__* 2-3+ years of Rails experience* Creation and consumption of JSON APIs* Database systems (Postgres or MySQL) and strong grasp of SQL* HTML/CSS* JavaScript/ES6 and node__Nice to have:__* Experience with Javascript client side frameworks (Angular / React / Backbone / Ember)* Mobile application design or development experience* Interest or experience with Analytics* Experience with Redis / RabbitMQ / ZeroMQ / SNS* Experience with asynchronous systems: WebSockets, Sidekiq, Eventmachine, Celluloid* Devops experience (Ansible / Puppet / Chef / Terraform)* Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS / Rackspace / Linode / Heroku)__Education & Experience__* Minimum 3-4 years of relevant professional experience* BachelorÃ¢Â Â s degree in a relevant field or equivalent demonstrable experience

items.title: Mobile Cross Platform Developer
items.content: __Job Duties:__Develop new iOS and Android applications, and update existing applications; Build iOS and Android libraries that can be shared across applications; Take responsibility for the development and delivery of a portion or the entirety of both iOS and Android development projects including architecting, coding and unit testing specific requirements as determined by the project team; Write high quality code, ensuring excellence with unit tests when appropriate; Create internal builds of applications and submit them to the client for review; Conduct code reviews to ensure compliance with Black PixelÃ¢Â Â s quality standards; Participate in mentoring other developers; Work in an Agile-like iterative development process; Collaborate with designers, testers, project and product managers and project sponsors; and Communicate and report tasking estimation and progress regularly to a project manager through appropriate tools.__Minimum Requirements:__BachelorÃ¢Â Â s Degree in Computer Science or a Related degree plus 4 years experience. Employer will also accept six years experience as equivalent to a BachelorÃ¢Â Â s Degree plus four years experience.   __Special Requirements:__Must have 4 years of professional iOS or Android software development experience and a demonstrated ability to deliver applications to the App Store and Android Apps to Google Play. Full proficiency with Java 6 and 7 plus professional experience developing Android Apps using Android Studio. Full proficiency with Swift and Cocoa Touch, plus a solid understanding of Objective-C. Experience with adaptable layouts, including an extensive use of Auto Layout in both code and Interface builder. Experience with multiple Apple frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, Core Graphics, Core Text, Core Audio and Spritekit. Solid understanding of memory management in a garbage collected environment. Experience with Dependency injection libraries including Dagger 1, Google Guice and Dagger 2. Experience with REST APIs, Apache Libraries and Volley/Retrofit frameworks. Experience with UI Widgets including Android Views and Butterknife. Experience with image loading libraries including Android Bitmaps and Picasso. Experience with networking libraries and Frameworks including Apache HTTP Libraries and OKHttp. Experience with Gradle Build System._Remote employment/telecommuting permitted. Employee must be able to work during North American Pacific time zone business hours._

items.title: Sr. Rails & Front End Developer [React.js / D3.js]
items.content:
Are you an Engineer looking to revolutionize the way people innovate and build software? Do you want to create something that will change the way people think about innovation, and work with cutting-edge visualization, collaboration, and social ideation technologies at the same time? We are looking for highly ambitious engineers who want to work on major aspects of the Aha! product Ã¢Â Â from the back-end through to the end user experience. If this is you, we want to hear from you!

As a Senior Rails Engineer, you will have an excellent opportunity to join a breakthrough and profitable company that is growing fast. Aha! was founded by a proven team of Silicon Valley veterans whose last two companies were acquired by well-known public companies. More than 100,000 users trust Aha! to link their brilliant strategy to their team's work and create visual roadmaps.

We're looking for someone who:
  • Is experienced in Ruby-on-Rails and Javascript
  • Has worked on key functionality for a cloud-based product
  • Wants to work on a major aspect of product functionality from back-end algorithms through to the user interface
  • Wants to be great and work in a fast-moving, online environment where the end-user is king

We are committed to being great, and we want someone who:
  • Can work at a fast-paced company where the feedback cycle is measured in hours rather than weeks
  • Has a 'get it done' attitude and a background of delivering superb work again and again
  • Is seeking a career-defining opportunity and a proven, results-oriented team that has sold multiple software companies

We are building a distributed team and you can work from anywhere in the North America for this role. We offer generous salary, equity, benefits, and a profit sharing program to the right candidates.

For immediate consideration, please follow these helpful guidelines and contact us at Engineering-jobs@aha.io.

To apply: Please send a resume with a link to your GitHub and LinkedIn profile to Engineering-jobs@aha.io. If you are interested in sharing, we love to hear about what you have been working on recently. If you have the right background we will quickly follow up with you. We are not working with recruiters or third party agencies.

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
Are you a talented and creative developer? Are you always searching for the latest most exciting technologies? Are you driven by creating great code, that makes users happy?

Do you want great challenges, an exciting team to work with, opportunities to see your ideas come to life, and the flexibility of working remotely?


Well read on.

Who is Elucidat?


Were a fast growing Learning Technology startup which is quickly becoming known as a leader in its field - but dont just take our word for it!


Elucidat is globally recognised as a leading elearning authoring tool by winning a Brandon Hall Gold Award for Best Advance in Content Authoring Technology


We have clients all over the world including Tesco, Auchan, Renault, Nissan, Comcast, Johnson & Johnson and many more.


Elucidat is a very modern business, offering a flexible working environment such as flexible working hours and location. We have a fun culture and are willing to take risks in an industry that is traditionally conservative (where few Learning Technology products really stand out).



Benefits


What will the work be like?

  • You get to work from wherever you are most effective. Our team members get to choose the best location for them.
  • Well help get your home office setup, or contribute to coworking space costs
  • We work around childcare commitments - so whatever times of day are best for you
  • We are on Slack constantly, so you will always see, and chat with your team - so youll never get lonely
  • Youll work directly with the dev team lead, so will have real influence on how we proceed
  • Well work at least one day a week at HQ in Brighton, East Sussex, to plan and go over the weeks work, and we meet once a month for a drink and to chew the cud
  • Free day off on your Birthday
  • Great startup culture, no stuffy corporate rules here
  • Inspiring work, make a difference

items.title: PHP Developer
items.content:
This is a long term (3 months to 1 year) contract for 40 hours/week work. The candidates must be able to invoice for their work.


The chosen freelancer will be requested to work in close collaboration with the project team, aka in european working hours. 


As a PHP Developer, you will be working on the conception and rollout of a brand new version of Greenpeace flagship websites based on the Wordpress CMS. You will also be developing, review, testing and deployment of websites, themes and plugins, as well as supporting end users and resolve bugs.


Your main responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:



  • Writing well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices;

  • Integrating data from various back-end services and databases;

  • Developing enhancements and resolve bugs as part of the product release lifecycle;

  • Designing, developing and testing ETL / integration scripts to allow data migration and integration with other CMS and CRM systems;

  • Performing code review of 3rd party developed themes and plugins, make recommendation about possible performance and security improvements;

  • Identifying performance bottlenecks, propose and implement solutions;

  • Participating in the design of new feature and change requests and discuss technical feasibility;

  • Writing technical specifications and documentation to facilitate development and maintenance of the platform;

  • Cooperating with web designers to match visual design intent;

  • Creating, deploying and maintaining automation tools to streamline development, testing, deployment and monitoring processes;

  • Writing functional and unit tests in order to facilitate user acceptance testing and prevent regressions;

  • Releasing code to the staging and production environments;

  • Assisting end user technical questions and troubleshooting new issues;

  • Staying abreast of latest technologies/industry trends and proposing new ideas to enhance usability and performance.

  • Once or twice per year, play board games with your team members when you meet face to face

items.title: Developer

Development

Leadership and Collaboration

Serve clients as a single point of contact throughout the sales cycle (from lead generation through contract renegotiation)

items.title: Senior Software Engineer - Ruby
items.content:
Who are we?
At Spreemo Health we believe that advanced data science can prevent serious misdiagnoses and poor outcomes. Using that approach, Spreemo Health has helped tens of thousands of injured employees at Fortune 500 companies recover better, faster, and more affordably, fueling our rapid ascent as one of the 100 fastest-growing tech companies in North America. When you join Spreemo Health you will see first-hand how we prioritize a diverse workforce -- diversity is in our DNA. Join the brightest minds in medicine, technology, and venture investing in our fight to democratize access to high-quality, cost-efficient care.

Who you are:
WeÃ¢Â Â re looking for engineers who empathize with the end-users of our products, care about making the world a better place, and want to be surrounded by people by other like minded individuals. We also expect you to care equally as much about honing your craft, always seeking to learn new and better ways of building and testing features that make a difference. YouÃ¢Â Â ll be responsible for spearheading the development of user interfaces, business logic, and full-stack integrations within the web app through which our customers refer injured employees.

In particular, you'll have:

  • A strong enough grasp of both Ruby itself, as well as the Rails framework, that you can help with code reviews and mentor Associate Software Engineers
  • Experience excelling in a distributed team environment
  • Outstanding communication skills. You can clearly share ideas with people across a myriad of mediums.
  • Experience building features that matter in an agile development environment
  • YouÃ¢Â Â ve talked to stakeholders to tease out requirements. YouÃ¢Â Â ve written first drafts of code on your own, and made them better with feedback from your teammates. You write elegant, correct, fast, and highly testable code
  • Well-founded opinions that can be verbalized, and yet are able to change your mind based on new information
  • Strong sense of ownership and accountability. We care about results, not who does the work. We are a lean startup. Sometimes we need to get things done, no matter who does it/helps out.


You may also have:

  • Experience with Amazon Web Services and Docker
  • A thorough understanding of full-stack security
  • A background in healthcare or financial services engineering


What it's like to be on the team:

  • The majority of the engineering department is remote; over half the engineering leadership is remote -- WE Ã¢Â Â GETÃ¢Â Â REMOTE!!!
  • We come to work each day and actually fix healthcare by democratizing access to high-quality, cost-efficient care
  • We move quickly in innovative, independent teams that build features that matter
  • WeÃ¢Â Â re obsessed with testing and code quality - we care about our systems, users, and patients!
  • We are always learning, teaching, and growing
  • We embrace failure, making sure we take risks and learn from our mistakes
  • We have a culture of trust, continual improvement, and mutual support
  • A few times a year, we get the whole engineering team together for a few days of workshops, lightning talks, urban adventures, and an epic hackathon.

Benefits:
Our Software Engineers are full-time employees, with a competitive salary, as well as stock options and great benefits. Benefits include: 401K, medical, dental & vision insurance, FSA, pre-tax commuter benefits, lots of paid time off and flexible hours.

To apply: Apply online at: https://jobs.lever.co/spreemo.com/f9ccce00-3ec1-4689-b488-58daf67b8a7b

items.title: Senior Front End Developer (React, Redux)
items.content:
WeÃ¢Â Â re looking for a full-time front end developer to help create a brand new product from the MeetEdgar team. When we boot-strapped Edgar in mid-2014 it quickly became profitable and now has 1000s of happy, beautiful, paying customers. We want your help to do it all over again.

ItÃ¢Â Â s a greenfield project (yay!), so youÃ¢Â Â ll be instrumental in making the technical decisions of how it all comes together, working in a pure React/Redux environment.

YouÃ¢Â Â ll be joining a small team of talented developers, and working alongside dedicated UX designers, QA and Customer Experience pros.

Our stack is a React/Redux front end, consuming an Elixir/Phoenix back end hosted on Google Cloud. ItÃ¢Â Â s great stack to work with everyday, and we take our time to write solid code and proper tests to make sure it stays that way.

Dev Process
We do a fair amount of pair programming and a lot of code reviews, we love solid tests and continuous integration, and we deploy several times a week. Basically? WeÃ¢Â Â re constantly improving our process so we can create an ideal developer environment - low overheads, high transparency. Estimates were inaccurate and irrelevant, so we dropped Ã¢Â Â em. Artificial deadlines werenÃ¢Â Â t doing it for us, so we switched from scrum to pure kanban and never looked back. When something isnÃ¢Â Â t working, weÃ¢Â Â re not afraid to throw it out and try something new - so if you have exciting ideas about the dev process and how to make your own job even better, youÃ¢Â Â ll fit right in. (WeÃ¢Â Â re open-minded like that.)

YouÃ¢Â Â ll have final responsibility for the solutions you build, from inception all the way through to deployment, so your teammates know exactly who to shower with praise when you ship to production.

About Us
WeÃ¢Â Â re a small team of about 30 people, all working remotely across the US & Canada. We do a lot of collaborating and meme-swapping on Slack, along with virtual team meetings and super-futuristic video calls. We also do a twice-annual meetup week where we work together on cool projects all day and generally make fools of ourselves all night. WeÃ¢Â Â re proudly bootstrapped and profitable, which means we get to turn down VC money a lot and keep doing things the way we like. WeÃ¢Â Â re pretty serious about building and maintaining an awesome, positive company culture, so, you know, no jerks.

We'll probably get along if youÃ¢Â Â re someone who wants to be creative, have a pretty-serious-but-not-inhuman amount of responsibility, and work with people who make going to work not suck. (And be one of those people yourself. We like those people.)

We know weÃ¢Â Â re ridiculously lucky to have this crack squad of ambitious, kind, independent little nerds, and we want to keep that going by bringing in even more people who love geeking out about what they do and doing work theyÃ¢Â Â ll be super proud of. (And on that note, weÃ¢Â Â re an equal-opportunity employer genuinely committed to building a diverse team, and to fostering the type of inclusive environment in which diversity thrives.)

You can find out more at http://meetedgar.com/careers/

Requirements
  • Senior level developer w/ at least 3 years experience
  • YouÃ¢Â Â ve got real professional experience with React + Redux, and ES6 is a big plus
  • You know how to consume a REST API
  • Experience creating single page applications
  • Startup or 'greenfield' experience is a big plus
  • Live anywhere in the USA or Canada (must be able to provide documentation of eligibility to work in the USA)
  • You love JS and React
  • You know how to communicate effectively and work as part of a team trying to build something great
  • Passionate about improving the dev process and recognize the value of an awesome company culture
  • Not a jerk

Perks & Benefits
  • Work from home (or wherever thereÃ¢Â Â s strong wifi)
  • 4 weeks paid vacation (Shazam! And yes, everyone actually uses all 4 weeks)
  • Monthly cleaning service for your home - not that we don't have total faith in you
  • Paid home Internet service
  • Coworking space/coffee shop working expenses
  • Health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your fam
  • 401(k) plan with employer match
  • An extra paid day off per quarter so you can volunteer in your community (awww)
  • New Mac laptop (#blessed)
  • Books, conferences, and other educational resources to help you be even more amazing at what you do!
  • TSA pre-check to make getting to retreats and conferences a breeze (optional)

Check Ã¢Â Â em out in even more detail here (you know youÃ¢Â Â re curious):
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1txOs5h-ZjbOqMW-GxmJcKnCClKK3yVqOWO0hhHBAbT0/edit

To apply: Apply at https://meetedgar.com/careers/

items.title: Full-stack Web Developer
items.content:
Hello -_-v.

To begin, make sure to read our jobs page about who we are and what it's like to work with us: https://lookback.io/jobs/

WeÃ¢Â Â re looking to expand our distributed team with a skilled, experienced full-stack web developer. Someone who loves building great user experiences, innovative and reliable products as well as working with real-time media streaming. WeÃ¢Â Â re looking for you whoÃ¢Â Â s excited about the opportunity to work in a remote team and to build a product for some of the worldÃ¢Â Â s most impactful tech companies (Facebook, Netflix, Spotify and thousands of others). Ideally, youÃ¢Â Â ve built many UIs, used many of the web frontend frameworks, but your focus is backend and making things work extremely well (without losing elegance or speed of innovation).

Ideal set of experiences

  • YouÃ¢Â Â ve worked with building and maintaining large web apps in Meteor, React, Node.js, MongoDB or similar stacks for many years, preferably for a startup.
  • YouÃ¢Â Â ve worked with WebRTC and real-time media streaming, mobile streaming and peer to peer.
  • YouÃ¢Â Â ve got DevOps experience and have managed larger web services and REST APIs in production.
  • You've been part of a fully distributed startup team in the past, preferably from the early days all the way through to becoming a larger company.
  • YouÃ¢Â Â re a vim user and prefer Spotify over any other music service (nah just kidding... or are we!?).

In terms of characteristics, we think you are something like this:

  • YouÃ¢Â Â re excited about Lookback's mission of using technology to create more empathy.
  • YouÃ¢Â Â ve got strong verbal and non-verbal communication skills (we do a lot of text communication).
  • YouÃ¢Â Â re humble, you like personal growth, and you listen well.
  • You choose a positive outlook on life.
  • YouÃ¢Â Â re self-organized and driven.
  • You love traveling and are excited about LookbackÃ¢Â Â s quarterly offsites.
  • You believe technology has the ability to be a great force of good for humanity, and want to contribute to that movement.
  • You value introspection and emotions, and are striving to become more aware of the emotions of yourself and those around you.
  • You thrive in small teams with a lot of collaboration.

More about Lookback, the role, and compensation:

  • This is a full-time position, working from U.S or European timezones. If youÃ¢Â Â re in EU, weÃ¢Â Â d ask of you to work later in the day a few days per week, to overlap more with the U.S.
  • YouÃ¢Â Â d be working primarily with LookbackÃ¢Â Â s Live technology (https://lookback.io/live) and maintaining and scaling our web app as well as various web services.
  • Working at Lookback means a lot of autonomy, and youÃ¢Â Â d have a lot of freedom and influence in terms of tech decisions and choosing the best way forward to get a job done.
  • Our web tech stack consists most of Meteor, some React and raw Node.js APIs. We also work with Sass (in-house), various HTML5 audio/video tech, Ansible, MongoDB, WebSockets, ES6 and some CoffeeScript, as well as various JS testing frameworks, like Mocha and Ava.
  • We offer competitive salary, stock options in a high-growth startup with lots of potential, 30 days of paid time off plus national holidays as well as great insurance for yourself and dependents (U.S only). We also offer paid travel and accommodation for three or more offsites per year (last time we went to Miami Beach

To apply: WeÃ¢Â Â d love to hear from you. To apply, shoot an email to omgworkwithus@lookback.io.

items.title: Infrastructure Engineer

items.title: Senior Ruby Developer
items.content:
Replay Gaming is a UK social gaming company looking for a full-time, senior-level Ruby developer working remotely to help us grow our freemium poker site, Replay Poker (www.replaypoker.com). We have a small team of highly technical and experienced developers geographically distributed working via GitHub and Slack.

The role

You will be part of the core development team working mostly on the Rails application building new features and improving a big codebase. We want you to help build and scale our entire stack to handle our ever-growing number of players.

One of the biggest projects we have is the development of a new poker server and you will be part of the team that will design and build it.

This is not a Ã¢Â Â code-monkeyÃ¢Â Â opening. You should be comfortable designing solutions from top to bottom using the best tools for the job. Although Ruby is our main language, we know of itÃ¢Â Â s trade-offs and expect people that are open-minded and not afraid of learning new ones.

About us

  • We are a growing team, so youÃ¢Â Â ll have a huge impact on the decisions and the work being done
  • We all work remotely, 100% of the time. Work from wherever you are most productive
  • We're currently spread out across North America, South America, Asia and Europe

Our stack

  • Website: Rails 4, a single page application with Backbone.js and a new React front-end in progress
  • Poker server: Ruby multi-threaded TCP server
  • Desktop client: Flash - ActionScript 2.0 (in maintenance mode) and a new HTML5 client in progress
  • Other technologies: MySQL, Sidekiq, Redis/Sentinel, node.js, Go, Kubernetes

You should

  • Be eager to learn and able to express your thoughts, arguments, and ideas clearly and effectively
  • Have good knowledge of Javascript, HTML5 and CSS3
  • Have a good understanding of REST and REST-ful APIs
  • Have experience writing automated tests, be it BDD, TDD, etc
  • Have a good understanding of databases and concepts like transactions, locks, ACID, CAP and eventual consistency
  • Have a good knowledge of threads and parallel programming
  • Be comfortable working with git, code review and pull requests
  • Have 3+ years of Ruby development experience
  • Have expert knowledge of Ruby/Rails and itÃ¢Â Â s surrounding environment
  • Have extensive experience with Linux
  • Have excellent english language skills (fluent speaking)

Ideally you should

  • Have experience with Javascript client-side frameworks like React, Backbone, Ember, etc
  • Have contributed to open source projects
  • Have experience with Docker and Kubernetes
  • Have professional experience working remotely
  • Enjoy playing poker!

What we offer

  • Plenty of autonomy for you to work the way you think you're most productive
  • A flexible process with the focus on efficiency of working with minimal bureaucracy
  • A mixture of a fun and challenging project working on a real-time game
  • Flexible paid holiday (no counting days!)
  • Competitive salary (negotiable and depending on experience/skills)

To apply: Fill out the application form here: https://replaygaming.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0mqpi?source=weworkremotely

items.content:

As a Front-End Developer, you will be responsible for designing, building and maintaining efficient, reusable and reliable front-end code. You will be working on the conception and rollout of a brand new version of Greenpeace’ flagship website based on the Wordpress CMS. You will also be responsible for the creation of web-based style guides and interactive prototypes (and their integration as themes), as well as supporting the end users and resolve front-end related issues.


Your main responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:



  •  Designing, building and maintaining efficient, reusable and reliable front-end code;

  • Making decisions related to front-end code architecture and technical approach;

  • Building cross-browser solutions optimized for mobile devices;

  • Translating requirements and mock-ups into fully functioning features using efficient and maintainable code;

  • Performing code review of 3rd party developed front-end code and make recommendation about possible improvements;

  • Participating in the design discussion of new features and change requests;

  • Identifying UI performance bottlenecks, propose and implement solutions;

  • Continuously looking for ways to improve greenpeace.org and implement A/B tests;

items.title: Front End Engineer
items.content:
Who Are We?


MemberSuite, Inc. is a web-based, enterprise Software Service (SaaS) company based in Atlanta, GA. With over 20 modules, our software powers the back office processes for more than 100 medium and large associations and non-profits, providing order processing, member self-service, and e-marketing. We believe firmly in the future of cloud computing and it’s inevitability; we believe every enterprise software market will be disrupted by a well architected, service-oriented, extensible SaaS solution, and the world’s market of 3.8 million non-profits are no exception.  We believe in world domination – or go home.     



What Do We Need?


We are looking for extremely bright, experienced engineers who love the idea of building something new! We are on the cutting edge, utilizing the Amazon Web Services platform along with the Angular2 framework to redesign our entire interface from scratch. We're giving it a modern makeover based on user testing and feedback. If that excites you – if the ability to build the industry’s first app store, or to build a mobile platform from the ground up gets you all warm and fuzzy – then you’re in the right place.


Requirements:





  • Familiar with one of the following JS frameworks (ie. Angular 2, AngularJS, React, Knockout, Ember, Node)

  • Passionate about working with new tools (Slack, Zeplin, High Five, your favorite plugins, etc) and spreading knowledge about new ones to make life easier


Nice to haves


  • 5+ years of software development on a single page app/with JS frameworks 

  • Experience building an app from scratch

  • Angular 2!!

  • Node/Lambda

  • Experience with mobile first design through a framework like bootstrap/foundation

  • Test driven development with karma jasmine mocha protractor

  • Experience with Rest API

  • Experience working closely with UX





What makes you, the ideal candidate; the right person to join our company?


You see, the right candidate – that candidate that will have a blast at our company – hates working on legacy systems, or being pigeon-holed into maintenance type jobs. The right candidate loves the opportunity to try out a new technology, or to work on a new feature, and then to be able to see how that features helps customers. The right candidate doesn’t want to be a cog in a machine; they want to drive the business forward. They want a stake in the company so that they can benefit from their hard work. They want to create something that didn’t exist before them, and feel the pride that comes from real people using it to make their jobs easier.



What You Will Get In Return



  • Catered lunches

  • Unlimited vacation days

  • Cool Equipment in house (3D printer, Segway, etc)

  • Ability to work from home

  • Casual dress all day, everyday

  • Unlimited snacks and drinks

  • Gaming room (6 xboxes fully loaded with tons of games and an Occulus)

  • Flexible Work Hours - we give you the freedom to set your own schedule

  • Weekly free massages onsite

  • Company-sponsored career development opportunities

  • Regular company outings and team events like monthly happy hours, game nights, weekly wine and coffee tastings, lunch and learn's, etc.

  • Team Environment: we work as a team and succeed as a team


At MemberSuite, we understand the value of building a strong product that enables our customers to do their jobs more efficiently and effectively.  To support our customers effectively, we provide our Engineering team with the tools and equipment they need to be effective.  This includes getting a high powered CPU or a MacBook, three flat screen monitors, and all of the snacks he/she can eat and drink. If a piece of equipment makes your life easier, we’ll get it for you.


Job Location: Dunwoody, Georgia


Position Type:  Full Time


Compensation: Based on experience



**Please note that only qualified candidates with unrestricted employment authorization (US citizens or permanent residents) will be contacted. Also, this position is LOCAL, so only candidates residing in or near Atlanta will be considered. We are based near Perimeter Mall, in Dunwoody.



Want to learn more about our product?


Copy and paste the link to launch the MemberSuite demo!


http://www.membersuite.com/get-ready-membersuite-online-demo

items.title: Full-Stack Javascript Engineer (U.S. only)
items.content:
* U.S.-based applicants only please! *

Retrium is looking for a senior full-stack developer to help us build out our amazing agile retrospectives platform. We need someone who has hands-on experience with our tech stack (Node+React+Redux+ES6) preferably in a fast paced startup environment.

We're a startup and things move pretty fast around here. It's exciting. It's also relatively unstructured; it's on you to figure out the best way to get things done.

We care deeply about the developer experience. As a result, we regularly pay off our tech debt and review new technologies that makes development enjoyable and effective.

The team is small and close-knit. We have fun. Everyone has a ton of responsibility. And people love working here!

Here's the tech stack you need to know like the back of your hand:

  • NodeJS
  • BabelJS/ES6
  • React
  • Redux

Bonus points if you've hacked on:

  • ImmutableJS
  • ShareDB
  • MongoDB
  • Redis
  • Material-UI
  • Radium
  • Elastic Search

A bit about remote work...

Retrium is a fully distributed/remote company. Work from home, or from a coworking spot. It's up to you. We Slack a lot and we love Sococo for our virtual office. Some people love the idea of working remotely; some don't. Make sure you do.

Finally...

This job isn't for everyone. We're looking for a truly senior level contributor who can thrive in a fast-paced, remote work environment. Think that sounds like you? We'd love to hear from you.

To apply: Please submit your application via https://angel.co/retrium/jobs/186672-full-stack-javascript-engineer

items.title: Backend Engineer Integrations
items.content:
Each day, clinical teams around the globe use Hale to deliver efficient, modern care to their patients. Our integrations with other systems help these practices get the most out of Hale: ensuring clinical data is in sync and saving our customers time with workflows that are seamless and efficient.

We’re looking for a keen, collaborative back-end engineer to focus on extending and enhancing these integrations to deliver an incredible experience for clinical teams using Hale.

While the role depends on expertise in the details of RESTful APIs and modern web services, success also requires flexing your strong interpersonal skills to work alongside internal teams and to be a technical lead in customer-facing conversations.

items.title: Infrastructure Engineer
items.content:
Hello! I'm James Carr with the Infrastructure Engineering Team at Zapier. We're looking for someone to join our team who can help us scale our product that helps over 1.7 million users (and growing) automate their tedious, everyday tasks so they spend less time working extra hours and more time enjoying what matters to them. If you believe that APIs will define the future of the web, visit our website to learn more about this open position.

We're a widespread remote team of 80 people, located in thirteen countries, that think computers should do more work. The Engineering Team currently has team members in Canada, Costa Rica, India, Netherlands, Nigeria, Portugal, The UK, and all over The USA.  As you can see, you don't have to be located in the USA, you just have to be talented!

We get together 2-3 times per year for a company retreat (next one in is August), and benefits include great healthcare, dental and vision coverage, 401k retirement plan with company match, profit sharing and 14 weeks paid leave for new parents.

If you're interested in learning more about our Infrastructure Engineer opening, visit the Jobs @ Zapier site.

We're not accepting applications from agencies.

To apply: Please view the job description on our site and complete the application form linked at the bottom of the page.https://goo.gl/ma1Xad

items.title: Expert Technical Interviewer
items.content:
Join our elite community of Expert Technical Interviewers.



  • Karat’s Expert Interviewers are recognized and rewarded for doing a first-class job as top assessors of technical talent. Every interviewer in the network is an accomplished engineer.  Our interviewers include development managers from big-tech companies, start-up engineers and freelancers covering the full technology stack.

Some experts do 5 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.

items.title: Senior VBulletin Developer
items.content:
AmazingRibs.com is a very popular web site dedicated to barbecue and grilling. We need a expert vBulletin developer who can help us as a part time contractor.


We anticipate around 20 to 30 hours per week on average at the outset, but if you have the right skill set and can run with the ball we are happy to give you more! We are a small team, primarily based in the Chicago area, but you can be located anywhere. We prefer US or Canadian residents.


You will manage our subscription-based vBulletin forum called 'The Pit'. The work is complicated because The Pit is behind a paywall linked to Stripe credit card processing and PayPal. It is heavily customized and performs tasks like sending out welcome letters and renewal notices. It also has special coupons and other unusual features.


We will make sure you are well compensated, and we pride ourselves on paying electronically within 48 hours of invoice.


Please see if you fit these requirements, and contact us at bigjim@amazingribs.com with the your resume and samples of your work.


You will be responsible for



  • Fixing bugs.

  • Installing patches and updates.

  • Improving UI and functionality.

  • Improving reporting systems (membership lists, renewal rates, etc.).

  • Security.


Our expectations of you



  • Able to handle emergencies and be on call when needed (a rarity).

  • Great communication skills.

  • Like working in a collaborative, team-based environment.

  • Attention to detail.

  • Experience using version control (we use GitHub) to manage your code and working with a team that uses version control.

  • Expert at js, php, and CSS.

  • Adherence to vB best practices.

  • Document your work.


We'll fall in love with you if you



  • Can manage a server.

  • Have other skills, especially Drupal.

  • Are self-managing and self-motivated.

  • Are confident but don't have an oversized ego.

  • Have a great attitude and love food, especially outdoor cooking.

items.title: Full stack developer (Python, Django, Javascript, SSH) - part time
items.content:
=What do we do?

This is a call to all full stack developers with a fascination for science, medicine, technology and innovation. If you like the topic, you will love working on our platform. 

SciencePOD is a high-growth startup, which makes complicated ideas from science and technology accessible to wider audience.WeÃ¢Â Â re a distributed team, working remotely in Europe.

We have an existing workflow and content creators management platform, that our editors use internally, and which needs to be further developed into next generation platform to be suitable to be offered as a Saas to our clients. 

Our backend tools are fairly standard - Python, Django and our front-end is built on marionette and backbone frameworks. Next generation platform is likely to use React JS. 

=Whom are we looking for?

  • 3-5+ years experience with Phython/Django/Javascript
  • Knowledge of SSH
  • Familiarity with GitHub
  • A product-first approach to building software and great attention to detail
  • Experience of working on workflow solutions preferred
  • Experience of Saas development an advantage
  • We keep open communication lines at all times
  • You are responsive and able to meet deadlines

=Work conditions
  • Initially, task-based remuneration, based on a pre-agreed hourly rate
  • Work required will grow as the company develops
  • Opportunity to shape the direction of the company and grow with the job

To apply: Send your CV together with examples of websites you have worked on to editor@sciencepod.net

items.title: Frontend Engineer
items.content:
About NomNom
NomNom is a B2B Saas application that helps customer-obsessed professionals learn from their customers faster. We aggregate customer feedback from different sources, making it easy to search, analyse and share it across the business.

Our team is small and distributed.

Our culture is driven by talented individuals who love perfecting their craft. We like scrappy hustlers who are excited about solving hard problems with practical solutions.

We help our team members grow in their roles. We encourage and finance continuous learning and development. As part of NomNom, youÃ¢Â Â ll attend events, improve your skills and explore new ones.

We have no set hours, as long as your work is getting done, you're free to work whatever schedule suits you. We have a flexible vacation policy. You take the time you need.

We deploy several times a day - all it takes is a single command.

About you

We are seeking a Senior Frontend Developer to help us shape and execute our product roadmap. This is an opportunity to join a brilliant team and demonstrate your ability to learn fast and scale an early stage product. As the ideal candidate for this job, youÃ¢Â Â ll have had previous experience working at startups and feel comfortable in a self-managed environment.

As a fully distributed team, we rely on the following tools for collaboration; GitHub, Slack, Trello, Status Hero, and Zoom.

Our frontend codebase is based on React/RactiveJS and Redux. We test our code with Jest. We're using SASS for our stylesheets and all assets are managed by Gulp and then passed through Rails' asset pipeline.

Design and user experience are very important to us, we value high attention to detail. You'll be working very closely with the product team.

Required knowledge and experience

  • Knowledge and experience of Javascript and CSS

  • Test driven development

  • Experience of working on API-powered single page applications

  • Demonstrated history of working with various frontend JS frameworks (We use ES6, React/RactiveJS and Redux, it's very unlikely you'll ever see Angular in our stack)

  • Proficiency in English


Desirable knowledge and experience

  • Interest (or experience) in Clojure and/or ClojureScript (pet-projects are OK :-))

  • Interest in functional programming (you donÃ¢Â Â t have to be a Haskell nerd, but we like Immutable.js)

  • Ruby (and a bit of Rails)

  • Client-side performance

Salaries and Perks

  • You can work from anywhere in the world (Europe and South America strongly preferred)

  • Budget allowance for professional development (up to Ã Â£1,000)

  • Pick your own equipment

  • FancyHands.com access

  • Competitive salary based on experience

To get started, apply now.

Important: NomNom is not working with agencies or recruiters. We only accept direct applications.

To apply: Apply directly here https://nomnom.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0moem/

items.title: Web Developer
items.content:
ProZ.com, founded in 1999, is the world's leading network for freelance translators with offices in the United States, Argentina, and Ukraine and remote employees based in the United States, Argentina, and Japan.

We are a small team of around 20 looking for a talented web developer who is able to take ownership of multiple products/services, understand their purpose, and interact with users/customers to improve the products/services continuously over time. Interest in and experience with languages, and language technologies, would be pluses. A passion for learning about these is ESSENTIAL.

Most ProZ.com code is in PHP and Javascript. In peripheral products and our mobile apps, some Java, Ruby, Swift and Objective C are used. DB's are MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB.

Interested candidates are asked to send a cover letter and resume in response to this posting. Let us know what you find interesting about working in the translation industry / for the world's freelance translators. Please also indicate desired salary. In your cover letter please include any examples of recent work (GitHub or an equivalent profile is a great place to start) or interesting projects youÃ¢Â Â ve worked on.

ProZ.com offers a comprehensive package of benefits including health insurance (100% coverage), 401k with matching (for U.S.-based employees), performance-based bonuses, training budget, gym membership and more. Travel opportunities, to our offices in Syracuse/Argentina and to industry events in Europe, are also available to all ProZ.com employees.

After a preliminary interview, promising candidates will be asked to demonstrate their creativity and coding ability with a paid test assignment. This is where we hope to learn more about you and see your skills in action. Hearing you talk through what you did, the decisions you made, and what you would do if you had more time gives us great insight into how you work.

To apply: Please send a cover letter and resume to kevin@proz.com

items.title: PHP DEVELOPER / ENGINEER
items.content: If you can create awesome software, and you want to work from home in your underwear, keep reading!At Doubledot Media, we help our customers build and run successful, sustainable online businesses, by building tools and providing education under two main banners: Affilorama (https://www.affilorama.com), for online content-based businesses; and SaleHoo (https://www.salehoo.com) for e-commerce.###What sort of tech/frameworks do we work with?- CakePHP (Who doesn't like cake?)- MySQL- Git- HTML/CSS/Javascript (surprise!)- JQuery and Angular- Elasticsearch- Gearman###What would you be doing?- Maintain existing codebases- Work with teammates to improve our hugely popular tools- Streamline features to make customers' lives far simpler and easier- Suggest and develop software improvements- Work with us to guide the direction of our software- Being generally amazing###Cool reasons to work with us:- Flexible hours- Work from home (or from our Christchurch office)- Relaxed, ego-free, family-friendly work culture(And you can wear whatever you like!)If you work from our Christchurch office, you also get:- Weekly Friday BBQ (or sushiBQ, or ThaiBQ)- Novelty coffee mugs (and the coffee to go with them)- Free snacks (including fresh fruit, and M&Ms galore)- An extremely comfortable chair(You'll have to wear more than just underwear, though)If you think you have a solid understanding of a decent chunk of our tech (or similar), at least 3 years commercial PHP experience, have the spark we're looking for, and want to show off your skills, we want to hear from you!

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
We're looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our growing team. As a developer at kohactive, you'll work with our clients to solve complicated technical problems by building web and mobile products. We have a diverse array of clients including entrepreneurs, mid-size, and fortune 500 businesses.


Benefits


We enjoy working. We have plenty of vacation time and a fun and casual work environment. If you're in Chicago then we have a fully stocked fridge and some comfy spots to work. If you need a change of scenery, you can work from home.

We also enjoy learning. We have lunch and learns and encourage everybody to share articles, new technologies and their knowledge. Contributing to open source is important for us as well.

items.title: Cloud Native Java Developer
items.content:
Cloud Native Java Developer


Railroad19 Inc.is a company that provides software development as a service.
We are currently seeking a Cloud Native Java Developer that is fluent in both Spring Boot and Java 8 to be a technical resource for the development of clean and maintainable code.

At Railroad19, you are part of a company that values your work and gives you the tools you need to succeed. While our headquarters are located in Saratoga Springs, New York, we are a distributed team of remote developers across the US only.  This is a full time role with vacation, full benefits and 401k.

items.title: Experienced TypeScript UX/UI Developer (Remote)
items.content:
Are you passionate about applying best practices to create excellent user experiences? Are you experienced using TypeScript?

This might be the job youÃ¢Â Â re looking for.

About us

Stack Builders is an Agile software consultancy based in New York with offices in Quito, Ecuador. We are dedicated to going above and beyond not only by offering great services for our clients, but also by pushing the software industry forward through the use of better tools and practices.

Some of our projects are currently using Ruby, Rails, and Haskell as a back-end, with some PureScript, JavaScript and TypeScript (Node.js) on the front-end. We are passionate about providing clean and maintainable code that surpasses our client's expectations.

We work in a variety of languages and therefore we value developers who are flexible about working with different stack configurations, that feel confident about tackling new challenges, and that aim toward excellence.

If youÃ¢Â Â d like to work with passionate developers that value quality and best practices, this is the place for you!

About You

We are looking for a remote contractor with a very solid TypeScript background and experience working with agile teams to augment our team. Extensive knowledge about UI/UX  is a plus.

This position would most likely last for at least 6 months and would require a commitment to provide 40 hours a week (occasional vacations off with previous notice are fine) and generally working during NYC business hours (EST) from 9 to 6 (at least 5 hours need to overlap with your time zone to be able to do pairing sessions).

A high English level  is a must since we value strong communication skills and conduct all our work using this language. This position is not open to agencies.

For citizens of countries where we have offices, please apply through our portal for any full time employee positions that may be available.

Stack Builders is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability or pregnancy.

Perks

  • Strong teaching culture
  • Regular pairing sessions
  • Challenging projects

Opportunities for company sponsored:

  • Conference participation
  • Technical talks
  • Occasional travel opportunities to Quito, Ecuador

If interested, please apply through our site confirming your availability for full time work, and please include a link to a GitHub profile with your projects in TypeScript  that we can evaluate. We will only consider candidates that apply through our portal.

If we think you might be a good fit, a technical interview will follow.

If you are not available to work now, but would like to be considered for further work, please apply making sure that you include a note about this and we can reach out on a later time when we are looking for more people. Otherwise, feel free to reach out to us when you are available!

To find out more about us, check out our website at https://www.stackbuilders.com


To apply: If interested, please apply through our site confirming your availability for full time work, and please include a link to a GitHub profile with your projects in TypeScript that we can evaluate. We will only consider candidates that apply through our portal.

items.title: IOS Developer
items.content:
Device Magic is hiring an iOS software engineer. You'll work on our primary Forms iOS app, which is a critical part of what the company does. We're based in Raleigh, North Carolina, and Cape Town, South Africa, but remote candidates are welcome.


The app is a critical tool for our customers, many of whom rely on it to keep their businesses operating. Every day we work to make sure that it runs more reliably and helps them work more easily and accurately. You'll be an integral part of this, and get the reward of knowing that the work you do makes a real difference to so many people's livelihoods.


Your responsibilities will be to implement new features, and fix bugs and defects, based on customer feedback and internal goals. Good UX is very important to us, and you will work closely with our designer to maintain this.


Day-to-day you will collaborate with our backend engineers and our CTO. We prefer to work in one or two week sprints, with engineers being involved deciding what gets addressed in each, and responsible for delivering.

items.title: React Node.js Developer
items.content:

items.title: Windows UWP Developer
items.content:
At Doist, we strive to build not only amazing products but amazing groups of people. Our multidisciplinary teams are passionate about creating products like Todoist and Twist that improve peoples lives. They thrive on building new solutions to old productivity challenges and seek to change how productivity tools are made.

Doist is a global, remote-first company and we believe that our way of working independent of borders and time zones is the future. As part of our Windows team, youll play a key role in helping us inspire the workplace of the future.

Your role

Were looking for a Windows developer to help us grow on Microsoft's platforms, primarily Windows 10 and Office 365. Specifically, you'll work on making our Todoist UWP app a best-in-class on Windows 10. We want to make sure our app is rock solid from a technical perspective and don't shy away from investing into refactoring.

You'll implement major new features together with our design team end-to-end. You will also collaborate with our other platform teams to shape and deliver functionality that spans multiple platforms.

In this role, passion for what you do is the best trait you can have. The most successful Doisters take initiative, learn fast and are comfortable with having a high degree of autonomy. We value people who take pride in their craftsmanship. Amir, our CEO spends most of his time coding.


Benefits


Were bootstrapped, profitable, and committed to building a sustainable company that will continue to grow for decades to come. That means we value work-life balance and invest in our employees long-term growth.

We offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Generous paid vacation + national holidays
  • Education stipends
  • Flexible schedule and location
  • Home office perks
  • And much more

This is a remote position, so you will be free to work from wherever you please on whatever schedule works best for you. Youll also have the option to work from our office in Porto, Portugal or rent a co-working space in the city where you live.

You can read more about how we work on our team blog, in this Forbes article, and in this Fast Company article.

items.title: Software Engineer
items.content: Full Time: Software Engineer at Penrose Hill in New York or Remote

items.title: Lead Automation Engineer
items.content:
This job is open to applicants residing anywhere within the United States or Canada.

We are looking to hire a software engineer with a strong infrastructure foundation and a passion for Continous Integration and Continous Delivery. Someone capable of leading a growing team of 4 within a growing company. Ideally, you are comfortable writing full-stack application code in Ruby, Python, or similar. You have worked closely with JavaScript for a few years, and have spent quite a bit of time close to server and systems infrastructure. We leverage AWS heavily for all things CI/CD. Our current web CI suite is managed by CircleCI Enterprise. We also have the infrastructure in place to support our mobile client's efforts in AWS; Leveraging Jenkins, Appium, Genymotion, and XCode.

You'll spend about 60% of your time as a highly technical individual contributor and 40% of your time leading the team through the delivery of CI and CD solutions.

Why Work at Doximity?

Doximity is rewiring healthcare and is the 6th fastest growing technology company in North America. Here's how clinicians use our products. For us, transparency is key, so ensuring your goals and values align with ours is also an important step. Take a look at how we Work at Doximity.

Skills & Requirements

  • Experience: You have at least 3 years of professional experience developing automated test suites using tooling such as test-unit, RSpec, Capybara, Selenium, and Jenkins. 
  • Proficient dealing with server infrastructure, AWS, and Docker.
  • Pragmatic problem solver with a passion for well-implemented solutions.
  • A passion for test automation.
  • Experience with Ruby, Rails, and JavaScript are a plus.
  • Experience with mobile automation suites for iOS and Android.

Here's what you can expect to work on

  • Improve reliability of our continuous integration and continuous delivery suites for web and mobile.
  • Setup cross-app, cross-microservice integration tests with Docker.
  • Work within the Ruby on Rails ecosystem to solve problems and optimize the test suite.
  • Debug, profile and optimize Ruby and Javascript code tests.
  • Help other team members with automation tests, issues and questions.
  • Deploy, maintain and optimize mobile CI/CD suites for Android and iOS.
  • Lead a small team through the planning of quarterly and yearly goals, help the technical direction.
  • Hire and train teammates.

A few facts about us

  • We deploy our applications to production on average 25 times per day.
  • We have over 250 private repositories in Github, ranging from forks of gems, our own internal gems as well as auxiliary applications.
  • Our production stack is hosted on AWS and QA clusters on DigitalOcean.
  • Hundreds of thousands of healthcare professionals will utilize the products you build.
  • We host unstructured 'hack days' periodically, which is time reserved for you to scratch a code itch.
  • A couple times a year we run a co-op where you can pick a few people you'd like to work with and drive a specific company goal.
  • Every new engineer ships code to production on day one. Our mentorship program ensures you're immersed in the team's culture early on. 
  • We embrace the distributed culture, with over half of our team spread out across multiple continents. 

About the Technical Stack  

Doximity's web applications are built primarily using Ruby, Rails, Javascript, and a bit of Go.  Our applications are used by hundreds of thousands of Physicians and Healthcare professionals, and we also have a suite of mobile applications for iOS and Android.  We like to think pragmatically in choosing the tools most appropriate for the job at hand.  More details about our engineering stack and engineering blog.

Your Perks

  • Lead and grow your team in growing company. 
  • Set the direction for the CI/CD suites.
  • Full medical, vision, dental for you and your family.
  • Generous pre-IPO stock incentives.
  • 3+ weeks of vacation (another week off during the December Holidays)
  • Top of the line hardware.
  • 401K (non-matched) and flexible spending accounts.
  • Life insurance and disability insurance coverage.
  • All-company trips in fun places like Beverly Hills, Lake Tahoe, and Puerto Vallarta, Mexico.

About Doximity

Doximity is the leading online medical network with over 70% of U.S. doctors as members.  We have strong revenues, profits, real market traction, and weÃ¢Â Â re putting a dent in the inefficiencies of our $2.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system.  After the iPhone, Doximity is the fastest adopted product by doctors of all time. Launched by Jeff Tangney in 2011; Jeff previously founded healthcare pioneer Epocrates (NASDAQ: EPOC).  Our beautiful offices are located in SoMa San Francisco.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

To apply: https://goo.gl/rGxoA0
