items.title: Senior Python Developer
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

You have excellent Python coding skills and a strong understanding of the Django framework; you understand how to use both in building RESTful APIs. Bonus points if your background touches on projects in Finance!

YouÃ¢Â Â re comfortable on teams using a variety of technologies, including some new and exciting frameworks like Flask.

YouÃ¢Â Â re looking for projects that you'll be proud to share with your friends and familyÃ¢Â Â maybe even one that involves enhancing an open source Android emulator used by millions of developers as they innovate in the mobile app space.

You're ready for a long-term fit with the flexibility to create your best work, again and again.

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

To apply: https://clevertech.biz/careers/55d493d3e30a86154e716acf

items.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
items.content:
Are you interested in entrepreneurship and creating a leading-edge product that powers the backbone of modern innovation?  Do you thrive on learning new things and creating elegant solutions to complex problems?  Do you have exceptional development skills and want to work with a great team to build out a great product for some of the world’s most smartest brands and innovative startups to use?


Startgrid is a dynamic and dedicated team of experienced entrepreneurs and engineers who strongly believe in the power of entrepreneurship and innovation. We’ve witnessed, firsthand, the inefficiencies of the emerging innovation marketplace. So we’re on a mission to develop a platform to connect entrepreneurs with leading enterprises to help scale innovation and develop solutions to big problems. Our SaaS product is gaining rapid traction and has massive upside among the Fortune 500.


We’re looking for a bright, driven and talented Sr/Lead Full-Stack NodeJS/Python/GoLang SW Engineer to join our geographically distributed development team to work on key product development. You will be responsible for working collaboratively with our Product Management and Engineering teams to develop and add meaningful features to our platform.


Projects include: authentication, authorization, messaging, workflow, mobile, automated tests

items.title: Front end Developer
items.content:
Ever heard of cell factories? Or synthetic biology? With the rise of genome editing technologies like CRISPR, the world now needs CAD-like tools to manipulate organisms like yeast to solve problems such as sustainable production of chemicals for use in human health, nutrition, and energy. We are seeking a talented front-end developer with affinity for academic research in life sciences to work on interactive visual exploration modules for biological data. Our team works on the cutting edge technology stack. You will be working closely with some of the most reputable scientists in life science research in the scope of DD-DeCaF, a Horizon 2020 European research project (dd-decaf.eu), and help build tools to design cell factories and engineered microbial communities.


Key responsibilities

  • Work with life scientists and designers to help transcend the current limitations in metabolic engineering modeling
  • Write well-structured and tested code
  • Implement beautiful layouts in TypeScript and HTML5
  • Build tools that are intuitive and delightful to use and bring change to the scientific and everyday world

Benefits


  • A product that really matters
  • Great opportunities for personal and professional growth
  • Work with the latest technologies
  • International team and client base
  • Possibility of remote-only work
  • 30,000-42,000 EUR/year salary

items.title: Full Stack Developer (Europe)
items.content:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

 

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working both on front-end and back-end development. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 320,000 users from 190 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

 

What skills are we looking for?

As a full-stack developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript and Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

 

Compensation Range
 

The budgeted compensation range for this role is Ã¢Â Â¬50,000 to Ã¢Â Â¬70,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside. 

Requirements
  • Strong background in benchmarking, optimization, scaling and dealing with high levels of traffic
  • Experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS and Python
  • Experience using jQuery, PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, Lua, Linux, Nginx, Elasticsearch, and Amazon Web Services a plus
  • Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium
  • Familiarity with distributed revision control systems such as Mercurial or Git
  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity
  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third party

To apply: Apply online at http://careers.hotjar.com/o/full-stack-developer-europe/?source=WeWorkRemotely

items.title: Hotjar Hero Engineer (Europe)
items.content:
Note: Although this role is fully remote, we are looking for candidates based in timezones between UTC+0 and UTC+4 only.

The Hotjar Hero team supports thousands of users and customers in over 180 countries by providing world class service, documentation, and training. The Hero team also works closely with our product teams to help prioritize and define changes to Hotjar to continuously improve the overall user experience.
 

We are looking for extremely organized and self driven Hotjar Hero Engineer to work in a remote role with a fast growing startup.

All new Heroes receive extensive technical, product, and marketing training Ã¢Â Â  as well as a yearly budget for additional training and self development. With this knowledge you will help our users set up and use Hotjar features to improve the experience and performance of their sites and apps. This is a great opportunity to develop your career by learning new skills and joining a fast-growing startup.

 
About You

 

Detail is key. Troubleshooting an issue isnÃ¢Â Â t always straightforward. Since our tool can get pretty technical, obsessing over detail really helps. If you canÃ¢Â Â t solve it, thatÃ¢Â Â s ok - just provide enough details to help the engineers as they investigate further.
 

Empathy for the win. Our users come from a wide range of backgrounds and have a wide range of technical ability. Hotjar Hero Engineers need to be able to put themselves in the usersÃ¢Â Â shoes to help them resolve any questions while at the same time empowering users with knowledge.
 

Independent mindset. As a remote team, autonomy and self-motivation is necessary. One of our core values is Honesty. We donÃ¢Â Â t use apps to measure whether or not you're working, we simply trust you. Are you up to the challenge?

 

Learning is growing. Hotjar is always adding new capabilities and improving the way our tool works. This means Hotjar Hero Engineers are always learning. Plus, it doesnÃ¢Â Â t stop there - everyone at Hotjar aims to learn 1% each day (machine learning, anyone?).
 

Go Team! Though we are spread across the world, our team is always in contact. We hold daily scrums, weekly planning, and company wide demos. We need to be prepared to step up if a team member is out. Or share a new idea we have for how to make the team or the company better. Being a team player is vital to the role of Hero Engineer.

 

What Hotjar Hero Engineers do... 
  • Creating 'WOW' moments by promptly replying and communicating with users on our support channels.
  • Investigate and solve technical issues users face on a daily basis by debugging complex issues in our codebase and on our users' sites Ã¢Â Â which use a myriad of different technologies.
  • Distill complex issues into underlying causes and work directly with our product teams to deploy solutions while consistently delivering world-class support.
  • Writing (and updating) documentation, FAQs and the Hotjar knowledgebase.
  • Representing Hotjar users within the company Ã¢Â Â to further their needs and help generate




Requirements

Must have:

  • Very strong English communication skills Ã¢Â Â both written and spoken. If you are fluent in other languages, tell us! German, French, Spanish and Japanese will be considered as assets.
  • Familiarity with the basics of HTML, CSS, Javascript, and using browser developer tools.
  • Ability to effectively communicate complex concepts that empowers our users without making them feel small.
  • Be able to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity
  • Experience working in technical support roles and teams, Agile experience a plus.
  • Desire and drive to always be learning.
  • Ability to work independently and within a team towards both personal and shared work goals
  • Passion for talking to users all day, every day.
  • Strong Javascript and angularJS knowledge.
  • Proficient in any one of the following: Python, PostgreSQL, Mercurial, Redis, Memcached, Lua, Nginx.
  • Previous experience in a troubleshooting environment and be a great problem solver.
  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third party.
 

Nice to have:

  • Experience working in technical support roles and teams.
  • Experience in codifying and maintaining customer support processes.
  • Experience working remotely.

To apply: Apply online at http://careers.hotjar.com/o/hotjar-hero-engineer-europe/?source=WeWorkRemotely

items.title: Full Stack JavaScript / Ruby on Rails Developer
items.content:
Pathable, Inc. is hiring expert full stack JavaScript and Ruby developers to join our nomadic team of software craftspeople. We've built an industry leading Ruby / JavaScript application and we need your help scaling and improving our full stack. Live and work from anywhere, while learning new things, working on a product thousands of people love to use every day. Our company is successful, self-funded, profitable, twenty people strong, and growing. We've developed a fantastic culture that embraces adventure in business, engineering and lifestyle. Please join us!

Specific Responsibilities:

  • You're an expert with deep programming experience using a variety of tools and languages.
  • You'll write beautiful, well-tested JavaScript for the browser.
  • You'll write beautiful, well-tested Ruby for Rails on the server.
  • You'll also work with Node.js, MySQL, Redis, Resque, CoffeeScript, jQuery, Backbone.js, and more.
  • You, being a polyglot, will occasionally dive into our small Meteor/React application to develop features and bug fixes.
  • You'll deploy code weekly, sometimes daily, to our AWS and EY clusters
  • In addition to clear and frequent written communication, you'll video conference daily with team members to design and refine new features for the product, marketing websites, email campaigns and more.
  • You have strong opinions loosely held; you enjoy vigorously defending what you know to be right as much as you enjoy being wrong when the best answers wins.
  • You enjoy the challenge of accurately estimating your work and ensuring its on-time completion. You're loath to have your co-workers discover bugs you've missed.
  • You thrive in a remove working environment where you define completely your own setup and interact with exclusively via computer; you go wherever you want.

About Us:

  • Pathable (http://pathable.com) is the leading provider of mobile event apps and online community platforms for conferences, tradeshows, events, and associations. From 10,000 doctors at a convention center to 200 community organizers meeting for a weekend, our software improves the entire experience of attending in-person conferences and events. 
  • Though we develop products delivered over the Internet, as a nearly 10 year-old profitable company, we're not quite a startup anymore. We're fortunate to have room to innovate and experiment as we develop new products and services.
  • Managed and majority owned by the original founders, we've got the freedom to chart our own course -- our only influence is what's best for our customers. 
  • From the beginning our culture has supported and embraced remote workers. We don't have an office and the Pathable family lives or is traveling in over 10 countries. Our members enjoy more time with their children, living in remote and unusual places, or exploring the world; all while growing professionally and building things about which they are proud.
  • We're building a new product, from the ground up, using the latest tools, integrated everything we've learned from nearly 10 years of product development to the same market. 

Benefits:

  • Accrued paid vacation
  • Paid holidays
  • Full medical+dental benefits for US workers
  • Medical insurance stipend for non-US workers
  • Yearly self improvement stipend
  • Monthly stipend for co-working space

To apply: Please visit https://www.jsco.re/s9oh and be sure to enter the URL of your personal site or resume in the field marked XKCDTHX1138.

items.title: Front-End Developer
items.content:
**Work from anywhere, flexible-hours, part-time or full-time position**

The Podcast Host ltd. are looking for a front-end developer to join the team. We’re a little company looking to grow, and a new Software as a Service (SAAS) project is a big part of that plan. Our new front-end dev will play a huge part in building that tool, and solving a deep problem that our audience experience.

Currently, the business revolves around content and teaching. We write, blog and, of course, Podcast, about podcasting. The aim is to help anyone (hobbyists to businesses) to start, run and grow a show. We have a tonne of free content that offers that advice, and a range of paid courses (sold as a premium upgrade) which go much more in-depth.

Next, we want to offer a software product that cures one of the biggest pains that afflicts our audience. This application will offer the tools to make Podcasting (and media production in general) much more easy – even for non-techies – and a workflow to save hours each week.

We’ve developed a prototype web application which works. It already solves many of the problems we want to tackle. That prototype is operated, right now, through a command-line type interface. The purpose of this project is to develop the front-end system which allows an average user to work with the application.

Technical Skills

The core aim of this role is to create a dashboard which allows anyone to use the already-developed back-end system. Within this dashboard we have a range of requirements, from standard button-push, drop-down controlled sections, to heavily designed, interactive HTML5 interfaces which allow people to drag/drop/interact with the workflow.

On top of the dashboard above, we’ll also be building a great public facing site, which handles the sales funnel, ecommerce, subscriptions and member management. Our front-end developer will take charge of all of this, and work closely with our existing back-end dev to create the interface.

In terms of the tech you need to know, the backend system is accessed through a JSON based RESTful API. You will need:

Strong Javascript Knowledge
HTML5 media components
HTML5 Canvas
Interfacing with a RESTful API
WordPress and Bootstrap experience
Some knowledge of audio and video codecs
Working knowledge of HTTP inspection tools
ie, Fiddler, Charles
NodeJS experience would be useful but not required
Media production experience is desirable but not required

Softer Skills

The big challenge here is creating an interface to allow our average user to carry out a set of quite complex tasks with their media. We need to let them do this in a really simple and easy way.

I’m looking for someone who will enjoy this creative challenge. I need you to help me rethink a process that currently intimidates or repels a large number of the people we work with. If you have experience in working with media, then that may be an advantage. Or, it might even be a disadvantage – we want to get away from existing ways of thinking.

In short, we need:

A creative mind, able to rethink and redesign an age-old process
A passion for making things simple, simple, simple
A real aptitude for great UX design and creating intuitive workflows
If you have a genuine interest in podcast, even better!

The Details

We are a company based in Dundee, Scotland, but we’re willing to work with someone at a distance on this one. You can work from anywhere within the UK (UK residents only I’m afraid). If you did want to move to Dundee, of course, you’re welcome to join us! It’s a great and growing place for digital media, tech and games right now.

Working hours are also flexible. We need a commitment to at least 3 days per week, so we can grow some momentum on this. If you’re interested in full-time, then that’s great too. We need daytime working – any time between 8 and 6, Monday to Friday – so this isn’t for someone already in a full-time job, looking for evening or weekend work.

The salary for this role depends entirely on experience. We have the option to go with an experienced front-end developer, and the upper end of our scale (25 - 32k). Or, we would consider a graduate with the enthusiasm to make the job their own, starting at a lower level (15.5 - 18). Either way, once the app launches, we’ll be growing the team. That means our existing developers will move up quickly and salary will increase an line with app traction and responsibility. We’re also open to a bit of negotiation on that for people with really extensive experience (including the possibility of equity or partnership, for the really right person…).

items.title: Embedded Software Engineer
items.content:
The Role:

Shot Scope are seeking an experienced embedded software engineer to help develop their next cutting-edge golf technology product.

Shot Scope is an up-and-coming, Edinburgh-based company which develops wearable technology for golfers. The Shot Scope wristband allows players to automatically track their golf shots and provides stats that were previously only available to top professional golfers.

The successful candidate will be tasked with writing firmware for Shot Scope’s second generation product. Working as part of the electronics team, the embedded developer will write C/C++ to create a compelling golf product.

The role will involve:

- Creation of a real time embedded application using the FreeRTOS operating system
- Development of drivers for various peripheral ICs
- Writing unit tests as part of a test-driven development strategy
- Improvements and additions to golf tracking algorithms
- Working with mobile app and desktop app developers to communicate with the wearable

REQUIREMENTS:

- Excellent C coding skills
- Experience with low power microcontrollers and ARM Cortex M cores
- Development with Real-Time Operating Systems
- Communicating with sensors, radios and other peripherals
- Knowledge of common bus protocols: I2C/SPI/UART/SDIO/USB
- Ability to read schematics and interpret datasheets
- Basic hardware debugging with oscilloscopes/logic analyzers
- Version control with Git

BENEFICIAL:

- Experience with FreeRTOS, FatFS and ST MCUs
- Experience with Bluetooth Low Energy
- Knowledge of encryption/authentication devices and protocols
- Eclipse and Open OCD expertise
- Test Driven Development

items.title: iOS Developer
items.content:
*iOS Developer*


*We’re looking for an experienced iOS Developer to join us as we go through an exciting re-brand and build the next generation of Touchnote's iOS applications.*


*About the Role*

Would you be interested in joining the UK’s 9th-fastest growing technology company to help design and build new and advanced applications for iOS?

This position will work alongside our experienced developers and collaborate with other teams, including product managers and designers, to transform our re-brand requirements into compelling, user-focused, applications for iPhone and iPad.

The ability to work well in a small, expert team is critical, as well as an eye for detail, a strong sense of initiative and being proactive. We’ll want the right person to actively contribute and take on important responsibilities without being prompted.

In this role, you’d report to our Chief Product Officer and work with a truly talented and close-knit team, ensuring consistent performance, quality and responsiveness of our iOS applications and helping to write and maintain clean, well-documented, reusable and scalable code.


*About You*


*Essential*

* Ideally, 3-5 years’ proven experience in iOS development, from initiation and planning through to successful launch in the App Store
* Deep familiarity with Objective-C and Swift with a practised understanding of the interoperability between both
* Proficient understanding of code versioning tools (Git)
* Experience using key tools UIKit, CoreAnimation, CoreData and Storyboards
* Solid experience of unit testing and implementing continuous integration of iOS apps
* Familiarity with third-party libraries and RESTful APIs to connect to back-end services

*Desirable*

* Experience with client-server type architectures and protocols
* Up-to-date working knowledge of the general mobile landscape, trends and emerging technologies
* Actively considers the wider picture, identifying patterns and connections between issues/situation that are not obviously related
* BS degree in Computer Science


*About Touchnote*

Touchnote is the world’s most popular postcard-sending service. We were ranked UK's 9th fastest growing technology company, in Deloitte's Fast50 2015 ranking.

Our mission is to become the most meaningful way for family and close friends to stay in touch.

We started in 2008 in London and have since sent millions of personalised cards worldwide. Our apps and website have been featured in the world's leading press, in Google Play and iTunes, and on grandparents’ fridges worldwide.

Our app is available on the iPhone, iPad, Android mobiles and tablets as well as on our website.


*Salary and Benefits*

Our salaries are competitive based on experience and are open to negotiation.

Other perks include:

* 25 days holiday
* Fortnightly work from home day
* Company laptop (Mac or PC - you choose!)
* Choice of wellbeing benefits which include Private Medical Insurance and/or a gym membership
* A membership with Perkbox which gives employees access to plentiful discounts such as half price cinema tickets at major cinemas including Odeon and Vue, a free Tastecard and many more
* Free breakfast and snacks
* Friday drinks
* Team lunch fortnightly
* Team socials every month
* Free Touchnote credits to use our product

items.title: Scrappy mid-level / senior Rails engineer
items.content:
Operating successfully in secondary schools in 40 countries, BridgeU’s platform leverages data about courses and universities from around the world, and combines intelligent tools with streamlined administration to empower schools to provide a premium, modern, careers-guidance service to their students. Declared one of the most innovative EdTech Startups in Europe (by EdTech Europe), BridgeU has raised $3.5m in venture capital from Octopus Investments, Seedcamp, Fresco and GSV Acceleration.

At BridgeU, we’re growing fast, building new products for our customers, and solving genuinely hard problems with data. We want to hire a developer to work on our Rails stack, who believes in our vision of using data to re-invent access to higher education.

You'll be working across our full stack, building new features and improving the existing ones, to ensure that our students continue to love our service. We want to build the most engaging, intelligent and comprehensive product for university applications, so we're looking for a strong software developer with an eye for detail.

You have solid coding skills & knowledge of Rails. You are a fast learner & an excellent communicator.

You'll have the chance to work with a team of fantastic and creative engineers. We have an open and democratic work culture, where everyone can contribute, learn and teach. We strive to be an awesome company to work for, optimizing our stack and our processes so that our developers can get on with the work they’re best at.

You have:
* Passion
* Skills: Rails, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, git, testing
* Demonstrable experience

Stack: Rails, HTML5, CSS3, JQuery, SCSS, Postgres, Docker, AWS, Microservices, Vue.js, Paloma.js

Salary & equity combination depend on experience.

*We are currently only hiring people who have a few years of experience working as a developer.*

We are committed to equal opportunities for all.

items.title: Full Stack Web Developer (.Net)
items.content:
How would you like to join a company that is actually disrupting an industry that's still based on faxes? The UK commercial energy brokerage industry is stuck in a bygone age. Relationships and paperwork still dominate. Open Energy Market uses technology to modernise the industry and empower its customers. We focus on trading only large volume Fixed and Flexible contracts. Our software automates the procurement process offering direct access to the UK's suppliers. Customers can forecast their portfolio allowing greater control over their use and costs.

For more information about us and our company, visit https://openenergymarket.com.

Our team is growing and we are seeking intelligent and creative people to join us. From day one your contributions will be felt within our fun but hard working environment.

We are looking for a self-organised and motivated individual to join us as a Full Stack Web Developer.

*The Role*

Our development team is cross-functional and is currently fully remote. We have an office in Surbiton from which you can work if required. You will be comfortable working in a mature and collaborative environment. Liaising with non-technical employees across multiple time zones will be required. The role provides a high level of autonomy and you will be reporting directly to the CTO.

You will be responsible for the development, deployment and support of our software. This will cover the ongoing support of our current software and the development of our new platform. You will be expected to contribute to all areas of the Devops process including:

• Architecture – Our new platform is in the embryonic stage and is evolving fast. We have clean and clear requirements for the first phase which is to evolve our current offering. Ongoing there is infinite scope for solving challenging issues our various market and commodity opportunities present. Your knowledge of building clean, performant and scalable solutions will be used in helping us to develop the platform that will power the company’s aggressive growth plans.

• Implementation – A strong and clear demonstration of clean, SOLID coding skills in one or more OO languages is required. Commercial experience of .Net in a web environment is highly preferable. Your code will value readability over brevity and you will be able to justify your solutions with the rest of the team.

• Testing - We are aiming to increase our automated test coverage across all our software. You will be a pragmatic Test Driven developer who has experience of developing automated testing suites to support your projects.

• Deployment - Our cloud-based environment runs on top of both Azure and AWS. It is vital to the growth of the business that we have continuity and performance for our customers. You will have experience in deployment and support for at least one of these environments. Any experience of monitoring and automation within a service based environment will be welcome.

*Our Technology Stack*

Our software is currently built using ASP.Net MVC and standard web technologies. We currently use SQL Server for our database requirements and use Git to automate our deployments. Any experience of these technologies would be highly preferable and you will have strong HTML, JavaScript and CSS skills.

All new development work will be undertaken using .Net Core and we are evaluating Vue.js as our preferred frontend framework. However, we are constantly investigating other technologies that would benefit our product or speed up our development process. Skills such as Powershell or Bash scripting experience would also be welcome.

*About you*

* You are a craftsman and take pride in all aspects of your role.
* You leave the code in a better state than you find it using a pragmatic, boy scout, approach.
* You program for fun as well as your day job.
* You like to break things while finding out how they work.
* You engage with the wider developer community and are involved in open source.

items.title: React Front End Developer
items.content:
Thanks for checking out our job post for a Freelance Front End Developer.

We are looking for a front-end specialist with experience building single page applications, intricate knowledge of HTML5, CSS (with a pre-processor) and JavaScript and who has an eye for UX & visual design. The right candidate will be able to design and implement frontend wireframes and workflows from end to end.

Your knowledge and experience:
• 2 – 3 years’ experience in a software development environment.
• Strong mobile experience, incl. responsive design and cross platform app development.
• Strong interest in UX / UI design, preferably with experience.
• Demonstrable understanding of fundamentals.
• Expert knowledge of HTML5, CSS, JavaScript.
• Exposure to a pre-processor like / Sass.
• Hands on experience with React.
• Exposure to or interest in ES6 / ES7, TypeScript.
• Proficient with industry standard graphic design tooling.
• Proficient with GIT SCM.
• Understanding of TDD, BDD and CI / CD.
• Excellent communication skills and ability to work as part of a team.
• Exposure to working in an Agile environment.

Nice to have:

• Familiar with microservices architecture & containerization tech like Docker.

Job benefits:
- Competitive day rate
- Central London office
- Potential full time position available, after initial 2-month engagement

No recruiters please.

items.title: Python Developer
items.content:
*About the role*

We build complex applications for transacting advertising trades. These have a combination of synchronous and asyncronous processes with various microservices communicating via REST APIs.

We have migrated all server code to Python 3. We have separate teams for UI and server development. Therefore, we do not seek full-stack developers. However, we have numerous internal admin interfaces that use Django Templates for the UI and where using jQuery and templates is useful. RESTful APIs are a core aspect of our product and we expect you to be familiar with RESTful principles.

We have a Continuous Integration pipeline that relies on a several layers of automated testing for which unit testing is a critically important element. Our Devops function is closely ingregated with the development team (we use Ansible/Jenkins extensively)


*Experience*


Required skills:

* Python

* Django

* Celery

* Linux

* Postgresql

* Git

* Jira

It is an absolute requirement that you be familiar with unit testing and be able to submit code with a high degree of unit test coverage.

We would expect you to be able to answer various questions about the Python language as well as general principles around good software engineering.

*Additional Experience*

* CouchDB, MongoDB, Druid and NoSQL in general
* Spark
* AWS

*Salary*
£30,000 - £60,000 depending on experience

NOTE: Working from home is an option for this role with occasional office visits (London based) and national applications are considered

*A bit about us*

Founded in 2013, Bitposter is the leading automated platform for trading out of home (OOH) media.

Built to provide efficiencies and transparency in how OOH media is bought and sold today, Bitposter offers an easy to use cloud based environment where media owners can list both classic print and digital (DOOH) inventory, and buyers can leverage first and third party data to plan, negotiate, option and book activity in real-time.

95% of OOH media owners, including: JCDecaux, Exterion, and Primesight, sell their inventory via the Bitposter platform; providing buyers with live availability across more than 400,000 classic and digital screens, across the UK.

items.title: Frontend Developer (m/f)
items.content:
To strengthen our international team in Berlin, we are offering a full-time position:
*Frontend Developer (m/f)*

We enable leading international e-commerce companies drive performance in product advertising and paid search in more than 20 languages globally. In 2016, we generated over €1.7 Billion in client revenue and are proud to count some of the Top 500 Worldwide Internet Retailers such as Footlocker, ASOS, and Harrods as clients. To support our clients from all over the world, we have offices in Berlin, London, Passau, and New York.


*// Your responsibilities*
• As a Frontend Developer, you provide strong vision and technical leadership in web frontend development
• You architect solutions from data sources to processing to end-user display
• You create exploratory tools for visualization using Open Source tools and by implementing our libraries
• You work closely with our developers and the data team to maximize the value in our data
• You program clean and testable codes as well as conduct code reviews
• You serve as a mentor for new team members and share knowledge within your team and company
• You code, conduct performance analyses, and maintain existing products


*// Your profile*
• You have 3+ years of experience in web development
• You have in-depth understanding of web browser architecture and behavior
• You are an expert in HTML, CSS and JavaScript (node, Backbone, Bootstrap, CoffeeScript)
• You are experienced in solving unusual technical problems and in making architectural decisions
• You have a good understanding of data structures
• You are fluent in English
• You are experienced in UX, design, or any additional programming language as a plus (preferably Ruby)


*// What we offer*
• Contribute to a unique software product that continues to excite us and our customers daily
• We offer challenges and encourage your personal development, offering individual external and internal training, conference visits, and regular appraisals
• You will take responsibility from day one and work in a great, agile team of diverse, smart, and passionate people from more than 20 nationalities
• We regularly provide you with deep insights into our business strategy and offer the chance to shape crealytics with your input and ideas
• You will benefit from our flexible working hours, our great relocation support, and depending on your tasks, we invite you to work in our Passau office from time to time – accommodation is provided!


If you would like to become part of our success story and think you would make a great addition to our team, Ann-Marie Hennemuth will gladly receive your application with the subject line “Frontend Developer (m/f) WIS” in English. Please make sure to include your earliest possible starting date and your salary expectations.

items.title: JavaScript Developer
items.content:
*About the Company*

Founded in 2012, Edinburgh based Gecko is growing fast, we’ve grown our team, and revenue significantly over the past 18 months, and we’ve got a fantastic roster of 70+ clients across UK, US, Canada, Australia and China.

Our software is used to help Universities recruit more students from all over the world, in fact, we’ve helped over 1 million students get in touch with a university and that’s growing every day. At it’s core our software helps gather student information digitally, and gives the University the tools to engage with them quicker and more efficiently. 

*The Role*

We are looking for a JavaScript developer to join the team and work on our range of products within a driven and passionate team of developers.

Our clients expect the best experience and we're always looking to improve the quality of our software. You'll have the opportunity to work as part of a team in a fast paced environment. Within this role, you'd be encouraged to explore new technologies and take ownership of your work. We embrace agile project workflows and techniques.

*Your responsibilities would be to:*

* Develop new products and improvements to our product range
* Use the latest JavaScript technologies
* Write extendable and testable code
* Use source control and undertake peer review using Git

We don’t expect applicants to know everything. If you can show a desire for learning new skills and implementing new ideas, then that's a big plus for us. We use a variety of technologies across our products and encourage developers to try new things.

*Suitable candidates could have:*

* Knowledge of front-end JavaScript frameworks (Angular 1.x, Angular 2.x, React)
* Familiar with ES6 and ES6 transpilers (TypeScript, Babel or JSX)
* Knowledge of NodeJs and Express
* Experience of RESTful services and integrating with API Endpoints
* Understanding of CSS (and the SASS pre-processor)

*About You*

* Self-driven attitude and a desire to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Able to work as part of the development team, but also on your own.
* Willingness to expand your technical knowledge and identify where this could be applied.  
* Able to communicate clearly (vocally and written) with other team members.

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* 28 days paid holiday (plus your birthday off)
* Your choice of Apple hardware
* Bose QC35 Wireless headphones for use in work
* Complimentary breakfast, fruit and soft drinks
* Table tennis
* Casual dress code
* Regular team events

items.title: Tech Architect
items.content:
Technical Architect
Want the environment of a start-up within a FTSE 75 company? Enjoy flexible working? Want to be led by hands-off management?
Chances are you’ve tried to change supplier for your television, phone, broadband or energy services before.
Did you have a memorable experience as a consumer? We’re here to make it a ‘yes’

We're a high growth technology and retail business. We develop deal comparison SaaS for triple play: TV, Phone and Broadband. It's a complex industry with over 5,000 products, each with several variants - we're here to offer customers the right option.
We’re also the proud creators of Voltz, an energy-switching app. It's had phenomenal feedback on the app stores (5*) and has helped people to save on their energy bills.
We use our deal comparison software ourselves, but it's also used by companies like Dixons Carphone, Sainsburys, Game, The Guardian ...

Right now, we’re in the midst of some big changes which include:
• Migrating our services to AWS.
• Scaling up our technology team.
• Integrating into the wider Dixons Carphone Group.


What’s it like working here:
Our Technical Architects report into our awesome Chief Architect – one of the nicest guys you’ll ever meet and someone who really knows his stuff. Working with him and our tech leads, you'll help to create software solutions and be a pro at articulating those ideas to the technology teams.
• We work in a collaborative, Agile team environment on a range of different projects from e-commerce websites, energy switching apps to SaaS enterprise solutions and tools.
• Our Architects work closely with the tech leads of each team, helping to clearly communicate ideas and solutions.
• Our Architects can be involved with more than one product at a time.


Sounds good? You’ll do great here if you:
• Produce high quality technical documentation.
• Are the type to inspire technical innovation.
• You’re an advocate of best-breed practices including test-driven design, code reviews, continuous integration…..
• You’re a great communicator and can instinctively lead and inspire others.

If that sounds like you, here's why you'll enjoy working here:
• We aren't corporate and don't wear suits.
• We're backed by Dixons Carphone , a FTSE 75 company.
• Great team and company-wide events: Escape rooms, hackathons, junkyard golf, bowling, team lunches….
• We promote flexible working.
• Yearly bonus!
• We're hands-off managers.
• Staff encouraged to stuff themselves with free fruit, velvet cake and takeaways...
• ... But we have a subsidised gym membership to counter that (we also have a free onsite gym at Acton HQ)

A few of our awards include:
- One of Europe's fastest growing technology businesses in the 2013 GP Bullhound Media Momentum Awards.
- We've been awarded the Sunday Times Tech Track 100
- The Deloitte Technology Fast 50 awards for the past three years in a row (2015, 2014 & 2013)
- Innovation in Analytics 2016

items.title: Senior iOS Engineer
items.content:
Ever wanted to help build and improve a product that actually helps people do useful things?

Here at Memrise we’re building the world’s most joyful language learning app, and you could be a part of it! We have well over 15 million users, a vibrant app and massive plans to improve mobile learning for everyone.

We are looking for an experienced and passionate iOS Engineer to join us and help build the world’s greatest language learning app!

This opportunity presents the rare chance to join a startup as it scales from millions to tens of millions of active users, and in doing so make a meaningful impact on how people learn around the world.

REQUIREMENTS

You will be very experienced in iOS app development, with a real passion for making user experience amazing. You will get to work with a very talented team of developers, designers and product people, so communication skills are super important as well. As we are a language learning app, an interest in languages will score you loads of extra points!

Ideally we would love for you to have:

* Experience building and maintaining live apps in the App Store.
* A practical, pragmatic and organised approach to development.
* An understanding of how important teamwork is as a project scales.
* Exposure to Agile development processes.
* Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and communication skills.

Technical Skills:

* Ability to think in both Swift and Objective-C.
* Experience designing clean and maintainable classes.
* Knowledge of the multithreading options available on iOS.
* Writing unit tests and testable code.
* An understanding of different caching techniques.
* Experience with connecting to a RESTful API.
* Ability to build UIs from Storyboard, Xibs and in code.

If you aren’t completely confident that you fit our exact criteria, please get in touch immediately. Humility is a wonderful thing and we’re not interested in hiring ‘rockstars’ or ‘ninjas’. And we're at least as interested in character as in talent.

BENEFITS

Healthcare and pension, with a number of discounts and cashback on important stuff like Gym membership, opticians and dentists' fees. Fresh fruit; coffee and soft drinks. We keep you fuelled with a wide ever-changing variety of healthy and unhealthy snacks, breakfast materials and weekly team lunches. We have frequent team expeditions, the last one being a lovely canal cruise in the summer sunshine! We run a cycle to work scheme and a selection of useful perks and benefits.

You'll get to work the people in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wORv8J1n0y8

items.title: Web Developer (Fintech, Proptech)
items.content:
*About the company:*

Thesqua.re is a global mobility company that provides 4 Star Serviced Apartments in key business destinations across the world. Thesqua.re has won multiple awards for product excellence and is now embarking on an ambitious strategy to broaden and expand its product footprint.

We are also creating a Fintech / Crowdfunding platform to allow investors to share in our success and gain access to a niche investment strategy on London property.

*The role:*

* Suitable for an experienced web / front end developer
* Ideal for candidates who like a fast paced environment and a variety of work.

*The candidate must have:*

* Strong ability in HTML 5, CSS 3, preprocessor (i.e. SCSS/SASS) and JavaScript

* Develop high quality websites
* Integration with our full stack and other platforms

* RESTful Web Services

NB: phone calls or submissions from recruitment agencies cannot be accepted.

items.title: Front-end Developer
items.content:
*About Paddle*
Our mission is to make selling software easy; allowing developers to focus on building products they love. We handle all of the hard stuff (like payments, licensing, taxes, trials, in-app purchases, analytics & customer engagement), so they don't have to.
We are a dynamic and entrepreneurial venture backed team of 28 based in London. We’re scaling fast with ambitious plans for 2017 and we’re looking for someone to help bring cadence and their expertise to our engineering team’s evolution through the next phase of growth.

*What will you do*
- You’ll be developing and expanding our existing range of products.
- Technical ownership of one (or more) areas of our frontend codebase.
- Working with the product team to transform prototypes into real user interfaces.
- Provide front-end engineering advice for team issues, and be involved in wider technical decisions that impact other teams or the company at large.
- Work directly with the backend team on API specification and integration.

*Your experience*
- React or Angular2
- CSS3 with SASS/LESS
- Build tools, such as Gulp, Grunt, Bower, CodeKit or similar
- Git (or similar) source control
- Unit and functional testing, using tools such as Mocha, Jasmine, Selenium, Phantom, Protractor or similar

*Useful Skills*
- Experience working with responsive designs
- Ability to work with jQuery and plain-old JS
- Previous exposure to JIRA
- Previously involved in building single page JS applications with API back end

*What’s in it for you?*
- Share options - everyone at Paddle is an owner in the business
- Excellent exposure to management, transparent company performance, input into company direction, ideas and growth
- The best possible equipment - whatever you need to increase your productivity
- We care about results, not face time - if you need some time to work from home and can maintain efficiency then that’s cool with us
- A close team with frequent team outings (food, drink, sports etc.)
- The opportunity to be part of a fast growing business, loved by an international base of clients

*Closing date*: 27th April, 2017

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

items.title: Web Developer
items.content:
BounceIt is a social media app based around the six degrees of separation- the notion that you can be linked to anyone in six steps or less. To utilise this concept in a social media app, we have created a function called ‘bouncing’. Any time you send content to a friend on BounceIt, they can ‘Bounce’ this content on to their friends, who can bounce the content on to their friends and so on and so forth. Using GPS, we can track the path of this photo as it travels around the world. For example, you take a photo and send it to your friends in France and Spain, who bounce it to friends in Germany, Hong Kong and Peru. Without leaving the couch, your media has travelled around the world without you leaving the couch.

Tied in with this is gamification. Users can compete against their friends in live leaderboards, collect trophies to display on their profile and complete challenges to gain experience. Although it is not implemented into the app yet, we plan on having a huge amount of customisability- from themed profiles based on achievements to customisable maps based on distance travelled/ countries visited.

In November, we received £112.5k funding as a proof of concept project, and are less than a month off soft launching, with the aim of a full launch late April. In a few months, we have grown our team from one hugely passionate full time employee to 4 hugely passionate employees. We have a digital director who is currently part time, however we need a full time front end developer.

Another project we are currently working on is an agency we are opening, specialising in website and app building, optimisation, CMS and ecommerce. Part of your role will be working with clients to build bespoke solutions for them, to keep cash flow positive.

*The role- Web Developer*
We are looking for a web developer to join BounceIt. Due to being a social media app, there are a few reasons why we need a designer; The first is that we are aware that our user interface has changes that need made, and once we have soft launched, there will be more changes that need made. A full time front end developer will allow us to make these changes as quickly as possible. A new corporate side to our website needs built, as does an ambassador page.

*So why BounceIt?*
• We are in one of the most exciting and fast moving industries today and with the right idea (which we believe we have) the payoff could be huge.
• The variety in our team is massive. Both our CEO and COO are 22. Our Technical Director and Digital Director both have over 20 years of experience and our chairman has boarded 6 companies and led a successful one for 15 years. This brings the perfect blend of youth and experience.
• As well as having a social media application, BounceIt is viable as a marketing tool, something that has been validated by Microsoft Education, Forza Motorsports and RBS, along with other smaller companies.

*Responsibilities*
• Constantly updating the user interface according to the customer feedback
• Building the front end of a corporate section of our website
• Illustrations, infographics and images for our social media and blogs
• Collaborating with the rest of the team to complete other projects

*Skills Required*
• HTML/HTML 5
• CSS/CSS3
• JavaScript/JQuery
• Design skills
• Attention to detail
• Artistic flair

*Skills Optional/Beneficial*
• CMS/Umbraco
• MVC/Razor/.NET Web Forms

items.title: Lead Front-End Web Developer
items.content:
Overview

Popsa is an e-Commerce startup that uses data to automatically create personalised prints such as photobooks, calendars, posters, canvases, and postcards.

Our vision is to generate beautiful keep-sake mementos and personal photo-diaries entirely in the background – selecting the best user-generated content via machine learning algorithms before programmatically designing an appropriate layout.

We print from the best facilities in Europe and deliver direct to your door within days.

Our aim is to build a subscription service to your memories; your best photos carefully curated and lovingly presented, printed and shipped to you each month – all without lifting a finger.


You and the Role

Front-end developers get a lot of the glory, but they also write a LOT of code. Those subtle animations and interactions take time to get right and we understand that (in fact, our CEO has designed our UX interactions for years, so you’ll have a good internal advocate for getting this stuff done right!).

We want you to be as obsessed over the details as we are. A perfectionist. Nothing is more important than our customers’ experience and that starts with the parts of our business they interact with directly. You will be responsible for the quality and delivery of world-class web-apps that will delight customers (and your colleagues!)

This is a new role that we’re creating, so you’ll have a lot of freedom – that being said, we expect the highest degrees of professionalism, and that you’ll adopt best practices.

We’re also looking for someone who wants to stretch themselves professionally and who is engaged in the tech community. Like implementing solutions with the latest tech? Constantly tweaking your toolchain to optimise your own workflow? People know your face at AngularConnect or React London? We want you!


Education & Experience

Education is everything, but we recognise there are many ways to get it. You could have a BSc/MSc in Computer Science (or a related subject) but you might be a self-taught superstar. We don’t discriminate on education, it’s the results that matter.


Expertise

HTML5 and CSS3 (and CSS preprocessors)
Core JavaScript and an MVC framework like Angular or React
Package managers, like NPM
Testing frameworks
Git – we’re big on branching workflows, pull requests and code reviews
Code deployment, like Jenkins or AWS CodeDeploy
Terminal – your shell choice says a lot about you
Professional IDEs like WebStorm

If you have a few years of commercial experience under your belt (freelance or employed) that’s a definite bonus. Make sure you tell us about it when you apply.

Ideally

You’ll love great design and appreciate good UX
Be completely comfortable with RESTful APIs
Know your way around an SQL database
Be open to working with NoSQL databases
Be familiar with AWS Services like EC2 & AutoScaling, Lambda, CloudFront, Route53 — these are core part of the Popsa stack

Expectations

We’re a close and hard-working team; happy to share workloads and work late at crunch time, you’ll need to be a team-player.
We’re sticklers for neat, maintainable, well-documented code that follows the conventions for the language or framework you’re working with. We’ll expect you to feel the same way.
We work in an Agile team with quick iterations, regular deployments, weekly sprints; it helps if you’ve experienced these working patterns.
We’re driving towards increased automation so we expect everyone to contribute to this DevOps culture with high-visibility of application performance.

Rewards

You’ll receive a competitive salary, but most importantly, you will also get to own part of the business.
Popsa has an share options scheme that is open to all employees.
We’ll tell you all about it as part of the interview process.

items.title: Full Stack Go developer
Senior Front End Engineer - React, Angular, Node, JS
items.content:
ANDigital is a new way for digital delivery.

We are growing fast and looking for passionate and enthusiastic, Senior Front End Engineers to join our bright and talented team.

How We Work:

We work in an Agile Scrum environment and encourage our Software Engineers to be innovative and deliver solutions to technical and business problems that our clients face. As a Senior Front End Engineer at ANDigital you will design and develop compelling and commercially viable customer facing products across multiple digital and e-commerce channels: web, mobile, social, in-store.

Check out some of the recent work we have been involved in - https://andigital.com/our-work

The Tech:

Front End Engineers at ANDigital come from strong HTML/CSS and JavaScript backgrounds working in an agile environment. Working with some of the latest and cutting edge tech:

CSS3, HTML5, jQuery, JavaScript
JavaScript Front end frameworks - React, Angular, Vue, Redux, Ember etc.
Styling pre-compilers - SASS, LESS
Task runners - Gulp, Grunt.
Do have a look at the tech we love to give you the full picture: https://andigital.com/our-tech/

Your Role:

As a Senior Front End Engineer, you will be an expert in your domain, applying your experience and knowledge when influencing your team or client. You will work with our clients onsite in a multi-skilled Agile delivery team to design, architect and develop digital and eCommerce products. You'll adopt continuous integration and delivery techniques throughout the software development life cycle. You will also be involved in developing responsive websites across web and mobile.

As an inspirational mentor and coach you'll encourage regular feedback, promote skills development, foster strong relationships, build connections AND encourage open communication.

AND the best of the rest:

We encourage you to innovate and progress in your career but we also know the importance of having a good work life balance.

After going through our intensive (but seriously fun!) ANDBootcamp with the rest of your new team, you will be ready to be deployed to one of our clients and enjoy the many benefits of being an ANDi!

Market leading package and equity – from an annual tech budget to spend on the latest gadgets, to bonus challenges, private healthcare, flexible holiday and share options!
Join a growing, professional and driven squad team that is closely knit and supportive
Make a huge impact in creating a unique company
Learn, develop and grow as part of a fast growing company
Work hard, play hard in a fun environment where everyone is valued

We always love to hear from passionate and enthusiastic technologists who love to innovate and explore new tech. Whether you are backend, full stack or frontend we want to speak with you. We have teams working with Angular, Node, React, NoSQL and much more. If you enjoy being challenged and enjoy learning we’d love to hear from you!

items.title: Java Backend Developer
items.content:
Excited by the prospect of working for a young startup? Enjoy solving distributed computing problems? Want to expand your skills with the Internet of Things (IoT)? Love building backend micro-services? Believe in the principles of DevOps?

Doordeck’s vision is to replace building access cards, fobs, tokens, keys etc with the one key you’re already carrying - your smartphone. We’re already making inroads to the B2B market but we have a long way to go and must expand our team to ship more features.

To fulfil our vision, we manufacture hardware that can control any electronic lock and a powerful software platform in the Cloud to glue everything together.

We're using the latest and greatest technology to build a highly resilient platform for controlling our hardware. Our stack consists primarily of Java, AWS and Cassandra. You must be passionate, demonstrate a desire to learn and grow quickly - you'll play a key role in shaping the future of Doordeck!

REQUIREMENTS

* 3+ years experience building Java backend applications
* Experience with AWS services
* Experience with asymmetric/symmetric cryptography, digital signatures
* Preferably experience with Cassandra
* Preferably experience with Ansible

items.title: Full Stack Developer (Mid-Weight)
items.content:
*About Us:*

"Staff Heroes":http://www.staffheroes.co.uk is an on-demand temporary staffing for businesses, think the Uber model for Temp Staffing. Through our web and app booking platform a business can find staff for short temporary roles (in as little as 1.5 hours). Our platform matches the business’ request to our database of thousands of candidates across London and finds them staff with relevant experience available to work at the desired location.

We are a team of seasoned serial entrepreneurs with backing from experienced advisors & investors from companies such as Shopping.com, eBay, Criteo, mydeco, BBC and Paramount.

*The Location:*
Our offices are in Vauxhall, London – in a modern fun converted Marmite factory.


*About The Role:*

We are looking for an experienced Mid-Weight Full Stack Developer to join our team.

If you have excellent programming skills and a passion for developing applications or improving existing ones, we would like to meet you.

Ultimately, you should be able to develop high quality code and maintain functional and stable web applications to meet our company’s needs.



*Key responsibilities*

• You will work on both the frontend, backend and doing whatever it takes to get things done;
• You are customer focused, enjoy solve problems and creating solutions that delight internal and external customers and you’re hungry to grow with the role as the company expands
• Are comfortable working in an Agile development environment using continuous integration. We use Circle CI for continuous integration.
• Care about producing and shipping high-quality code, using best practices. You’re using TDD and understand the importance of automated testing.
• Thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders from across the business including product, design, marketing, operations and fulfilment to build mission critical features that power the platform



*Required Skills & Experience*

• At least 2 years production quality experience in React and hybrid mobile development (Cordova)
• At least 4 years production quality experience in NodeJS and potentially other backend technologies
• You have an eye for user interface and interaction design
• Experience building REST APIs and a familiarity with GraphQL
• You have evaluated and used a number of hosting and devops platforms
• You’ve working in a fast-growing startup, interacting with both technical and non-technical teams
• You’ve made Open source contributions


This is a unique opportunity to join a fast paced, rapidly growing start-up and be part of the founding team.


*Benefits:*

• Competitive salary
• Stock option plan
• Up to 25 days holiday
• Pension
• Training
• Fun and sociable environment
• Regular socials and team events

items.title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Lead)
items.content:
*About Us:*

"Staff Heroes":http://www.staffheroes.co.uk is an on-demand temporary staffing for businesses, think the Uber model for Temp Staffing. Through our web and app booking platform a business can find staff for short temporary roles (in as little as 1.5 hours). Our platform matches the business’ request to our database of thousands of candidates across London and finds them staff with relevant experience available to work at the desired location.

We are a team of seasoned serial entrepreneurs with backing from experienced advisors & investors from companies such as Shopping.com, eBay, Criteo, mydeco, BBC and Paramount.

*The Location:*
Our offices are in Vauxhall, London – in a modern fun converted Marmite factory.


*About The Role:*

We are looking for an experienced Senior Full Stack Developer/Lead to join our team.

If you have excellent programming skills and a passion for developing applications or improving existing ones, we would like to meet you. As the lead developer you’ll work closely with more junior team members to ensure system consistency and improve user experience.

Ultimately, you should be able to develop high quality code and maintain functional and stable web applications to meet our company’s needs.


*Key responsibilities*

• You will work on both the frontend, backend and doing whatever it takes to get things done;
• You have the ability to prioritise and focus your work and that of junior team members
• You have the ability to articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences
• You are customer focused, enjoy solving problems and creating solutions that delight internal and external customers and you’re hungry to grow with the role as the company expands
• You want to be an integral part of our team and thrive in a collaborative environment
• You are comfortable working in different settings (independently/in a team/with external partners)
• You want to be involved in forming and leading our tech team
• You are comfortable working in an Agile development environment using continuous integration. We use Circle CI for continuous integration.
• Care about producing and shipping high-quality code, using best practices. You’re using TDD and understand the importance of automated testing.
• Thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders from across the business including product, design, marketing, operations and fulfillment to build mission critical features that power the platform


*Required Skills & Experience*

• At least 2 years production quality experience in React and hybrid mobile development (Cordova)
• At least 4 years production quality experience in NodeJS and potentially other backend technologies
• At least 2 years experience at a senior or lead developer role
• You have an eye for user interface and interaction design
• Experience building REST APIs and a familiarity with GraphQL
• You have evaluated and used a number of hosting and devops platforms
• You’ve worked in a fast-growing startup, interacting with both technical and non-technical teams
• You’ve made Open source contributions

This is a unique opportunity to join a fast paced, rapidly growing start-up and be part of the founding team.


*Benefits:*

• Competitive salary
• Stock option plan
• Up to 25 days holiday
• Pension
• Training
• Fun and sociable environment
• Regular socials and team events

items.title: Firmware Developer
items.content:
Opportunity for a talented embedded system firmware developer to join a well-funded London and Bristol based IoT startup focused on residential property tech

ABOUT US

Switchee is a connected homes / IoT start up founded two years ago. We are in commercial trial phase for the first ever smart thermostat designed for landlords and are scaling up our team to meet significant customer demand. We currently have a full-time team of seven. We have a highly capable, academically accomplished and driven hardware, firmware and commercial team and are looking for an outstanding embedded system firmware developer to expand our engineering team.

At the core of our proposition is data, collected through a hardware device we have built in-house, which we use to deliver savings to both residents and landlords. Our first market is UK social housing where we have a social mission to combat fuel poverty. As well as reducing energy bills, we help landlords cut maintenance costs by helping to detect issues such as boiler faults and mould growth.

THE JOB

As a firmware engineer it will be your responsibility to architect, design and implement solutions that run on our hardware platform. The platform comprises sensors, a microcontroller than controls the system and the user’s heating system, advanced communications such as GSM, WiFi and Zigbee and various supporting components. This work is at the core of our business. You will be building on our existing applications developed for a PIC microcontroller and helping to port them to ARM.

We are looking for someone with drive and a creative mind capable of solving complex problems in a neat, simple and reliable fashion. You will work closely with the CTO and Head of Product and alongside our current firmware engineer (as a peer) who specialises in PIC microcontrollers and has written our current applications. A key part of your brief will be to incorporate user feedback into the development of our core offering.

YOU MUST HAVE:

• A desire to work with others in developing complex products
• A passion for writing reliable firmware at pace
• Excellent C, C# or C++ skills
• ARM experience (including RTOS)
• At least 5 years experience coding firmware
• Proven experience in developing for embedded systems
• Hands-on system bring-up, testing, and debugging skills
• An ability to work independently

Bonus Skills:
• PIC microcontroller experience
• A strong academic background (2.1 or above from a leading university)
• Experience working with GSM, WiFi or other WAN communications protocols
• Experience working with Zigbee, ZWave or Sub-GHz local communications protocols
• Experience working in IoT or at the software/hardware interface
• A background in social housing or energy efficiency

WE WILL OFFER

The opportunity to make a massive impact in one of the most exciting property tech startups and:

• A competitive salary
• Options scheme
• Freedom to work flexibly in a way that suits you
• A great team and central London office (Piccadilly Circus)

items.title: MVC Web, Back End & IOS Junior Engineer
items.content:
THE COMPANY

SwipeIn is a Mobile market place that is leading the biggest revolution on the IT recruitment industry for the past 25 years. Launched in 2015, SwipeIn has been backed by some of the most brilliant minds on the recruitment and software industry as well as a selected group of angel investors with key CEO’s and MDs of top Microsoft Partners and Software vendors.

For the past 48 months we have design, architected and marketed a leading Mobile platform that seamlessly matches and connects Software developers and consultants directly to companies over an easy to use mobile app without the need of using recruitment agencies or spending countless hours carpet bombing jobs on web portals.

Our smart and carefully hand-crafted algorithms and Back End services are able to accurately match top consultants and engineers to the right roles and hiring managers in the UK; based on parameters like commuting distance, programming and framework skills and versions, industry expertise and even things like security clearance, helping both companies and talent to significantly reduce time and costs to match, find it each other and hire or be hired.

THE ROLE

We are now on the hunt for special and rare talent and individuals to come and shock the world with us.
This role is for a super ninja Junior to middle engineer, crazy and passionate about crafting mind-blowing and eye popping Web, Back End and IOS services that fit and integrate seamlessly.
Our technology stack is composed of Heroku and Mongo DB connecting to Parse server and providing services over NodeJS to both Native IOS (Objective -C) and Android Native and a recently launched MVC Web platform.
As a Junior/Middle Engineer you will take full responsibility for our Web, Back-End and IOS platforms and work alongside great Android engineers, Product owners and the CEO/COO to deliver new cross platform services for our clients.
You will also help new code get born safe, sound and stable and will work on debugging and continuous integration and release as part of the SwipeIn methodology.

WHAT YOU GET

 Initial Package: £19,000k + 0.25% EQUITY
 Flexibility: 100% flexible/home work (We are a distributed team so you can work from home or from your favourite lounges, pubs, restaurant, the beach, the nightclub, anywhere you like as long as you deliver awesomeness)
 Motivation and decision making: You will work with some of the most brilliant minds in the Software and recruitment industry. You will be able to make strategic decisions on technology stack choices and drive the platform to the technologies that you think might be more sound to ensure future scalability and performance
 Your future: Within 24 months you will move up to middle engineer and increased salary and within 48 months you will move up to Lead engineer, increased salary, team management + Additional 0.25% EQUITY.

Ready to come and shock the world with us?!

You will hear from us within 48 hours if we recognize the key traits of a crazy, passionate and aspiring super ninja SwipeIn engineer, SwipeIn shareholder and world-shocker all-in-one!

items.title: Full Stack Developer (m/f)
items.content:
Have you dreamed of building the future? relayr has become Europe's leading platform for the Internet of Things, enabling the interaction between diverse systems, and creating new scenarios in which we interact with the world around us. If you would like to work with a great team and technology to build the infrastructure for the next generation of connected devices...

Then relayr is the right place for you!

We have a cloud interoperability problem supported by a diverse mix of SDKs and APIs for both IoT hardware and Applications that want to access the data. We also have Gateway software which allows us to create a very dispersed (fog) architecture. We have a strong industrial customer base both in Germany and America, and a mission to invent and create new IoT based solutions.

We are looking to recruit a diverse group to be able to best handle the diverse problems in the emerging market of Internet of Things. Currently we are seeking a *Full Stack Developer* to join our team and be based in our *Berlin* office.

*Your tasks:*

* Help Relayr build the world’s most advanced IoT Cloud Platform
* Design, develop and improve microservices in our cloud platform backend using the newest technologies.
* Work with internal libraries and services to build both prototyped and ready-to-market solutions
* Develop dashboards for visualizing and controlling cloud-connected sensors and systems
* Prototype and iterate quickly
* Engage in architectural discussions
* Collaborate with cloud and hardware teams to give feedback on internal systems and define new features
* Work with UX/UI Designers, QA and DevOps in the development, testing and deployment of services
* Embrace and advocate software engineering best practices

*Your skills:*

* Minimum 3-5 years experience in web engineering
* Significant JavaScript (ES6) experience on backend (NodeJS) and frontend
* Experience with persistence (i.e. Postgres) and messaging (MQTT, AMQP) are a plus
* Knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, UI Frameworks (i.e. ReactJS or Angular), LESS, SASS, WebPack
* Able to work in a structured, test oriented manner with experience in TDD

*We Offer:*

* Flexible office environment
* A diverse and friendly team with people from all over the world, speaking 10+ languages, of all ages and parental-status
* Connecting you with a network of companies and people from around the globe
* A learning environment where you can extend and build upon your skills and interests, as well as knowledge-sharing at our semi-weekly events
* Opportunities to attend events and conferences pertaining to your discipline
* Competitive Salary and Stock Options
* Cool office with free beverages, fresh fruit, a variety of team events, and social activities – we love to hang out and be social!
* We offer the ability to work in a cutting-edge field with the best people in the IoT industry!

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
SuperAwesome (@GoSuperAwesome) is the largest kids digital media platform in the world, reaching over a quarter of a billion kids each month across mobile, web and online video. SuperAwesome’s technology and products power kid-safe advertising, parent-portals and COPPA compliance for hundreds of brands and agencies around the world. Recently named in London’s future 50 (http://futurefifty.com/2017-cohort/), we continue to grow at a fast pace with some of the biggest clients on the planet including Lego, Warner Bros, Hasbro, Spin Master, Nintendo and many others.

We are looking for various developer roles across the company, one of which is to scale the development of our Kids Web Services (KWS). KWS is a platform that allows app & web developers to build safe apps & sites for kids without having to worry about any of the infrastructure and legal complexities behind it. It includes a full parent portal, automatically compliant COPPA data flows, loyalty-club dynamics and many more modules that brands can use on a self-serve basis through a set of dashboards and tools we make available to them.

The role would see you help scale the product and fine-tune all of its self-serve capabilities, making it easy to use for any developer (big or small) wanting to build safe apps for kids. This is a big challenge that allows you to use many cutting-edge technologies such as Docker, ES6, NodeJS and NoSQL in a production environment at scale.

Key Responsibilities

* Take full ownership of the technology powering our Kids Web Services
-- … and make it as easy to use as possible for both developers and non-developers
* Ensure all products are built to an appropriate level of quality for the stage (alpha/beta/production)
* Deliver products using the appropriate agile project management methodology, learning & iterating frequently
* Work with the Product Manager to define the roadmap for any given product and translate this into user stories
* Help grow the team by assisting the whole product team in the hiring of world class developers

Required

* Experience developing large and complex web applications
-- Experience with NodeJS would be a plus
* Comfortable both on the front and the back-end of web applications
-- Experience with AngularJS would be a plus
* Experience developing third-party consumed APIs & SDKs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and/or Docker a plus

Qualities

* You get stuff done.
* You’re a fire-starter, you can clearly demonstrate your ability to be proactive without direct supervision
* You like working in an agile development environment
* Flexible and adaptable, to changing situations and responsibilities

Benefits

* ​Ownership: we trust you to get sh*t done
* Live & learn on the cutting-edge: we want to use the best tools for the job, you won't be stuck using older frameworks
* Never sit still: Yearly swarm weeks at remote locations with the whole team (Portugal is next), Hackdays every quarter and constant innovation across the company lead to real innovation
