items.title: Lead Full Stack Developer
items.content:
_Full stack engineers at Live Better With use combined skills to create & connect systems to deliver amazing customer experiences_

*Our Mission*
At Live Better With we are on a mission to make day-to-day life a little better for the 300m+ people across the world living with long term conditions. Our current focus is Cancer and we connect cancer patients with curated products and services recommended by patients, families, healthcare professionals, charities and our 30,000+ community to address the side effects and symptoms that reduce the quality of their day to day lives. Find us at https://livebetterwith.com/

We are well funded, operating in both in the US (New York) & the UK, scaling rapidly and we are looking for talented developers to join our expanding technology team. This is an opportunity for an ambitious candidate to make a big impact on our business, playing a leading role in technology to help shape the future of our products, services and customer experience to make a difference to the lives of millions of people around the world.


*You'll work on*
Projects spanning end-to-end systems and technologies, designing, testing and shipping high-quality code every day so that we continue to iterate and improve quickly. You’ll build the tools, integrations, processes, automation and experiences that underpin our platform and make our consumer and community experiences truly personalised, user-focused & world-class.


*You may be a good fit if you:*

* Enjoy working on both the frontend, backend and doing whatever it takes to get things done

* You are customer focused, enjoy solve problems and creating solutions that delight internal & external users and you’re hungry to grow with the role as the company expands

* Have good experience in Python & Django. We’ll consider strong candidates with good experience in other languages if you’re enthusiastic about learning Python.

* Are comfortable playing a leading role in a technology team with both frontend and backend developers

* Are comfortable working in an Agile development environment using continuous integration. We use Circle CI for continuous integration.

* Care about producing and shipping high-quality code, using best practices. You’re either using or keen to start using TDD and understand the importance of automated testing.

* Thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders from across the business including product, design, marketing, operations and fulfilment to build mission critical features that power the platform

* Enjoy being part of a team and having fun!


*You’ll stand out if you have experience in:*
* Experience in React / modern front-end and JS frameworks
* Experience in Native mobile development (Android/iOS), scaling system architecture & machine learning
* Knowledge of a functional language such as Haskell, Erlang or Clojure
* You have an eye for user interface & interaction design
* You’ve working in a fast-growing startup, interacting with both technical and non-technical teams
* You’ve made Open source contributions


*Our Technology Stack*
* Python, React.js
* Django Oscar & Postgres
* ElasticSearch
* AWS, AWS Code deploy
* Docker, Ansible or other configuration management tools
* Circle CI for Continuous Integration
* New Relic & Sentry monitoring

We continually evaluate different languages and frameworks for new services and as part of our R&D.

*Benefits*
* Very competitive salary and options dependent on experience
* Join a growing, dynamic, motivated and fun team, where everyone is valued and really want to help people
* Make a big impact in a unique company
* Breakfast & team Pizza!
* Team social events (lunches, drinks after work, team outings)
* We’re modern and use modern SaaS tools! (Slack, CharlieHR, Google Apps)

*Location: Kings Cross, London, UK*

Website - https://livebetterwith.com/
FB - https://www.facebook.com/livebetterwith/

In the news:
Live Better With in Silicon Valley - http://bit.ly/291JzhA
Live Better With Top 100 Startups - http://bit.ly/291Kbnj

items.title: Back-End Developer
items.content:
We are looking for an mid level Back End/Server side Developer to join and lead our small team as one of our first engineering hires. Working alongisde our Front End Developer, you will be hands on within the technology and working towards making our product the best that it can be by solving the challenges we face.

ABOUT STAFFABLY
Staffably is a platform designed to reduce the inefficiencies caused by job boards and agencies, by putting teachers directly in touch with schools and vice versa, providing transparency, efficiency and cost savings. We are changing the way schools are staffed by applying the latest technology and thinking to a keenly felt problem. Our web (and soon mobile) apps are used by teachers to create their profiles, set their preferences and apply for jobs that match their needs. Schools can create their profiles, have access to all the profiles of teachers on the platform, post employment opportunities and get in touch with teachers directly.

THE ROLE
We are looking for an experienced Back-End Developer to work alongside our Front End Developer. Your background will include:

A graduate with a solid understanding of Computer Science principles
Experience of developing fully featured web application servers
A good understanding of authentication in modern web applications
We would also be interested in someone with a Python, PHP, Ruby, Java or similar background who has experience in an equivalent web application framework and is interested in crossing over to NodeJS and Express
Experience or an interest in maintaining a good software development process, and making good use of automated build tools
Building RESTful APIs and exposing endpoints to be consumed by clients
Experience of working with relational databases, particularly PostgreSQL. Some experience or interest in schema design and maintenance.
Comfortable in operating within the AWS cloud environment with the ability to create, maintain and backup both EC2 compute and RDS database instances
Some experience or an interest in using the AWS SDK would be desirable
An interest or experience in monitoring, logging, and metrics, with a view to keeping the company's platform operational and performing well

SKILLS REQUIRED

NodeJS and Express experience
At least 3 years of development experience
Strong skills around back-end development
Someone with side-project interests or an active GitHub profile would be highly desirable
An interest in software engineering best practices, including version control and backup strategies
A desire to gain experience and develop your career in an agile, vibrant startup environment
A self-starter who's happy to absorb unfamiliar technologies and keen to refine their skillset
Someone who can operate with a degree of autonomy and organise their tasks, but keep an eye on the bigger picture.
A good communicator who's keen to be an active participant in the development and success of the Business.
Suited to an Agile environment. The ability to maintain team velocity while adapting to changeable business requirements.


We are a team of awesome people based in central london. Join us and be challenged on a daily basis, while having fun and solving the hardest problems with a hint of social good.

NO CONTRACTORS OR RECRUITERS PLEASE

items.title: Full stack Javascript developer
items.content:
We’re a startup based about to move in to the Alphabeta Building in Shoreditch, London. There are seven people working here. You would be numero eight. But we pack a punch, and with the background, skills and experience of the team, we’re taking on a big challenge: the ‘Housing Crisis’.

We believe that by using technology to crack open the land market like the claws of a prize winning lobster, we’re in the process of making a big business that will uncover the places on which more houses can be built, by a wider range of people. This vision is backed the same investors behind Love Film, TransferWise, Zoopla, Shazaam and Property Partner. Real issues, real tech, underpinned by a real economic opportunity.

We hold it in high importance to build a team. In working for us you’ll be in constant contact with the company founders, so you’ll be in environment where you can learn about the conception of and running of a startup company that is scaling up. More so, you’ll be invited into the vision. Goalposts move all the time, we need help from other bright people that can build on the firm foundations we’ve put in place. This isn’t the average tech role, this is a problem solving role. Adopt our (proverbial) child, and help to mould and grow it. In return, we’ll stretch you and give you the space to thrive.

*So who do we expect you to be?*
* You want to understand a start-up business, the challenges and be proactive in coming up with solutions
* You can work independently to get a project completed, working on all parts of the stack.
* You want to help us make a big business and own part of it

*Responsibilities*
* Plan. We work in an agile way, planning work in fortnightly sprints.
* Build. Build exciting new features based on our unique big property datasets. Create maps and slick interfaces to delight customers.
* Test. Be part of the team, test your own work and help others to ship quality code.
* Learn. We measure and learn from new features that are built.
* Support. We all support the sales team and customer support - goes without saying.
* Organise. Help organise 100 million+ property records so we can build the best property data platform.

*Skills*
* Javascript, front-end frameworks such as Angular, React, Vue
* Node.js & MongoDB
* HTML/CSS
* Test driven Development, unit tests
* Knowledge of git
* Excellent communication skills

*Bonus Points for*
* AWS experience – EB, EC2, SQS, S3.
* Strong knowledge of SQL, relational database experience
* Understanding of ETL (Extract-Transform-Load) data processes
* A computing related degree
* Knowledge of GIS, PostGIS, location based apps
* Knowledge of the property sector

*What we offer*
* A competitive salary
* Equity
* A fun, flexible and friendly working environment
* 25 holiday days per year
* The chance to tackle a problem that has deep social consequences

items.title: Senior Front End Developer
items.content:
ABOUT US
Want to work for one of the UK’s hottest FinTech companies?
MarketInvoice is shaking up the world of business finance. We help ambitious companies grow by providing funding when they need it most, instead of waiting up to 90 days for their customers to pay invoices.
We've funded against over £1 billion worth of invoices, helping thousands of businesses across the country to achieve their goals. Our platform provides a slick user experience and integrates with all the leading accounting software packages, so it's never been easier for businesses to take control of their cash flow.
At MarketInvoice you’ll be solving real life business problems, working with a team of smart and dedicated people. It’s a fast paced environment but it's also a lot of fun, and we’ll give you the support and training you need to thrive. As the company grows, your role will too.

THE ROLE:
The role is to join our team of full stack engineers but with a particular focus on driving forward our frontend technologies and mentoring other engineers modern javascript frameworks.
You will be working in autonomous teams that have the freedom to drive innovation themselves. We have a strong DevOps culture too and believe CI/CD/Testing are the only ways to innovate at scale. You will add value right away with coding, building, testing, deploying, monitoring.
When we say innovation we mean it; every engineer gets one day, every other week to investigate new technologies, expand their knowledge and prototype new ideas or features.

YOUR TECHNICAL ENVIRONMENT:
You’ll be working on our core platform allowing small business to access funding seamlessly through fantastic UX and automation of complex processing such as risk analysis and payment processing.
Our core platform is built in .Net C# and AngularJS (plus some React) but the choice of technology or language is continually evolving. As a Senior Front End Developer you'll take the lead on our Front End, and whilst there are no management responsibilities we would ideally like to see you mentor more junior developers.

REQUIREMENTS
Significant experience with Javascript frameworks such as Angular.js, or React required.
Experience working with C#, ASP .NET MVC
People person. You are energised by a high amount of contact with a wide range of people. You value diversity and are sensitive to different environments & cultures.
Experience mentoring more junior developers
Team ethic. You make change happen by working with & through others.
Can do” attitude - when faced with a business or technical obstacle you will not run and hide. You should be able to describe the issues you’ve encountered, your approach to solving them and your final solution.

BENEFITS
Not only will you have the opportunity to make a huge impact at one of the UK's hottest FinTech companies, you will also have access to:
Day off for your birthday.
25 days annual leave per year.
Enhanced maternity leave
Childcare vouchers
Best-in-class options scheme.
Innovation Days.
Private healthcare.
Half-price gym membership.

items.title: Backend Developer with NodeJS experience
items.content:
Do you want to join a tech startup riding a positive momentum and applying Machine learning in product development? We are currently expanding our technical team to reinforce our market leading position. Do you want to grow professionally and personally in a supportive and open culture? Then join us.

HelloUni is a young team from China, Italy, Spain, Greece and the UK. We are the official provider for the University of Glasgow and Coventry University HelloUni app for marketing and recruiting their prospective applicants.

We are a company with a mission: to make studying abroad easier and more rewarding!

We are revenue generating and currently looking to expand market in China.

Essential:

- Equivalent 2:1 degree or above in Computer Science or related STEM subject.

- Experience using Amazon Web Services (e.g. S3, SNS, DynamoDB, CloudFront, Lambda)

- A good understanding of application layer protocols such as HTTP

- RESTful API development experience

- Experience using relational and nonrelational databases

- A strong will to learn and ability to problem-solve

- Able to work well as part of a team


Desirable:

- Knowledge of Javascript and HTML5

- A good understanding of other application layer protocols such as XMPP, RTMP

- Experienced in NodeJS backend development

- Comfortable using a Linux server and CLi

- Some knowledge about web scraping technology


ICAN Perks:

- Competitive salary and stock options

- Multicultural team, open and honest company culture

- Weekly team lunch/drinks

- Regular knowledge transfer sessions

- Opportunity for international travel

- Office in the heart of Glasgow or London and soon to be China

- Mentored by Microsoft Senior Machine Learning Engineers

items.title: Senior / Mid-level Software Developer
items.content:
We’re looking for an experienced software developer to join our development team at GrowthIntel to build the only machine learning marketing platform of its kind.

As a developer at GrowthIntel you’ll work on a range of cutting edge tech in a fast paced agile environment. As the 7th member of the dev team, you’ll have a real impact on the business - working on everything from data engineering to DevOps and web app development. You'll be involved in planning work to meet customer requirements which you yourself will have gathered. You'll contribute to the product roadmap and be encouraged to help improve and refine our agile methodology.

*Who are GrowthIntel?*

GrowthIntel is a VC-funded marketing technology company based in London. We’re the only UK company using machine learning and web-crawled data to build a B2B marketing recommendation system. We’re six years old, with a team of 11 people, including six on the development team. We’re a friendly bunch with a broad range of experience - we put emphasis on sharing knowledge and supporting each other in personal growth.

*Our tech*

Area’s you’ll be directly involved in:

* Frontend UI / UX
* Web app development
* DevOps
* Web crawling
* Machine learning systems
* Large scale data processing

Specific Technologies we work with:

* Python (incl. pandas, scikit-learn, flask, luigi)
* Javascript (ReactJS)
* AWS
* Apache Spark
* MySQL
* Elasticsearch

*What we're looking for:*

* 3+ years commercial experience in a dev team working in Python (ideally) or a core enterprise class language (ie C++, C#, Java, Scala)
* Interest and (ideally) commercial experience in other languages (e.g. Javascript) or programming paradigms
* Experience with data modelling - e.g. applications backed by relational databases
* A track record of delivering against business objectives
* First or Upper Second Class Degree in a numerate subject
* Native or fluent English speaker
* Based in / can relocate to London

*It'd be great if you:*

* Have experience with NoSQL databases
* Have independently managed & delivered projects
* Are engaged in the wider tech community (organising/presenting at meetups, tech conferences, contributions to open source)
* Have mentored more junior team members in best software development practice

*Perks*

* Meals, games, outings and parties with the team
* Hack-days every 6 weeks
* Trendy co-working office space in a converted book-binding factory
* Free breakfasts every fortnight
* Free drinks at our all-hands every two weeks
* Health and dental cover

GrowthIntel is dedicated to equality of opportunity in all areas of its work. All individuals will be treated in a fair and equal manner and in accordance with the law regardless of gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation.

items.title: Front End Lead
items.content:
goHenry is a digital banking solution based in London with a mission to make the next generation of young people better at managing money than the last. We have recently raised £4 million in a Crowdcube campaign making it the most equity raised from the crowd ever. To help with our growth we’re now looking for a Senior Front-End Web Developer to come on our journey with us.

*About the role*

We need an excellent Angular 2 Front-End Technical Lead to join our development team and help shape the future of an exciting, fast growing and dynamic application. Minimum 2/3 years Professional / Practical experience with developing and designing websites is required.

*The successful person will have:*

● Degree in Computer Science or related field
● Excellent knowledge of Angular 2, Typescript, Javascript
● Excellent knowledge of HTML5, CSS, LESS, SASS and Ajax
● Excellent knowledge of Responsive design and development
● Practical experience with JavaScript Libraries and MVC patterns
● Excellent knowledge/awareness of usability, accessibility, cross-browser issues and solutions
● Good knowledge of packages such as Photoshop and Illustrator
● Experience in developing with APIs (SOAP/REST, XML, JSON …)
● Experience of PHP / Back-End technologies is a nice to have
● Experience in WordPress
● Knowledge of GIT or other Source Code control systems

But most importantly, we’re looking for the right person. We are looking for someone who is looking for a challenge and who wants to be part of something special that is growing rapidly.

*We're looking for someone who will...*

• Be imaginative, creative and will have a knack for problem solving
• Be a natural leader: there is opportunity to grow and lead the team
• Have a proactive attitude and be willing to own problems and find solutions
• Be able to think holistically and long term about their code, taking into account future development of the application and scalability etc
• Be able to work with minimal direction, yet also to work in a team environment
• Be passionate about web technologies
• Have a desire be a part of something new, exciting and innovative

items.title: Technology Lead / Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
Location: near Birmingham Airport (with UK and overseas travel)
Includes: Benefits – 10% bonus, pension, life assurance and corporate discounts
Salary: to £50k

We are Park-IT; a growing parking software company which works across the UK’s major airports helping to track over 1 million cars a year. Founded in 2014, we are a team of 14 talented and smart individuals reinventing the way operators view their parking assets and giving customers peace of mind whilst they are on holiday.

We’re an innovative and entrepreneurial start-up business with exciting expansion opportunities on the horizon. Backed by our parent company, Holiday Extras a Sunday Times Best Company to work our, Developers across the group have the opportunity to work on exciting challenges in the world of tech, whilst providing a fantastic environment in which to work.

Based at our Birmingham HQ, close to Birmingham Airport, we are looking for a talented Technical Lead to join our team and make a major contribution to our success.

What we’re offering…
You’ll lead our newly formed development team and will be responsible for delivering robust and performant solutions across our platform. You will have the freedom to deliver the best solution for the challenges the business puts in front of you and will be given the resources and time you need to get the job done.

Our stack consists of Javascript, NodeJS (Express), React, Sequelize and MySQL and we will continue to always use the best technologies for the purposes of our work.

Your Responsibilities:
* This is hands-on development role. The Technology Lead will be expected to delve into technical detail and act primarily in a development capacity while making time provisions to carry out necessary team management tasks
* Lead software delivery in a cross-functional team including matrix-organised reports within an agile product delivery environment
* Carry out recruitment for software engineers and maintain high level selection criteria
* Work with the Product Owner to establish a roadmap of concrete deliverables and make sure the roadmap is delivered
* Establish strong relationships with business stakeholders to understand business requirements
* Use best software engineering practices to ensure delivery on team commitments
* Frequently report on team delivery performance to senior management. Be transparent about team challenges and proactively communicate risks to all levels
* Encourage a supportive culture where people are allowed to make mistakes but also learn from them
* Promote the culture of autonomy and responsibility within the delivery team
* Keep strong ties with key senior technology staff in other group businesses and make sure communication is fluent and interactions are managed well and common goals are met
* Responsibility to design and execute of the technical architecture roadmap

What we’re looking for:
* Experience working as a senior software engineer in a technology business
* Strong knowledge of the technical architecture of SaaS applications, real-time data-management systems and software components such as data stores, application middleware, APIs, UIs, distributed caching and messaging
* Strong leadership capability with some exposure to management
* Extensive programming experience, ideally in Javascript/Node.js
* Experience of API design and shipping of HTTP Services.
* Demonstrated experience building highly scalable distributed web applications
* Github profile and (ideally) open source contributions.
* Examples of a pragmatic approach to software delivery, understanding the pros (and cons) of shipping early and often.

Desirable
* Experience with React (including native), Redux, Express, Sequelize, MySQL, AWS, Docker, Convox

items.title: Senior Software Engineer For Social Impact
items.content:
Are you a Senior Software Engineer who is interested in joining a successful start-up?

We are Worktu. The social impact venture that is changing the way schools hire teachers. Backed by Bethnal Green Ventures and recently being praised for our innovative solution by the Department for Education, we are disrupting the education recruitment industry and we are looking for our next hire, a software engineer.

You will play an important part in the company’s continued success. We’re looking for people who have experience in relational database structures and understand design patterns used in frameworks like React & Angular but you’re not tied to any one thing. If successful, you will be working from the co-working space in Central London with the option to work remotely when required.

You would have had previous experience or interest of working with the following modern stack and tools; Heroku, Codeship, AWS, Postgres, React, JIRA or Slack.

Working with customers and the tech team, you will be able to create products that are solving key problems in the education system and are making a huge social impact.

Technical Knowledge of at least two of the following:

AngularJS

Nodejs

Mongo DB

Relational Database Structures

React

Benefits:

Use of modern tools and training.

Offer flexible hours and remote working.

Share Options.

20 days holidays.

If you are ready to join our social impact venture and have at least 2 - 3 years industry experience then we would be glad to hear from you! Please provide a detailed covering letter and an up to date CV.

Skype interview followed by in-person interview. Job vacancy to commence end of April 2017.

items.title: Junior Web Developer
items.content:
Junior Web Developer wanted for exciting Aviation startup. Autoflight is the world’s most innovative electronic logbook for pilots. The concept behind our new product is a first of its kind, revolutionising the pilot logbook industry.

THE PROJECT
To redesign the website with a more fresh look and feel for our customers. You can work from home with hours that suit you, provided that a minimum number of hours is fulfilled. Full details and specification will be provided upon commencement of the project.

WHAT WE LOOK FOR
Creative, fun, driven and passionate people looking to gain essential experience to move their career forward quickly. You should have knowledge and/or experience with HTML5, CSS3, PHP and AJAX.

WHAT WE OFFER
We understand this may be completed around your studies. We recognise that you will want to gain experience to enhance your graduate CV, therefore Autoflight will provide you with a competitive package whilst you study. Equity offers will be made to exceptional candidates.

Kickstart your career now by gaining invaluable experience. To apply or ask a question, email a CV and covering letter.

items.title: UX Expert
items.content:
**** Please No Recruitment Agencies *****

Gamar is the world's first 3D augmented reality platform which allows anyone to create their own games and fun tours that interact with the world around us. We are creating an epic disruption in the culture, tourism and leisure industries where it has increased engagement over 100 times and thus encouraged higher footfall.

Our clients include top brands like Merlin Entertainment, DHX Media, The British Museum and many other brands, theme parks, castles, museums and sports stadiums. Join Gamar to change the way people engage in the local attractions, whilst creating great memories!

We are looking for a talented User Experience Manger who is an expert in branding, messaging, web and app world.

*Our Challenges:*
* Gamar's biggest challenge is, we are a B2B2C company and this is posing us a lot of challenges in terms of messaging and branding
* Our technology is pretty new and unique and this has to be explained easily and in simple words
* We created a platform and ecosystem and not a product
* Our platform is interacting with the real world around us, so, it is not just another digital app

*We need someone who has solved such complex challenges already!*

*Essential Requirements:*
* Highly talented UX designer with 5+ years agency experience
* Outstanding portfolio showcasing high-impact user experience design across multi-platforms for desktop, mobile, tablet and apps
* Bring lots of inspiration to the team through innovative design approaches
* Well versed in design research, user experience design processes and methodology, its value and how to integrate it into work
* Be able to work across a diverse number of projects and keep within tight deadlines
* Expert at developing and crafting wireframes, user flows, experience maps and prototypes
* Responsible for maintaining quality right through all phases of design process

*Competitive package offered depending on the experience. This is a 6-month contract with a possibility to become full time.*
*You should be available immediately to start.*
*Apply now!*

items.title: Junior App Developer
items.content:
Junior App Developer wanted for exciting Aviation startup. Autoflight is the world’s most innovative electronic logbook for pilots. The concept behind our new product is a first of its kind, revolutionising the pilot logbook industry.

THE PROJECT
Design a location based app for our members. You can work from home with hours that suit you, provided that a minimum number of hours is fulfilled. Full details and app specification will be provided upon commencement of the project.

WHAT WE LOOK FOR
Creative, fun, driven and passionate people looking to gain essential experience to move their career forward quickly. You should have knowledge and/or experience with Apple Xcode.

WHAT WE OFFER
This is a paid position and we understand this may be completed around your studies. We recognise that you will want to gain experience to enhance your graduate CV, therefore Autoflight will provide you with a competitive package whilst you study. Equity offers will be made to exceptional candidates.

Kickstart your career now by gaining invaluable experience. To apply or ask a question, email a CV and covering letter.

items.title: Strategic Business Development Lead
items.content:
*ABOUT US*

MarketInvoice is the VC-backed peer-to-peer fintech platform that’s building the modern backbone of the economy.

Imagine you’re a young company who’s just won a major contract but your client wants to pay you on 90 day terms when you need to pay your staff and suppliers upfront. That’s where we step in. Our platform uses the peer-to-peer approach to provide the day-to-day operational financing for companies as varied as mobile development agencies, food brands and care homes.

We’re the largest start-up in our space worldwide and already lending £50 million/month to small businesses and on track to double that within the next year.

It’s a £100bn/year market which is dominated by legacy lenders and banks with complex processes and shady practices.

We’re bringing transparency and simplicity to the market.

We’re a data driven tech company disrupting banks in the same way Spotify re-defined the music industry (we actually share the same investors).

*THE ROLE*

You'll be leading the sourcing, managing and executing strategic partnerships geared towards scalable distribution of our funding products for businesses. Some examples of our partnerships to date include partnering with leading e-accountancy businesses and local councils.

As a marketing team member, you’ll work across multiple teams such as sales, product, marketing and technology, and you’ll have the opportunity of working directly with the founder CEO on rolling out these partnerships. This role offers the right candidate an exciting opportunity to step-change our growth rate.

Our values matter and as part of the team, they will be yours too…

#MakeItHappen | #1Team1Dream | #AlwaysBeLearning

*WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING*

Business Development strategy: Identify, source and prioritise the types of partnerships that MarketInvoice should be focusing on and potential collaborators within each vertical. Figure out which partners could help us improve our product offering, to open up new types of users.

Business development: Lead the identification of decision makers and reach out to potential partners. Use your network and know-how to take your ideas and proposals to the people that matter, in some of the world’s biggest and most high-profile organisations.

Pitching: Sell proposed partnerships at the highest levels. This will involve winning deals in high pressured, highly competitive environments.

Execution: Drive and deliver a project all the way from concept to reality. Pulling together the relevant internal and external teams that are required to bring a potential partnership to life.

*ABOUT YOU*

*Commercial acumen:* The ability to structure commercial agreements with potential partners. An ability to spot an opportunity and structure a partnership in a manner that makes great sense and solves problems for both parties.

*Brilliant presentation skills:* Clearly laying out your ideas to people at the very highest levels of major organisations.

*Leadership:* You are a hands-on leader. Someone who can see the bigger picture but also stay very close to the details.

*Project management:* The ability to set a smart strategy and execute flawlessly. Being able to pull together various teams and people in order to deliver your objectives will be crucial.
Communication skills: The ability to skilfully articulate your plans and ideas both inside and outside of the organisation.

*Tenacity:* The ability to stay the course and see a project through to fruition. Overcoming hurdles that arise along the way and having the vision and conviction to deliver something truly meaningful for the company

*BENEFITS*

*An excellent remuneration and benefits package

*Best in class share options scheme

*Regular performance review and extra options / compensation for strong performance

*Enhanced maternity pay

*Childcare vouchers

*Amazon Kindle and unlimited e-books

*Private health coverage and half price Virgin Active gym membership

*25 days of annual leave per year, plus your birthday off

*A great office (complete with roof terrace, ping pong, table football and beer fridge) in the heart of Shoreditch

*Breakfast & snacks

*Innovation days

*A company culture that actively encourages career progression!!


*If this amazing role excites you, then get in touch asap!*

"Hear from our Co-Founder & CEO, Anil Stocker, on his favourite MarketInvoice moment":https://medium.com/@anilstocker/my-favourite-moment-as-a-business-founder-ff99fd4f51aa#.rjbe2sidc

items.title: Startup Mentors
items.content:
YouShore is a specialist company in Social Media Marketing and Analytics. Our proprietary engine combines the power of natural language processing, statistical modelling and artificial intelligence, enabling us to understand the (very slightly different) personalities of each social media user in extremely granular details. We currently work with Omnicom and WPP, two of the world's biggest adverting agencies, and help their corporate clients to identify, acquire and analyse the target audience on social media.

We also have exclusive access to a rank of social media influencers with just under 0.5million followers combined.

So far our services have only been available to big corporations and we want to make them available to startup companies by launching YouShore Labs, a marketing accelerator programme. We are now looking for seaonsoned enterpreneurs/mentors to work with us to launch YouShore Labs. If you love to work with early-stage startups and help them make a difference in their very first attempt to market, please get in touch.

items.title: Performance Marketing Lead
items.content:
Who are we?

Cudoni is the most convenient way for busy people to sell their unwanted luxury fashion goods.

Our premium offering is tailored to suit those who are time-poor, and our clients expect only the best user experience around.

You can expect to work directly with luxury brands, high net worth individuals and high-end retailers.

Why join us?

1) This is an excellent opportunity to work in a hands-on role with a funded start-up which is rapidly growing. You can expect quick career progression as we scale if you’re able to deliver results.
2) We have an award-winning founder and team, and our investors have built some of the biggest brands on the planet.
3) We have featured in numerous publications and on television – you can expect great exposure whilst you’re with us.
4) We have been through three incubator and accelerator programs; the last of which is recognised as being one of Europe’s top three.
5) Most importantly, we’re an exciting place to work. We like to mix-in drinks and laughs with hard-work and results. There is never a dull moment in our office!

What’s the role?

We’re looking for someone to head-up our performance marketing. You’ll be key to our growth efforts.

You will be a technical problem-solver who can use analytical insights to enhance on-site performance and average order value.

This is a brilliant opportunity to immerse yourself in the world of luxury, and to lead a growing brand with international ambitions on the front-line. You will be solving a genuine problem for people who lack time, in a way that no business has been able to before.

What responsibilities can you expect?

• Produce insights on the fashion re-sale market, competitors, market share and opportunities to drive key strategic decisions.
• Based on your research, planning budget allocation across key digital channels.
• Defining and executing against KPIs
• Creating and managing campaigns; both acquisition and retention.
• Reporting strategic insights and key metrics (e.g. CAC, CPL, LTV) to the CEO and advisors.

What skills and qualities do we require?

• Relevant work experience in a marketing role, having ideally had some experience in the luxury and/or fashion spaces.
• Experience with paid search, social media and retargeting. We’re keen to see evidence of past successes.
• Analytically-minded. Experience with CRO, LTV Optimisation, campaign planning and execution.
• Autonomous in approach, competitive, hard-working and enthusiastic.
• Strong communication skills and able to effectively convey our brand image. A high standard of written and spoken English is essential.

What can you expect to Cudoni?

• A competitive salary.
• Shares in the business.
• A very sociable and interactive office environment.
• Regular team activities and away-days.
• Highly qualified and ambitious teammates.

How can I apply to Cudoni?

Please send us your CV along with a covering email explaining why you’d like to come and work with us!

www.Cudoni.com

items.title: Digital Marketing Lead at Award-Winning Startup (Funded)
items.content:
HowNow is a global platform that enables experts to teach learners anywhere in the world over live, interactive video chat. There are millions of people with expertise around the world that could be teaching and millions more who do not have access to high quality teaching. Backed by Mark Pearson (Founder of MyVoucherCodes) and Tennis Star Andy Murray, HowNow are bringing these people together, beyond borders, and changing the way the world learns.

We’re looking for a creative, ambitious and data-driven digital marketing extraordinaire with expertise and experience in user acquisition and growth hacking.

*What you’ll be doing*

• User Acquisition – Hack our customer and supplier growth using innovative and lean strategies. This involves planning, creating and implementing marketing campaigns across various acquisition channels.
• Reporting – You love data and making sense of it is your forte. From Cohort Analysis to Database Segmentation, you’ll be able to continuously test, report and optimise your campaigns.
• Paid Advertising – Creating, managing and optimising PPC and Social Media advertising campaigns.
• Working with Designer and Community Manager to create artwork, engage the customers and develop new business.
• Setting up and managing Brand Ambassador programs
• Affiliate marketing

*What skills you need*

• You’ve got experience and expertise in user acquisition, growth hacking as well as strong analytical and numerical skills to be able to extract insights from data.
• You have a great understanding of CPO, CPA, CPC, CPM, CTR and everything else in between, with the ability to report clearly and concisely.
• You know how to manage paid advertising across channels such as Facebook, Google Adwords, etc.
• Email management and optimisation
• A good understanding and experience of successful SEO
• Marketplace and Edtech experience as well as graphic design skills would be a bonus
• Highly motivated, autonomous with entrepreneurial flair
• A history of working hard and getting results.
• A love for trying new experiences is a MUST HAVE!

*What you get*

• A competitive salary with commission
• Work directly with the founders who have built a startup that has been awarded Business of the Year, named Top 100 Startup in the UK and have been recognised by Virgin Media Business as one of the most innovative founders in the UK.
• Generous perks and holidays
• Consideration for share options
• Work with a passionate team of hustlers changing the way the world learns.
• The satisfaction of building something that matters and spending your time in a meaningful way.

If reading this post has got your excited, send us a message with your CV, a bit about yourself and why you’re applying.

items.title: Production Lead - China and Vietnam
items.content:
The Production team is focused on getting our beautifully designed furniture products from our workshops to the UK in pristine quality and on time.

You are our eyes and ears on the ground, working closely with our suppliers in China and Vietnam as well as Production, Buying and Design teams in London.

You are an excellent communicator are happy to work independently and remotely. Once your training is complete in London, you'll spend the majority of your time in Asia with quarterly trips back to the UK.

You are an excellent Production Lead and work tirelessly to ensure Swoons distinctive furniture is delivered with exceptional quality.

You'll be extremely pro-active in communicating the status of every container in production and ensure pre-production meetings and QC schedules facilitate on-time delivery.

Your responsibility doesn't end with the product. Packaging needs to be thoroughly spec'd to avoid damage in transit, with accurate information and branding on the box and in assembly kits and instructions

NOTE: This position is only open to candidates with the right to work in the UK. Accommodation is provided in Vietnam for this role

RESPONSIBILITIES
* Hold monthly Performance and Pre Production meetings with each supplier
* Develop production transparency to enhance understanding of our supply chain
* Ensure product development timelines and original ex-factory dates are met
* Hold Quality Control Audits and review Swoon products on the production line, post production and packaged - to ensure product accuracy and product quality
* Enforce a zero tolerance policy for any items that do not meet Swoon quality expectation
* Feed in product quality learnings and proactively problem solve future batch improvement
* Perform packaging drop tests and revise packaging specifications to reduce transit issues
* Work closely with the Design and Buying team to ensure all products meet technical, safety and legal requirements
* Develop and maintain Supplier Manuals, Defect Classification list and other QC reference docs
* Source new suppliers for Swoon to work with in the region and complete the onboarding process in advance of order placement

REQUIREMENTS
* You have an impressive eye for detail
* You have knowledge of product technologies relevant to the furniture sector
* You are quick to react to production changes and take appropriate action
* You are a fast learner and enjoy a challenge
* You are process orientated
* You revel in a fast paced environment
* You have a positive attitude

items.title: Sustainability Business Developer
items.content:
We are looking for a remote Business Development Executive with an entrepreneurial spirit and focus to become part of our young team. Our focus is to help industries become more sustainable and introduce new technologies to the market. Hence, you will have a unique challenge to bring our services to the teams around the world that need them, achieving product commercialization and growth. Key responsibilities relate to business development and sales.

Your missions:
-Identify new leads, key players and potential opportunities
-Manage pipeline of projects
-Manage client relationships
-Conduct research
-Perform some analyses

Requirements
-University degree
-Strong time & project management skills
-Prior experience in sales (good to have)
-Fluent English, additional languages a plus

Initial focus is on Europe and Asia, thus language proficiency is most welcome. This role is on a commission-only basis. You can send us your application here or via email. Please include a recent cv, a paragraph about yourself and why you're applying. Sustainability plays a big role in role what we so it would be good if you are familiar with this field. We encourage applications from university graduates as well.

items.title: Business Development
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

Hubble is on a mission to find the perfect home for every company. We’ve built an online marketplace to help businesses rent, manage and share office space in London. But this is just the beginning. The commercial property sector hasn’t kept up with the needs of new companies and still works like it did 20 years ago. Our vision is to completely transform the way commercial property is transacted, managed and financed.

You will lead our efforts to build partnerships with our flexible office provider clients, both big and small, and build disruptive products for the industry. A key problem solver for the business internally and externally, you will be working directly with the founders to impact our global flexible office strategy.

The role will vary day to day and will include, but not be limited to: relationship building with the flexible office sector; market analysis; advising clients on flexible & managed office requirements; and working closely with the product teams to build disruptive technology for flexible office providers.

You should be willing to get stuck in, with a very ‘hands-on’ approach and work autonomously in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment. You’ll need to be able to build, lead and communicate with cross functional teams from marketing to engineering.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyse our data to identify gaps in our supply, and source and grow partnerships with flexible office providers to fill these gaps and drive liquidity for the business
Lead on our international expansion efforts
Manage day to day relationships with Hubble’s flexible office clients to ensure smooth operational processes
Become a trusted advisor to Hubble’s larger flexible and managed office clients
Work closely with new flexible office market entrants to help them advertise, sell and manage their space using Hubble’s software
Build Hubble’s presence within the flexible office sector via branding, partnership and PR opportunities
Work closely with the product team to build disruptive technologies for the flexible office sector

REQUIREMENTS

Experience in business development, account management or sales in a technology startup environment, or in the commercial property sector
Experience of launching international markets
Self-starter with ability to execute in high-pressure environments
Strong interpersonal skills; the ability to build rapport and long-lasting professional relationships
Confident public speaker with an outgoing personality
Tech literate and a frequent user and embracer of new technologies
Demonstrable experience in challenging the status quo or thinking critically about how old methods of working can be disrupted by technology
Experience in managing projects and small teams

BENEFITS

We make sure everyone in the team is comfortable and has the best environment for them. We offer flexible hours, remote working and have a relaxed attitude to taking holiday - focusing only on whether work gets done. Benefits are optional and can be tweaked on an individual basis depending on what makes you most productive. Here are some of the things we offer:

Remuneration competitive with industry and level of experience.
Equity options.
Macbook, dual monitors + peripherals, standing desk.
Expense budget & travel.
Noise-cancelling headphones.
Spotify Premium or Apple Music.
Kindle Unlimited + free technical books.
Health & Pension.
Cycle to Work scheme.
Additionally, being part of Entrepreneur First, 500 startups and Seedcamp gives us (and you) access to a vibrant startup community, office hours and talks with industry experts.

ABOUT HUBBLE

Hubble is backed by top venture capital firms Entrepreneur First, Seedcamp and 500 startups, and property tech specialists Spire Ventures (PiLabs). Hubble’s investors and advisors include founders & C-level including James Caan (Dragon’s Den and serial entrepreneur), Rohan Silva (Second Home, Former Policy Advisor to the Prime Minister), Jackson Hull (Student.com, Onefinestay), Brett Akker (Zipcar, Lovespace), Jonathan Galore (Wonga, Silverlake Partners) etc.

Hubble is an equal opportunities employer. We are a diverse bunch of people who are committed to maintaining a welcoming culture of inclusion and equality. We encourage applications from anyone that meets the requirements for the role.

items.title: Business Development Associate
items.content:
*About GuestReady*

We’re GuestReady – a global short-term and vacation-rental management company! We provide professional services to real estate investors, hosts, as well as guests. Featured in TechCrunch (http://tcrn.ch/2hyXAKc), our mission is to take the hassle out of short-term rentals. Any operations that are related to turning over guests and optimise listings to incur a maximum yield for the host are handled by us.

GuestReady is co-founded by seasoned entrepreneurs and operates in Europe and Asia. We’re well funded, growing incredibly fast, have big ambitions and we are now looking for a motivated and bright Account Executive to join our team in London.


*The Role*

This is an amazing opportunity for someone bright and ambitious to join a successful startup and to take real responsibility for building our Account Management function from scratch. You’ll have plenty of support from the City Manager as well as the CEO – plus you’ll be able to get involved in Operations and Sales too.

Your role will be to build and maintain long-lasting relationships with our clients.

* Operate as the lead point of contact for any and all matters specific to your client
* Providing the highest level of customer service whilst resolving problems and enquiries
* On-boarding our properties and building trust with our clients from the very beginning
* Working cross-functionally within the company to develop process and improve client satisfaction
* Solving challenging internal and external issues when things go wrong
* Immersing yourself in the company and building knowledge of our evolving product
* Ensuring feedback flows from your team to the relevant business and product partners
* Ad-hoc reporting and admin tasks


*The Candidate*

* A multi-tasking individual, who is organised and able to manage time efficiently
* A dynamic self-starter with an extroverted personality and a proactive attitude
* Friendly, polite, articulate, personable and detail oriented with strong focus on quality
* Capable of building a rapport with just about anyone and have excellent relationship-building skills
* You truly value customer satisfaction and put it at the heart of your work
* Passion for working in a startup and not scared to get your hands dirty (literally)


*The Perks*

* Work with multicultural and multiracial team members
* Fun & casual working atmosphere with an international mindset
* A team of experienced entrepreneurs who have successfully built companies before
* A dynamic work environment with flat hierarchies and space for your own ideas


To apply for the role, please send us:

* A link to your LinkedIn profile
* Your CV
* One paragraph on why this role is exciting and why you would be good at it (max. 200 words)

items.title: Business Developer
items.content:
*About Polydone*

Polydone is a startup company based in London. Our flagship product (www.polydone.com) is a project management platform aimed at medium to large businesses who are looking to better manage their projects, tasks and teams via Agile.
We have been around for 1 year, we’re funded, we have revenue and we’re growing fast.
As we close more and more customers, we are looking for a business developer to extend our business even further and even faster.

*Job Description*

As Polydone’s first Business Developer (apart from the founders), your role will consist of building new relationships with potential customers, close new customers and maintain relationships with existing customers.
Polydone’s customers include, software companies, marketing agencies, gaming companies, creative agencies, and more. You will be engaging on a regular basis with decision makers, C-Level officers and managers in large companies such as project and product managers.
You will meet on a daily basis with Polydone’s CEO to discuss progress and once a week with the rest of the team to discuss strategy, product, roadmap, sales, etc.

*Responsibilities*

* Source and engage with businesses that have 100 - 1,000 employees (emails, phone, in-person)
* Manage your own pipeline, meet with customers, run presentations and demos of our product
* Close sales
* Maintain relationships with existing customers
* Work on sales strategy with the rest of the team and discuss product benefits / features as you learn about new requirements from our customers

*Requirements*

* 5+ years of experience in Business Development or Sales, of which at least 1 full year selling B2B, ideally SaaS
* Experience sourcing new customers, building relationships and closing deals
* Fantastic communication skills
* Competitive when selling but a team player inside Polydone (bullies and divas need not apply)
* Driven, self-motivated, persuasive but not pushy (we’re establishing long-term relationships with our customers, not making a quick buck and running away)
* Ambition to move up to a C-Level position, grow Polydone and become a millionaire in the next 4 to 5 years.
* Must have enough savings to be motivated by higher shares and lower initial salary for the first 3 months
* Bonus points for previous experience in startups and experience with project management tools

Note: this position is highly suited for an entrepreneur who has built and grown or tried to build a company or two.

*Benefits*

* Salary + bonus + shares (up to 10%)
* Flexible hours
* Work from anywhere
* Opportunity to grow into C-Level position

items.title: Acquisition Specialist
items.content:
*About Route1*

Route1, an award winning app that provides a quick and easy alternative to recruiters and job boards and costs companies significantly less. We are focussing on legal recruitment before expanding in to other verticals. 

Launched in the UK in May 2016 and Australia in September 2016, we work alongside some of the world's largest law firms, including Clifford Chance, Linklaters, DLA Piper, Herbert Smith Freehills and Norton Rose Fulbright, and currently have over 7,000 lawyers using the app.

We're a small team at the start of a long journey, we have big ambitions to permanently change the way people hire and get hired. Find out more about us at www.route1.co

*The Job*

We are looking to add an outgoing and engaging team member to be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with our rapidly growing candidate and employer networks.  Existing, strong, recruitment-based relationships with London law firms and in-house legal departments is required. 

This exciting new role is flexible in terms of both work schedule and location and is available for an immediate start. Remuneration is commission-based and includes options.

items.title: Customer Care Team Lead
items.content:
Our Customer Care team are at the heart of our business and the first port of call for our customers. Whether they’re looking for advice on the perfect piece, or seeking to help with a delivery that’s gone wrong, you’ll be the face (and voice) of Swoon Editions to each and every enquiry we receive – over the phone, email and on social media.

In the Customer Care Team Lead role, you’ll not just manage and resolve customer enquiries but also play a pivotal role in helping to design innovative solutions to prevent them, working with all areas of our business.

Reporting to the Head of Care, you’ll be managing a growing team, digging into customer data and identifying opportunities to improve the systems and processes that drive truly great customer experiences.

RESPONSIBILITIES

* Day to day operational and performance management of the customer service team against agreed KPIs and SLAs
* Designing innovative tech-led solutions and processes to improve and drive continual improvement within the customer service experience
* Resolving and managing the volume of customer issues and complaints, including timely follow-ups and customer escalations
* Providing timely and regular reporting on all appropriate elements of the team performance and customer contacts
* Assisting the Head of Care with the recruitment and training of new hires, identifying any knowledge gaps.
* Organising the team - ensuring rotas, annual leave, training and coaching are all planned in advance
* Leading effective performance management of the team and ongoing skills development, through 121s, weekly team meetings and training sessions
* Learning about (and selling!) our Editions

REQUIREMENTS

* You’re a natural leader with a passion for brilliant customer service and possess a positive can- do attitude
* You are a self-starter who has experience of working in customer service (desirable)
* You have a graduate degree in any discipline (desirable)
* You understand how to manage and motivate a team of care advisers to deliver a next level of customer service and ensure they have the skills and confidence to take ownership of every customer interaction
* You have exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* You are results focused with the ability to identify route of a problem and how to solve
* You are an analytical thinker with the ability to work independently using your own initiative
* You understand how to analyse and interpret customer data and reports, as well as to present and summarise findings

items.title: Business Development Internship
items.content:
ABOUT US

Festicket is transforming the way music fans discover and book tickets and travel packages for festivals around the world. Our platform revolutionises the music festival industry by offering an end-to-end experience for music travellers through an efficient two-sided marketplace for 500+ music festivals across 40 different countries! In three short years, we have become Europe's largest music festival platform.

Furthermore, we've announced Series B funding - https://techcrunch.com/2016/06/30/festicket-let-it... - and now we're looking to grow the Festicket Family!

YOUR ROLE
Festicket is looking for talented Business Development Intern to support our commercial / business development team. You will be responsible for maintaining our event / music festivals client database as well as supporting the development of new businesses. You will be supporting the Business Development Managers, in day to day work and taking care of all the administrative takes of the ‘extras’ team which are responsible for the additional products/services Festicket offers 

This is a great opportunity to learn in a fast-paced environment, and a chance to building strong analytical and commercial skills.

REQUIREMENTS
* Experience / interest in sales, business development, partnerships or commercial development
* Have a confident telephone manner
* Demonstrate an ability to manage projects, focus on achieving objectives, adjust priorities, manage time and follow up on actions
* Show an ability to work autonomously and be able to take responsibility beyond scope of role
* Actively look for new solutions and create new ideas regarding the on-going commercial development.
* Be aware of and take responsibility for implications of decisions
* Have the ability to cope in a high-pressure environment

DESIRABLE
* Experience in Travel, Leisure, or Tourism, with a desire to learn more about the industry
* Experience in Ticketing in live events/music, with a desire to learn more about the industry
* Speak an additional European languages (e.g. French, Italian, and Spanish)
* Competent with Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Photoshop, HTML, Adobe Pro and Keynotes
* Outgoing, enthusiastic and highly motivated

BENEFITS

We’re a team of 70 located in an amazing converted piano factory in Camden (NW1 8LH) a short stroll from Camden market and Primrose Hill. By joining us you will be part of one of the fastest growing music / travel start-up companies in Europe, where you will have ample opportunity for career progression as we continue to grow.

We have a company culture which is very idea orientated and driven but also very social. It's entirely normal at 6pm on a Friday for half the company to be drinking together in the office and then planning to head out for a night out.

items.title: SaaS Business Development Exec (English, German or Dutch speaking)
items.content:
About us
We are an established SME, which has strengthened during 2016 and we are now expanding after a period of planning. Get ready for a phase of fast growth. We provide both software-as-a-service and supporting services such as digital marketing. We work with accommodation owners and operators and specialize in the serviced apartment sector.

See our core SaaS business at this website: http://elinapms.com/
25 days of holiday per year, in addition to the 8 statutory bank holidays
Salary open to discussion depending on experience.

The role
The role is to work as part of the ElinaPMS, driving client acquisition to grow the German or Dutch markets, and support on UK market. Reporting into the Commercial Director, who leads the sales and marketing team, and supports on sales.

1. Contact prospects outbound. Contact serviced apartment businesses in Germany to gauge interest in ElinaPMS. We have clients already there and we believe this market can be expanded.
2. Support on inbound leads for the sales team. Give demo’s on ElinaPMS. Know the product really well. Be able to give a fantastic demo. Then follow up to close the sale with price negotiation and contract.
3. Manage the CRM. Keep the CRM up to date with prospects, leads and opportunities. Manage your pipeline and work with your team.
4. Give great feedback. Share what is and isn’t working. Help the team build better sales pitches, case studies, sales documents, and pricing strategies. We always evaluate how we can do better when we have great people.

Success looks like signing 4 or more new clients for the company each month after training, in the German or other markets. Although, we have excellent feedback that the product is a good fit for the German market.

Requirements – 2+ years in a sales role

 You have conducted outbound calls with success
 You know how to learn and pitch products
 You believe sales follow up is important
 You like working with a solid basic, but excellent bonus
 You can negotiate
 You have used sales CRM to manage your leads and opportunities
 Beneficial if you have experience in hospitality, but not essential,
 Degree educated
 Languages: Written and spoken English. Spoken and written Dutch / or German
 Must hold a UK work and residence visa

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER -- REMOTE OK. Open Source developer on Open edX (OpenCraft - Remote/worldwide company based in Berlin)
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER -- REMOTE OK. Open Source developer on Open edX (OpenCraft - Remote/worldwide company based in Berlin)

Development specialized on the free software project Open edX, used by many universities and companies to run online courses. See edx.org, stanford.edu or fun-mooc.fr for examples of Open edX instances. We are a team of ten developers, working remotely from Europe, North America, Asia, Russia & Australia. The company is not affiliated with edX, but contributing and working with them on various projects. This is a full time position, were you would be able to work remotely from where you want, as long as you have a good internet connexion. : )

It's a large Python/Django codebase, with good code standards and architecture (a lot of the edX engineers come from MIT). You would work on different clients contracts using the platform. The clients list/references include Harvard, edX themselves, the French government, and various startups & universities currently running their own instances, or looking to create one. Tasks are varied, from developing developing core platform features, custom exercises and tools for specific courses (XBlocks), customizing and deploying instances, working on both client/server sides, etc.

Most of your work is published as free software (Open edX is released under the AGPL license, which requires clients to release modifications under the same license), and you would also contribute to the free software project, pushing some of your developments upstream through pull requests, contributing features, documentation or help on mailing-lists.

Stack: Python/Django, Ansible, AWS/OpenStack, Debian/Ubuntu, JS, HTML/CSS, MySQL, MongoDB

Interview process: a 15 minutes (simple) coding exercise & a 30 minutes Hangout.

To apply, fill this form: http://opencraft.com/jobs/open-source-developer/

items.title: BBC iPlayer | Development Lead | LONDON, UK | Full Time | £40-£70k
items.content:
BBC iPlayer | Development Lead | LONDON, UK | Full Time | £40-£70k

We're looking for a development lead for the iPlayer Business Layer - the team behind the iPlayer API serving the website, mobile clients and devices.Our tech stack is mostly Node.js with Postgres and Redis databases on AWS in microservices.

We're now averaging over 100 million API requests every day, with an average 2,000 req/s and a <7ms response time (that's for the past 7 days from now).Some exciting projects we're working on include a machine learning one and a big priority for the year ahead is personalisation. Our open source projects currently see 40k downloads/month and we're keen to expand that.

It's a small team (2 senior engineers, 2 engineers (<- one of them is me!) and usually a graduate), and we're based in White City.

items.title: Apollo Agriculture | Software Engineer | Nairobi, Kenya / NYC / SF or Remote | Full-Time | Remote
items.content:
Apollo Agriculture | Software Engineer | Nairobi, Kenya / NYC / SF or Remote | Full-Time | Remote

Apollo Agriculture is using satellite data to help bring modern farming to the worlds poorest farmers. Millions of farmers globally don't have access to the basic farm tools the rest of the world depends on for food production, good seed and fertilizer. We sell these proven agricultural tools on credit, and use satellite data and ML to figure out who we can lend to profitably.

We use Scala, Python/NumPy/SciPy (for science/ML), android and are heavy postgres users. We're building great software for places with low reliability networks and harsh environmental conditions.

We just finished delivering fertilizer and seed to 1000 farmers in our first year, and want you to help us get to our first million farmers.

We're hiring for Software Engineers and Data Scientists, email me (the CTO) at earl@apolloagriculture.com. I answer every email personally and would love to be introduced to any smart people you think would be interested.

items.title: VR Game Developer | Autism Therapy | Washington DC based startup.
items.content:
VR Game Developer | Autism Therapy | Washington DC based startup.

Floreo (http://floreotech.com) is an early-stage startup in Washington DC developing a first of its kind virtual reality platform to deliver children’s therapy. Our first product is focused on VR-based autism therapy.We are a multidisciplinary team of developers, doctors, designers, therapists, parents, and artists and we are working in the uncharted territory of VR for delivery of therapist mediated therapeutic experiences. This is a unique opportunity to build a highly challenging technically grounded product that has the potential of helping families in immeasurable ways.We are looking for a second developer to join our team with the following qualities:Game development experience using a commercial game engine such as Unity or Unreal is requiredExperience in all aspects of developing a game, from design to fine tuning multiplayer network latencies are highly desirableExperience specifically with VR is a plusStartup experience is highly desired as we are a small team used to wearing lots of hatsOur stack currently includes, Unity (using CSharp), to implement the VR / in game experience. We are using “Google VR for Unity” AKA daydream/cardboard to build for iOS and Android. We are using in house developed 3D and audio assets. We run our own backend and API, written in Go on AWS.

Also visit: http://floreotech.com/careers/

items.title: IBM Watson | Developer Advocate | SF, NYC | Full-time, REMOTE or ONSITE
items.content:
IBM Watson | Developer Advocate | SF, NYC | Full-time, REMOTE or ONSITE

I'm hiring developers and developer advocates to join the IBM Watson Developer Advocacy team. We look after Watson's cognitive API platform: https://www.ibm.com/watson/developercloud/services-catalog.h...

You'll be the interface between IBM Watson and our developer communities. This means:

1. Working with developers from startups, partners, and enterprise clients at conferences, workshops, and meetups, etc

2. Creating technical assets (demos, tutorials, etc) to help our users succeed

3. Improve the platform by bringing developer feedback to product teams, or directly contribute to the SDK/documentation/API tooling

It has successfully developed its own ‘best-in-class’ platform for delivering online research and now seeks to take this to another level by expanding its team of developers."

https://www.flexmr.net/ruby-on-rails-developer-vacancy.aspx

The current development team consists of four. We all work remotely but meet for two days once a month on site. Day to day we make use of all the tools you'd expect an efficient, remote team would. At the core, we're looking for experienced Ruby on Rails developers. We know that some people may be also more proficient/comfortable in the frontend, backend or even devops spaces - that's all good.

We'd certainly be interested to hear of people who also have industry experience with (any of): Docker, React, Bootstrap, iOS/Android app development.

Please send any applications (CV and introductory email) to pam.taylor@flexmr.net. If you have any technical questions, they'll end up at my door so feel free to send them directly to neil.bartley@flexmr.net.

items.content:
LitCharts | Full Stack Engineer | Remote Only | Full-time

LitCharts provides high quality literature guides, analysis, and related literary tools and resources. Over two million students, teachers, and general interest readers use the LitCharts website and mobile apps every month.

We are looking for a full-time Full Stack Engineer to work on all aspects of the site, both front- and back-end. Must be comfortable with Ruby and Ruby on Rails, Javascript and jQuery, AWS and S3, Haml, SCSS, Erb, HTML and CSS, and working remotely.

Additional nice-to-haves: devops/sysadmin experience, UI/UX design, React Native / Android / iOS, Nodejs, Elasticsearch, a background or interest in literature, literary analysis, data analysis, and/or EdTech.

We’re a small team, and the code you write will have a direct impact on our success as well as reach millions of users. You can work from home or anywhere. We work flexible hours but typically stick to 9am-5pm EST and are looking for someone able to do the same. All applicants must also be legally authorized to work in the United States.

items.content:
BuffaloGrid | Full Stack Developer, DevOps | Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Hyderabad, Bangalore India, London UK, Anywhere | REMOTE

www.buffalogrid.com is the mobile power and internet service for the off-grid world. We use solar energy, innovative technology and cashless payment systems to provide our service where it’s needed most. We want to help people get connected and stay connected.

Are you a Mid/Senior Very Full Stack Developer or DevOps Specialist, willing to work remotely, and looking for a technology challenge that delivers real impact in the world? We need you to be one of the first full-time technology hires!

We’re Serverless on AWS and Azure. We’re playing with golang and angular2, in production with node, docker, various virtualization technologies, have CI, release to production multiple times per day, and are so into automation that we have build builds. We track in bitbucket, Trello, Hangouts/Skype, TeamViewer, Google Apps and regular catch-ups. We’re very full stack going all the way to hardware, and specialized T-shaped generalists.

We’re a company of 10 (of which 2 full technologists so far, at least one more joining shortly thanks to HN), seed funded, growing fast, and distributed across the world - from London to rural Uttar Pradesh - so we’re keenly focussed clear communication.

We are a team that strives to be a safe and comfortable place for all. Diversity is the root of new perspective and opportunity for us collectively.

Process: Intro by email -> screen by your github or remote trivial FizzBuzz, your setup -> interviews inc pair coding -> discuss role -> hired!

Want to help provide connectivity for millions of people? Email us at jobs at our domain name mentioning HN for more info.

items.title: Viking Education | Course Mentor | Remote | Part Time | http://www.vikingcodeschool.com
items.content:
Viking Education | Course Mentor | Remote | Part Time | http://www.vikingcodeschool.com

Viking Code School is a 100% online development bootcamp driven by the mission of launching a million high-growth careers around the world regardless of a student’s location, prior experience or economic standing.

Our mentor-led Flex Program pairs students with industry veterans who perform weekly code reviews as part of the learning process. It is a great chance to pass on your knowledge without leaving your day job (or your house). As a mentor, you work with your mentee(s) during their full time in the course, which typically takes between 6-12 months to finish. You meet with your mentee 1-3 times per week for code review and can work with anywhere from 1 to 10+ students, depending on desire and ability.

Our back end has two tracks (Ruby/Rails or Node/Express) and our front end covers JavaScript/React/Redux. As a mentor, you have access to the course materials so you can get up to speed on anything you aren't firm on.

Check-ins are compensated.

Requirements:

* 4+ years of professional development experience as part of an engineering team.

* Strong grounding in CS fundamentals like Data Structures and Algorithms.

* Relevant experience with CS, Ruby/Rails, SQL, JavaScript/React etc.

Email careers@vikingcodeschool.com with your CV, links and anything else that would prove your development or teaching ability and general awesomeness.

items.title: Trussle | Everyone! (Product Managers, Designers, Software Engineers, QA Testers) | London
items.content:
Trussle | Everyone! (Product Managers, Designers, Software Engineers, QA Testers) | London

Hi, I'm Jonny and I'm a software engineer at Trussle. Our product makes getting a mortgage super-easy, online and for free. We're here, so even if you don't want a job, go get a mortgage: https://trussle.com

We've just closed a £4.5m funding round and now we want to grow the Product Development team to fix the things we're bad at. Since we don't have a recruiter, I'm doing the hiring!

We're looking for:

* Software Engineers who want to make a difference in a small business that's growing up fast.

* Our second designer (ideally UX-leaning) to come and make our product and internal tools super-easy to use.

* Our next Product Manager (we've only got one!) to make sure we're doing the right thing.

* QA - automated or manual - who want to be our first dedicated QA.

There's more detail about all of the roles we're looking for on our Product Development blog (http://trussle.github.io/jobs/).

These roles are all full-time, permanent and based in our London office. We're unable to sponsor visas at this time - sorry!

If you have any questions, get in touch with us via work@trussle.com or tweet us @TrussleTech!

Collabora is a leading global consultancy specialising in delivering the benefits of open source software to the commercial world. For over 10 years, we’ve helped our clients navigate the ever-evolving world of Open Source, enabling them to develop the best solutions.
