  • Work with your team to identify and solve complex problems
  • Develop ways to automate and improve our build processes
  • Work with our team to connect our publishers to our backend API

About Mediavine

Mediavine has been an internet publisher since 2004. We own and operate The Hollywood Gossip, TV Fanatic, Movie Fanatic and Food Fanatic.

In 2013, when Food Fanatic was launched and our relationship with bloggers began, we learned we weren’t alone in our frustrations with the way most ad networks are run. Since then we've teamed up with over 1400 different publishers to create frustration free advertising experiences running high quality, non intrusive and relevant advertisements.

Senior Go Developer

$48k - 72k | Equity
Ethereum Classic ETCDEVTeam

Job Description

ETCDEV team is maintaining and adding features to Geth (go-ethereum), an official implementation of Ethereum Classic protocol. This is an Open Source project, a reference implementation of Ethereum Classic blockchain protocol.

We need a person to lead Geth project, who can make architectural decisions and set goals and priorities. He/she should have a prior experience with blockchain and cryptocurrencies, and be comfortable to work in distributed team as a lead.

Skills & Requirements

  • 7 years of software development experience with computer languages such as C/C++, Java, Python, Go, Haskell or OCaml (at least one)
  • 2 years of Go programming experience
  • Experience with Rust is big plus
  • Familiar with Git and Linux
  • Proficient with spoken/written English, excellent communications stills
  • Good practices documenting, writing and maintaining clean code
  • Track record of Open Source contributions
  • Experience of building distributed applications
  • Self motivated, can take initiative and feel comfortable both working alone and part of a team

About Ethereum Classic ETCDEVTeam

Ethereum Classic is a community driven blockchain continued after EF (a foundation originally started Ethereum blockchain) moved to a separate fork by introducing censoring transactions into their blockchain. Ethereum Classic community opposed that fork and kept original chain, because it believes in Blockchain Immutability and Code Is Law principles of blockchain.

ETCDEV Team is a team working on Core Projects of Ethereum Classic, together with the community

Senior Frontend Developer

Digistore24

Job Description

Imagine to develop software you believe in, with people you believe in and a leadership that believes in you and your capabilities. Think of a company that enables you to work with the most up-to-date technology and provides you with the development opportunities and challenges you are looking for. Hard to believe? Well, just stop dreaming and come to us.

Who we are

We are Digistore24, an online-reseller and affiliate marketing platform. Everything we do comes down to one simple mission: Help as many enterprises as possible, small and large ones, to have success online, by making their business as simple and automated as possible. We build everything to match this mission. No dogmas, no borders, no-nonsense.

Who you are

Optimizing user experience and creating beautiful interfaces that are easy to use is the most satisfying thing for you. You simply think and act through the eyes of your user. While your focus is on the frontend, you are able to connect it to the backend, too. After several years of experience you want an engaging role where you can directly influence a thriving company’s new products from scratch.

Job description

You’ll be the key frontend developer with a strong focus on turning creative designs into highly functional, pixel perfect web interfaces. You are going to work in a small team with a flat hierarchy, so you will have a lot of creative freedom and responsibility to implement elegant, maintainable, and usable solutions. With your knowledge you will contribute to building a strong frontend foundation for all our web projects. 

We want you to:

  • Develop all user-facing features of our new web projects
  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UX/UI designs
  • Collaborate with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability
  • Create quality mockups and prototypes
  • Write functional requirement documents and guides
  • Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability
  • Support back-end developers with coding and troubleshooting

Skills & Requirements

Your work will be used by many thousands of users, meaning that you have a keen eye for detail, the foresight to identify issues before they become problems, and a willingness to go the extra mile when needed.

You should also bring with you:

  • Sound experience as a front-end developer
  • Excellent HTML5 and CSS programming skills
  • Experience with Bootstrap, SCSS
  • Good knowledge of Vanilla Java Script, jQuery, AngularJS
  • Experience with agile development methods
  • Fluent in english

Nice to have:

  • Generating mockups and UX/UI experience
  • Know-how in wireframing
  • A portfolio of works
  • German language skills
  • Bulgarian language skills

About Digistore24

What we offer

Working for a rapidly growing market leader in the german-speaking online marketing business means that you can expect us to provide everyone with the best working environment and growth opportunities possible.

This includes:

  • Flexible working time, including the possibility to work from home
  • Very competitive salary and benefits package and absolutely reliable salary payments
  • High salary value due to lower tax burden and moderate consumer prices in Bulgaria
  • Top notch additional health insurance package
  • Health supporting environment with fresh fruits every day, fresh spring water, fresh filtered air, the ability to make fresh smoothies every day and much more

  • Free parking space in a modern office building with perfect view over Sofia's skyline
  • Bestair and Bestwater filters, a gaming corner, kicker tables (and the freedom to use them whenever you want)
  • Small and international yet close-knit team where everyone's input is truly valued for shaping the company

items.title: SoPost - Platform Team - Programmer - Elm at SoPost (Newcastle upon Tyne, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
SoPost - Platform Team - Programmer - Elm

SoPost

Job Description

We are recruiting an Elm programmer to join our platform team.

Our platform team is responsible for maintaining and developing our core technologies whether they be internal, private or public.

Basically you get to write Elm all day, every day.

You can either work in our office in Newcastle, or if you prefer, work remote.

We're making a solid effort to promote remote working as a first class thing.

Remote is fine, but only within the U.K. 

We try and get all of our team together once a month (on-site & remote) and go for a meal and spend some time together away from our keyboards.

Skills & Requirements

ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Demonstrable experience of Elm.
  • Solid understanding of functional programming.
  • You have to live and are eligible to work inside the U.K.
  • You must speak fluent English.

OPTIONAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Experience with Elixir, Erlang, OTP.
  • Experience with agile workflows.
  • Experience with remote working.

There is every chance that you will develop extra skills here as a result of being engaged with the team. We collaborate and do not do “over the wall” or “it’s not my problem”. We work as a team and that means working through the hard stuff just as much as it means basking in the good stuff – you have to be prepared to engage in this process.

About SoPost

We're a technology company focused on building the most powerful product sampling platform in the world. Our products are used by brands such as L'Oreal and Cadbury, as a way of driving trial and reaching new customers over social media. SoPost launched in 2012, initially with the goal of creating a dynamic postal address linked to social IDs, shifting our focus to product sampling a year later.

We're a small but growing team, headquartered in central Newcastle and with offices in London and New York. Our business is well capitalised, with venture capital and angel backing.

Our mission is clear - we want to be the world’s most powerful product sampling platform.

We work as a team and that means working through the hard stuff just as much as it means basking in the good stuff – you have to be prepared to engage in this process.

About SoPost

We're a technology company focused on building the most powerful product sampling platform in the world. Our products are used by brands such as L'Oreal and Cadbury, as a way of driving trial and reaching new customers over social media. SoPost launched in 2012, initially with the goal of creating a dynamic postal address linked to social IDs, shifting our focus to product sampling a year later.

We're a small but growing team, headquartered in central Newcastle and with offices in London and New York. Our business is well capitalised, with venture capital and angel backing.

Our mission is clear - we want to be the world’s most powerful product sampling platform.

items.title: Front-end Developer at Genialis (Ljubljana, Slovenia) (allows remote)
items.content:
Front-end Developer

€30k - 42k
Genialis

Job Description

Ever heard of cell factories? Or synthetic biology? With the rise of genome editing technologies like CRISPR, the world now needs CAD-like tools to manipulate organisms like yeast to solve problems such as sustainable production of chemicals for use in human health, nutrition, and energy. We are seeking a talented front-end developer with affinity for academic research in life sciences to work on interactive visual exploration modules for biological data. Our team works on the cutting edge technology stack. You will be working closely with some of the most reputable scientists in life science research in the scope of DD-DeCaF, a Horizon 2020 European research project (dd-decaf.eu), and help build tools to design cell factories and engineered microbial communities.


Key responsibilities

  • Work with life scientists and designers to help transcend the current limitations in metabolic engineering modeling
  • Write well-structured and tested code
  • Implement beautiful layouts in TypeScript and HTML5
  • Build tools that are intuitive and delightful to use and bring change to the scientific and everyday world

Benefits


  • A product that really matters
  • Great opportunities for personal and professional growth
  • Work with the latest technologies
  • International team and client base
  • Possibility of remote-only work
  • 30,000-42,000 EUR/year salary

Skills & Requirements

  • Experience with Angular, TypeScript and material design concepts
  • Solid understanding of the full web technology stack (e.g., HTTP, cookies, headers, asset loading/caching)
  • Proven creative and innovative problem-solving skills
  • Full-time availability

About Genialis

Genialis delivers beautiful and insightful data analysis software to life scientists. For our existing clients in pharma, academia and institutional R&D, we empower researchers to find answers to their questions. We make it possible for biologists to interpret vast, complex data more autonomously.

Our core team boasts an impressive and diverse set of experiences—of 15 team members from Slovenia and the US, more than half earned a PhD in relevant scientific fields focused on everything from genomics and genetics to machine learning and AI.

We aim to become the essential data analysis software in life science research—a tool each user works with every day, and that no researcher would choose to live without.

Transparency, freedom, trust, dreaming big and work-life balance are just a few key values that define Genialis as a company and as a team. Last but not least, we are all here to work on something that has a huge impact on improving people's lives.

items.content:
Compiler Engineer

Reconfigure.io

Job Description

At Reconfigure.io, we're making reconfigurable hardware as easy to develop and use as software. We do this though a platform that can build & deploy Go code to run on FPGAs in the cloud.

We're looking for a Haskell engineer to work on our Go compiler. You'd work on tools to lower the barrier to entry for high performance computing, from compiler optimizations, end-user library design, and accompanying tooling. You'll also be responsible for writing test cases and benchmarks.

You would work with a small, distributed team with varied skillsets, that strives for empathy and inclusiveness in our work. We have folks with experience in hardware design, compilers, backend, devops, and machine learning.

We use Slack & Hangouts to keep in touch, and Trello to track work. Building a great developer workflow is essential to our products, so we use continuous integration & continuous deployment.

This last quarter we launched a private alpha of our platform & compiler. 

Skills & Requirements

  • 1 year+ experience with Haskell
  • 1 year+ experience with Go
  • Experience with testing and continuous integration
  • Comfort in a distributed environment (we <3 slack)
  • Availability during Central/GMT workdays
  • Prior experience with compilers is a plus, as is any past experience with lenses, recursion schemes, DSL's, pipes, and QuickCheck

About Reconfigure.io

Reconfigure.io is a early stage Manchester and Austin based startup aimed towards enabling cloud engineers to use hardware accelerator technologies through a hybrid platform-as-a-service.

We have traction with some early large customers and have seed funding.

We value a diverse team and strive to build an inclusive work environment. We’re a small, distributed team that relies on visibility of work, sharing knowledge, and collaboration to build high quality software.

items.title: Développeur Fullstack PHP at Port Adhoc SAS (Paris, France) (allows remote)
items.content:
Développeur Fullstack PHP

€38k - 45k
Port Adhoc SAS

Job Description

Port Adhoc gère 7 ports sur le littoral français, équivalents à une capacité d'accueil de plus de 4500 bateaux. La plaisance entame sa mutation. Vous contribuerez à en écrire l’histoire...

Au sein d'une équipe passionnée à l’esprit entrepreneurial, vous participerez activement à mener à bien notre ambitieuse stratégie : rendre l’expérience client « wouaouaaa » chez Port Adhoc.

Chaque bout de code que nous écrivons améliore l'expérience des équipes Port Adhoc et de nos clients. Le challenge de la dev team est simple : être les pionniers de la digitalisation des ports de plaisance. 

Dans ce cadre, vous serez ainsi amené à travailler à la conception de la nouvelle version de notre backbone au nom de code "Projet Darwin", qui est au coeur de notre fonctionnement et organise la manière dont nous travaillons et communiquons avec nos clients. 

En étroite collaboration avec tous les intervenants de Port Adhoc, aux quatre coins de la France, vous pourrez :

  • être créatif sur l'architecture des bases de données et sur la manière dont on y rentre nos datas.
  • écrire un code intelligent, proprement commenté et qui fonctionne en harmonie avec le SGDB.
  • élaborer des algorithmes et les transcrire en code/scripts car parfois c'est nécessaire.
  • parler le langage des objets connectés car nous allons justement connecter pas mal de choses à "Darwin".
  • travailler sur une IHM bien pensée. Nos guides sont simples : pas de mode d'emploi, les utilisateurs doivent s'en sortir tous seuls. Si-il-ne-trouve-pas-le-bouton-pour-cliquer alors c'est qu'il est mal placé (déplace-le).
  • Darwin est également un Système d’Information Géographique. Vous participerez donc à l’élaboration de notre code « top secret » qui permet de réaliser à l'écran de belles projections cartographiques, dynamiques et générées à la volée.
  • Darwin se déclinera également en appli smartphone : vous parlerez IOs et Android.

Skills & Requirements

Nous aimons bien les gens qui comprennent ce qu'ils font, savent où ils vont, pourquoi ils y vont.

Au moins 1 ans d’expérience en développement PhP. Niveau minimum Bac +3.

Vous disposez de fortes connaissances en back-end :

  • PhP (OOP)
  • MySQL & MySQL WorkBench (UML)

De bonnes connaissances en front-end :

  • Expérience avec au moins un framework CSS/JS (Materialize, Bootstrap- Twitter, Angular JS...)
  • Réalisation de mock-up et maquettes HTML
  • Intégration de services tiers (Google API, ...)

Vous maîtrisez :

  • Au moins un Framework PHP
  • Quelques outils des outils de gestion de projet (Trello, Slack, ou autre)

Expériences appréciées (ou que vous apprendrez avec nous) en :

  • Laravel 5.X (notre outil au sein de l'équipe de développement)
  • Wordpress (le CMS de notre site web)
  • Composer (pour la création d'utilitaires connexe à Darwin 3)
  • Git (bash ou graphique) pour le versionning
  • Conaissance de la CLI sur Nodejs (optimisation des app web avec Gulp, ...)

Autres exigences:

  • Accepter un CDD de minimum 6 mois ou idéalement un CDI à plein temps, selon vos envies.
  • Disponibilité : immédiate.
  • Rémunération : 38k-45k € (selon profil)
  • Permis B apprécié.

About Port Adhoc SAS

"Port Adhoc, la plaisance, des émotions". Premier gestionnaire privé de ports de plaisance sur le littoral français, Port Adhoc gère les ports à sec de Leucate, Bayonne, Paimpol, Soubise, 2 zones de mouillages sur la Charente, la marina de Port Médoc, le port mixte de Port-Saint-Louis-du-Rhône.

De nouveaux actifs seront bientôt intégrés, avec à chaque fois la nécessité de revoir les outils web pour les harmoniser et les améliorer.

Wallethub

Job Description

WalletHub is a high-growth start-up based in Washington, D.C. .Our fast-paced environment and can do attitude have already earned us several prestigious awards including this year's Gold Stevie for best financial services website from the American Business Awards and a gold medal as one of the products of the year from the Consumer World Awards.  We're seeking hardworking, like-minded individuals to help us disrupt personal finance and make a tangible difference in people's everyday lives.

More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:

  1. Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.
  2. Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.
  3. Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.

In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.

Responsibilities include:

  • Designs and develops web applications using Java, PHP, Spring Framework, MySQL
  • Designs and develops unit test cases to make the code more robust
  • Participates in pairing and code reviews.
  • Support and troubleshoot problems with existing applications
  • Participates in the areas of architecture, design, implementation, and testing
  • Security automated testing and improving architecture of application with the goal of increasing security

This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed either remotely (including from outside the U.S.) or from WalletHub’s offices in downtown Washington, D.C.

Skills & Requirements

  • At least 3-4 years experience in Java, Spring and MySQL (or any relation database)
  • Experience developing web and stand-alone applications in Spring technologies such as: Spring MVC, Spring Security, Spring Batch
  • Excellent communication and analytical skills
  • Proficient with spoken/written English
  • Experience in security automated testing
  • Interested in learning about security and keeping up to date with security standards

Nice to have but not required:

  • Experience in PHP
  • Familiarity with front-end technologies – Object-Oriented Javascript, AJAX, XHTML, HTML, XML/DOM
  • Experience with unit testing framework, test driven development

About Wallethub

WalletHub helps all consumers reach top financial fitness by providing:

• Free credit scores and credit reports that are updated on a daily basis.

• Free 24/7 credit monitoring and personalized advice that will help you improve your credit and save money.

• More reviews on financial products, professionals and companies than any other website.

• An extensive education center coupled with the ability to ask financial experts your money-related questions for free .

items.title: Sr Frontend / Javascript Developer at Whitespectre (Barcelona, Spain) (allows remote)
items.content:
Sr Frontend / Javascript Developer

Whitespectre

Job Description

Are you passionate about Javascript SPAs, efficient client-side performance and building software for millions of users?

We need a smart developer to help entend our frontend Javascript clients for our microservice architecture of 18 loosely coupled services. It’s in production, supporting multiple brands and driving millions of dollars of revenue every month from US sales.

We are a remote-first company with a globally distributed team of 55. We’re proud of the way we get great work done. Our clients love working with us and we partner with them on long-term projects. Are you looking for a new challenge? This is fun!

What do we offer?

  • Work as part of a talented, globally distributed, successful team
  • A focussed adherence to our agile/scrum processes (we really believe it helps getting good work done)
  • Hard problems to solve (you won't find all the answers on Stack Overflow) - and the opportunity to own the solutions
  • A great working atmosphere where you can share and learn with other smart people
  • The best-in-class toolsets: Slack, CI/CD with Docker etc
  • Meetups in our Barcelona offices for our remote folks
  • Competitive rates
  • A long term working relationship

You'll be:

  • Building complex Javascript (mainly ES6, webpack, backbone/marionette) presentation layers to consume RESTful APIs in a performant way.
  • Working on ecommerce and back-office direct sales functionality to support hundreds of thousands of customers.
  • Helping the backend engineers in designing, specifying and implementing services to decouple functionality
  • Occasionally going full stack and diving in the the Rails services to add a new endpoint or modify behavior (and we can help you learn here too)
  • Working within a fast moving team (working 11am - 8pm Central European time)
  • Identifying bottlenecks, using tools to diagnose and refactor code for scale
  • Ensuring the robustness, performance and failure characteristics of the system.
  • Writing well tested, defect free code with CI/CD
  • Taking ownership of production applications - managing issues, releases and ensuring quality

Good English verbal and written communication skills are essential. As is production experience of Backbone.js/React/Vue/Angular framework applications.

This is a contract position with a long term outlook (12 months+ full-time project) for the right candidate. We are looking for remote workers (most of the company is remote) or have openings based in our Barcelona office.

About Whitespectre

Who are we? Whitespectre is a growing, globally distributed, software development company, focussed on building elegant solutions with Ruby on Rails in the backend, and Javascript SPAs plus native IOS and Android apps.

Why is it good to work with us?

We know that big ideas and big results only happen when you have the right people, working together smartly - whether that’s across the room or across the globe.  We make the work fun and rewarding.

Because we work on cool projects. Sure, we can list the latest set of technologies that we use, but that is a given. What's more interesting is how they are used - the design, the architecture, the approach to solving business problems. And we do that across multiple clients - each and every one we're excited to work with.

Because we believe in constant learning and exploring - whether that’s a new skill, a new role, or a new way of seeing.  And because we've found that we learn the most when we take on new challenges as a team.  We’re proud that people love working with us (and still have lives outside of work).

items.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer at Density Inc (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Embedded Software Engineer

Density Inc

Job Description

The Role

When someone installs Density in a location, they get access to real time, accurate people count. While the experience is magical to a customer, the process involved in accomplishing it is complex. Quality engineering ensures that the data is delivered reliably and accurately. We use Embedded Linux to accomplish tasks such as pulling and analyzing data, managing over-the-air updates, bi-directional communication, and monitoring the health of the device. We're looking for an engineer to help shape the way we accomplish all these tasks. Ideally you have a strong background in C and have a passion for Linux.

This position reports to Density's Head of Hardware Development.

Skills & Requirements

Here’s what we’re looking for

    • You know your way around Embedded Linux or Android, and your favorite bootloader
    • You love C and develop code that is elegant while maintaining a small footprint
    • You have experience with the Linux Kernel and device drivers
    • You have worked with ARM SoCs
    • You have made embedded devices talk to servers with HTTP or other application protocols
    • You know and love your debugger and profiling tools

Icing on the cake

    • An academic background in Computer Science (BSc or MSc) or equivalent
    • Experience with OpenGL and OpenCL
    • Knowledge of C++11
    • Experience working with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, multimeters, and jtags
    • You know your way around a schematic
    • A Github repo or OSS upstream patches

About Density Inc

Density is a people counter and an API. We build a small sensor that measures how busy a location is in real-time. Install Density above a doorway and use our API to access real-time and historical foot traffic.

items.title: Senior JavaScript Engineer at OK GROW! (Toronto, ON, Canada) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior JavaScript Engineer

OK GROW!

Job Description

We help our clients build apps with modern JavaScript through consulting and training. We’re a team of developers and designers and we’re looking for someone with a passion for JavaScript, the web, mobile, teaching, writing great code and building great products. We have an office in Toronto but we have a remote work culture.

The position

You’re organized and ambitious and pay attention to details. You have experience developing full-stack JavaScript applications or deep front-end expertise, plus a solid foundation in computer science principles. You’re a top React, Node, GraphQL, or JavaScript expert. And your working hours need to be able to overlap with both the east and west coast of North America.

You’ll work with a small but growing team and an experienced founder who are known in the JavaScript community internationally and the tech community in Toronto.

You’ll lead development of client projects and our own internal and open-source projects (which we work on one day per week). You’ll work with the best tools, manage projects, launch successful web and mobile apps, and become recognized as a leader in the JavaScript community.

How to apply

If you want us to get in touch please email jobs@okgrow.com. For extra consideration please find and run the hacker() function on our site and include the string it returns in your message to us. Please tell us about yourself, which timezone you’re in, and why you’d be a great choice for this position. Please include your resume, your GitHub account and links to things you’ve made or written online. We’re looking forward to meeting you.

(No recruiters or agencies please.)

Skills & Requirements

  • JavaScript
  • React
  • GraphQL
  • Node.js
  • Test-driven development
  • Good communication skills

About OK GROW!

We’re a small group of passionate developers. We love to launch great products, and we do our best to make sure that every one of them is a business success. We love to produce great open source software and we love to teach. We’re very involved with the JavaScript developer community and we’re focused on helping everyone that works with us achieve success in their career.

items.title: Software Development Engineer (Node.js) at Mediocre (Dallas, TX) (allows remote)
items.content:
Software Development Engineer (Node.js)

Equity
Mediocre

Job Description

Mediocre is looking for extraordinary Software Development Engineers to work on our ecommerce applications (meh.com, morningsave.com, and others we haven't launched yet). You’ll be responsible for the software our customers use for online shopping, account management, and the checkout pipeline. If this doesn’t sound like the most mediocre job in tech then we’d like to talk to you. But only if you’re an amazing rock star, or a ninja, or a zombie hunter, or whatever term all the cool recruiters are throwing around these days.

You’ll be expected to develop and maintain our customer facing web applications using modern web frameworks. You will also be expected to develop and maintain the back-end services and APIs needed to power our ecommerce applications. Ideal candidates are those that have experience building highly trafficked websites.

You can expect to be designing and documenting architecture, developing software, and testing applications on a wide variety of browsers and mobile devices. You’ll be asked to gather and analyze real-world data about how the applications are performing and usage metrics about which features are being used the most. You’ll also be working with our design team to help create the customer experience for new features and products.

Skills & Requirements

We’re looking for someone who has:

  • Experience building web applications and JSON-based REST APIs with Node.js (Express, Restify, etc.)
  • Experience with a variety of database platforms (MongoDB, MySQL, etc.)
  • Familiarity with search platforms (Lucene, Solr, ElasticSearch, etc.)
  • Familiarity with caching systems (Memcached, Redis, AppFabric, etc.)
  • Experience with HTML/CSS/JavaScript and a variety of frameworks and libraries (jQuery, React, Bootstrap, LESS, etc.)
  • Experience with cloud computing environments (Amazon Web Services, Windows Azure, Rackspace, Digital Ocean, etc.)
  • Deep expertise in internet protocols (HTTP, SMTP, SSH, TCP, UDP, etc.)
  • Knowledge of security best practices
  • Experience with DVCS (Git, Mercurial) and continuous integration systems
  • Experience with APM solutions is a plus (Boundary, Pingdom, NewRelic, Splunk Storm, etc.)
  • Experience with analytics platforms is a plus (Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Graphite, Statsd, etc.)

You should love gathering and graphing metrics, analyzing data to spot areas to make performance optimizations, and just generally be a data junkie.

About Mediocre

Do you remember Woot? We built that and sold it to Amazon. Now we're on to more mediocre sites, like meh.com.

items.title: UI/UX JavaScript Ninja, Cool Product Company, Location Flexible--East Coast pref at ThreatConnect, Inc. (Arlington, VA) (allows remote)
items.content:
UI/UX JavaScript Ninja, Cool Product Company, Location Flexible--East Coast pref

ThreatConnect, Inc.

Job Description

Want to work in a cool and innovative development environment? Us too. ThreatConnect is a dynamic and fast-growing leader in the threat intelligence space, and we encourage our developers and engineers to explore new ideas and solutions to improve efficiency and ease of use.

We are currently searching for a talented Senior Front-end Engineer ready to hit the ground running as part of our User Interface Engineering Team. The ideal candidate should be a versatile team player with the ability to think critically, conduct research and creatively solve problems. Proven experience in JS frameworks such Angular, NodeJS, Type Script with a solid foundation in front-end development is essential. 

We would love someone who is well organized and demonstrates a curiosity for learning and continually stretching boundaries with responsive web design utilizing emerging web trends. You will work as part of close-knit team, so a willingness to lend development tricks towards enhancing our conventions and workflows is sought. Most importantly, we want you to contribute, expand your talents, and really innovate with us.

  • Work in a fun collaborative environment solving complex problems to produce innovative solutions with your team
  • Actively contribute and guide our front-end technology and design roadmap
  • Architect effective front-end quality software components to be integrated into multiple projects
  • Build intelligent, intuitive front-end interfaces that balances optimization and functionality
  • Work with team leads and other developers on a variety of web projects

Skills & Requirements

  • Expert in core JavaScript principles such as event handlers, DOM manipulation and object-oriented programming
  • Experience with JS chart libraries such as D3 or Highcharts
  • In-depth understanding of front-end technologies and optimization, expert knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, DOM, JSON, pre-processors SASS/LESS
  • Understanding of web standards, usability and HCI philosophies as applied  to UX web development, navigation, information architecture and content hierarchy
  • Strong background in responsive frameworks and methodologies
  • 5+ years of experience in developing web applications
  • 3+ years (current) JavaScript Experience
  • 2+ years (current) AngularJS Experience; Exposure to NodeJS
  • Experience with RESTful APIs 
  • Experience building, testing, debugging web related projects with build tools such as Gulp, Grunt, Jasmine, Protractor
  • Familiarity working with a team using a centralized version control system such as Git, Subversion is a plus
  • Ability to review designs/wireframes and create user stories
  • Experience in Java, JSF is a plus
  • Strong analytical skills, decision making skills
  • Highly motivated, curious, capable and a lifetime learner
  • Bachelor's Degree in technical field OR equivalent experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Our Work Environment

ThreatConnect offers a positive, collaborative culture; comprehensive, fully-paid benefits, and unique incentives and perks that encourage you to become an integral part of our success!

As a member of the UI Team you will be collaborating with a variety of stakeholders to support development teams to maintain and expand the UX of our core platform and UI components library.

Meeting business requirements is always a top priority, but improving our abilities is just as important. We set aside time to foster a positive learning environment that further develops each individual's skills. We continually encourage our engineers to explore new ideas & solutions that improve efficiency.

About ThreatConnect, Inc.

ThreatConnect, Inc. is the leading provider of advanced threat intelligence products and services, including the most comprehensive Threat Intelligence Platform (TIP)on the market today. ThreatConnect delivers a single platform in the cloud and on-premises to effectively aggregate, analyze, and act to counter sophisticated cyber-attacks. Leveraging advanced analytics capabilities, ThreatConnect offers a superior understanding of relevant cyber threats to business operations. To register for a free ThreatConnect account, or to learn more about our products and services, visit: www.threatconnect.com. 

We are an equal opportunity employer offering a terrific culture and outstanding career opportunities along with exceptional, fully-paid benefits, performance bonuses, and groovy quarterly events that are social in nature.

items.title: Werkstudenten (m/w) für Entwicklung Objective-C und Java / Homeoffice at SecCommerce Informationssysteme GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland) (allows remote)
items.content:
Werkstudenten (m/w) für Entwicklung Objective-C und Java / Homeoffice

SecCommerce Informationssysteme GmbH

Job Description

Liebe Studenten,
wir suchen ab sofort und bundesweit Werkstudenten (m/w) in Teilzeit, die Interesse haben, an der Entwicklung und Programmierung von kleinen, in sich geschlossenen Applikationen für iOS, die unsere SecSign API nutzen, mitzuwirken.
Unser Ziel ist es, Unternehmen, aber auch den normalen Nutzern nützliche und attraktive Hilfsanwendungen zur Verfügung zu stellen, die ihnen z.B. sichere Authentifizierung, verschlüsselte Dateispeicherung und geschützten Datenaustausch ermöglichen. Dafür setzen wir stets auf neueste Techniken und prüfen, was noch weiter vereinfacht werden kann.


Euer Aufgabengebiet:
• Für den Anfang: Bauen von kleinen Anwendungen, die unsere API nutzen, für das iPhone/iPad sowie Android und Mac OS X

Wir bieten:
• Flexible Arbeitseinteilung, um Uni, Prüfungsvorbereitungszeiten und Job unter einen Hut zu bekommen
• Die Möglichkeit, selbständig von zu Hause aus zu arbeiten (aber auch gerne bei uns im Büro)
• Eine unbefristete Anstellung
• Die Arbeit in einem netten und dynamischen Team mit flachen Hierarchien
• Einen Stundenlohn zwischen 15,- und 20,- Euro

 • Einen Stundenlohn zwischen

Skills & Requirements

Euer Profil:
• Gute Kenntnisse in Objective-C und/oder Swift/Java
• Gewissenhaftes und selbständiges Arbeiten
• Kleine Referenzentwicklungen (können auch gerne Uni-Projekte sein), die uns einen Einblick in eure Erfahrungen geben
• Interesse an der Entwicklung für Android und iOS
• Ihr könnt uns 16-20 Stunden pro Woche unterstützen

About SecCommerce Informationssysteme GmbH

Über uns:
SecCommerce wurde 1998 in Hamburg gegründet und entwickelt seither Softwareprodukte hauptsächlich im Bereich der digitalen Signatur sowie der Public-Key-Infrastruktur.
Seit ca. vier Jahren entwickeln wir das SecSign Portal und die SecSign ID; ein Webportal für die sichere Online-Zusammenarbeit und eine Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierung für die sichere Benutzeranmeldung mit dem Smartphone. Beide Lösungen können sowohl im Web als auch als Inhouse-Installation genutzt werden. Durch unsere Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierung haben wir aber auch zahlreiche Berührungspunkte mit den aktuell wichtigsten CMS und Webservices (WordPress, Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence, Crowd), Typo3, Joomla asp.net, u.v.m.)


Unser Ziel ist es, weitere spannende Applikationen (für den Desktop sowie auch mobile) mit dem Schwerpunkt auf benutzbare IT-Sicherheit zu entwickeln. Ein Beispiel hierfür ist die Integration der Touch ID von Apple (s. auch http://www.iphone-ticker.de/touch-id-statt-online-login-ios-8-machts-moeglich-69123) in die SecSign ID. Somit kann jeder Entwickler mithilfe der Plugins den Nutzern seiner Webseite oder seiner Programme eine Authentifizierung mit der Touch ID ermöglichen.


Einen kleinen Einblick in unsere neuen Produkte erhaltet ihr unter
secsign.com
portal.secsign.com

items.title: Software Engineer at VacuumLabs (Bratislava, Slovakia) (allows remote)
items.content:
Software Engineer

€24k - 48k | Equity
VacuumLabs

Job Description

Bezpečný chat pre lekárov, vyhľadávač leteniek, či podpisovanie zmlúv na tablete. Za všetko toto a mnohé ďalšie sme zodpovední my.

Máš pocit, že banky sú v technologickom praveku? Žiadny stres. Pracujeme na tom, aby sme to fixli.

Vyberáme si technologicky náročné projekty, lebo milujeme výzvy.

Momentálne čarujeme s týmito technológiami:

  • React.js + Babel + Redux na webe, Electron na desktope,
  • React Native pre iOS aj Android,
  • Node.js + Express, Python + Django alebo Clojure na serveri,
  • keď treba REST/GraphQL/Websockets,
  • PostgreSQL/Datomic ako databázy.

Ešte máš trochu obavy, ale si na nás zvedavý? Príď na niektorý z našich meetupov, kde diskutujeme o problémoch a nových technológiách. Ak nie si z Bratislavy, to vôbec nevadí. Nájdeš nás aj v Prahe, Brne a vo Viedni. Počul si už o ReactiveConf, druhej najväčšej svetovej konferencii (nielen) o React.js? Správne! Aj v tom máme prsty.

Skills & Requirements

Nie je podstatné, v akom prostredí sa cítiš doma. Máš analytické myslenie a vieš sa nadchnúť pre vec? Super. Máš rád nové technológie, miluješ výzvy a neuspokojíš sa s priemerným výsledkom? Vynikajúce. Dokážeš rozmýšľať mimo zaužívaných predstáv? Už tušíme, že si náš človek. Príď to dokázať!

Nie si majiteľom univerzitného diplomu? Žiadny problém! Zaujíma nás Tvoj zodpovedný prístup, talent a skúsenosti s programovaním.

Máš snáď obavy? Nie je dôvod. Navzájom sa podporujeme a pomáhame si na ceste k cieľu. Dobrý/á programátor/ka sa u nás naučí novú technológiu za pol roka. Prečo by aj nie, keď sa učíme navzájom.

Všetko, čo súvisí s projektom, robíme spolu. Vládne u nás tímový duch. Staň sa jeho súčasťou a pomôž nám pri:

  • Analýze potrieb zákazníka.
  • Tvorbe architektúry a implementácii softvéru.
  • Hľadaní možností pre zlepšovanie procesu vývoja.
  • Koučovaní menej skúsených kolegov.
  • Štúdiu nových technológií a príprave prednášok pre náš tím.
  • Ak budeš mať chuť, tak aj pri prednášaní na meetupoch a konferách po celom svete.

About ezhome

At ezhome we've transformed the ease with which customers care for their homes. Whether it's our subscription based lawn care service or one of our many other home service products, we're providing homeowners with clear pricing, continuous communication, on demand availability, and amazing service and support.

Our highly personalized service takes the pain out of homeownership. No longer do customers need to research and evaluate numerous providers for a single service. ezhome customers simply choose the services they need and they're delivered by ezhome's trusted staff of full-time services professionals exactly as promised.

We have an exceptional team starting with two previously successful co-founders. Among others, Odysseas Tsatalos (https://www.linkedin.com/in/tsatalos) previously co-founded oDesk, now Upwork, which has a unicorn valuation. In 2012 Spiros Xanthos (https://www.linkedin.com/in/spiros) sold his first company, Pattern Insight, to VMware.

items.title: Front End Developer at Critical Mix - iGain (Perrysburg, OH) (allows remote)
items.content:
Front End Developer

Critical Mix - iGain

Job Description

Be part of an exciting, fast-growing technology firm creating web based applications and enterprise solutions to support global organizations. We use AWS, C#, ASP.NET, SQL data stores, JavaScript, and a host of other relevant technologies. We are seeking talented front-end developers with relevant experience to join our team and help expand the success of our software. Specifically looking for someone experienced with multi-device optimization.

Skills & Requirements

Requirements:

  • Design, implement, test, deploy, and monitor browser-based web applications with a focus on delivering content to various devices.
  • Work closely with users to develop project requirements and generate test plans.
  • Stay current with new technologies and implement innovative solutions.
  • Participate in code reviews.

Requirements:

  • Minimum 3 years’ relevant work experience designing and/or implementing browser-based applications.
  • Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, browser behavior & relevant protocols.
  • Understanding of concepts behind progressive web applications, responsive design, grid layouts, and performance optimization.
  • Familiarity with image formats, their key differences, advantages and disadvantages.
  • Strong commitment to quality.
  • Preference provided to developers with applicable experience in any of the below technologies:
  • Programming, frameworks and libraries: JavaScript, CSS, jQuery, BootStrap.
  • Web Services and APIs: REST, JSON.
  • Tools: PhotoShop/Illustrator/Gimp, Visual Studio 2013/2015, Git, Trello, Jira, Confluence or related.
  • The ideal candidate will have a passion for learning and applying new technologies, and will be eager to share what they have learned with colleagues.

Location:
This position is open to any of our primary development locations as below, or remote for highly qualified candidate:

Perrysburg, OH
Woburn, MA

About Critical Mix - iGain

Critical Mix provides easy access to highly-targeted global survey respondents, survey programming and data visualization services. Driven by a passion for simplifying data collection, the team at Critical Mix is personally invested in giving clients the ultimate customer service experience. Every project, no matter the size or type, is supported by a team of always-available, experienced market research practitioners who anticipate your needs and provide thoughtful customer care. Service options include a complete spectrum of high-quality data collection tools ranging from sample sources, survey programming and fielding, to report automation and data dashboards. Critical Mix is headquartered in Westport CT and operates globally.

items.title: Senior Java Software Engineer at Ultimate Software (Fort Lauderdale, FL) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Java Software Engineer

Ultimate Software

Job Description

What do Outback Steakhouse, Pep Boys, and the Major League Baseball Network all have in common? They are paid with the software you could be building! At Ultimate Software, we build a cloud enterprise human capital management solution that can scale and perform on an as-needed basis.

We are growing our Product Development team like crazy. We need to make UltiPro the best it can be for our customers (over 2,600!), and in order to do that, we need additional talent. What a great problem to have, right? That’s where you come in!

As a Java Software Engineer at Ultimate, you’ll be embedded on a development team consisting between 8-30 people where you can work on the next generation of internet software. You’ll get to work directly with other Developers,  Software Testers, Business Analysts, Product Managers, and Directors, all of whom make up the team. In this highly-collaborative environment, you will have the opportunity to grow as a software engineer, and even help mentor others.

A Day In The Life: 

  • Start your day off right by meeting with your teammates to make sure that yesterday’s challenges are today’s wins!
  • Get together with your Business Analysts, User Experience leads and Quality Assurance Engineers at the story kickoff meeting to make sure the code you write is building the software that you want to use
  • Want to talk shop? The tech standup is the place to do it where you meet with your fellow engineers and platform leads to make sure your code is using the latest and greatest practices and patterns
  • After lunch, head on over to a design meeting where you are working with the analysts and fellow engineers to determine what the code and product will look like just a few months from now
  • The team only gets stronger at monthly/quarterly retrospective meetings where your small ideas can have a big impact on how your teams days are going
  • When the day is over, by using our internal communication portal, Ulti Home, you plan on playing poker, volunteering, or going on a run with other Ulti Peeps!

Skills & Requirements

  • Multiple years of experience in web technologies utilizing SOA patterns and REST
  • Relevant experience with at least one statically typed languages Java / C#
  • Knowledge of microservice architecture is a plus
  • Familiarity with Cloud based Software-as-a-Service applications
  • Familiarity using open source frameworks is a plus
  • Relevant experience with relational databases
  • Experience with NoSQL databases (MongoDB), Angular, and Spring is a plus
  • Knowledge of OOP design and patterns
  • Strong use of source code repositories, like GIT and understanding of GIT workflow
  • Willingness to learn new technologies
  • Teamwork is a must

About Ultimate Software

Ultimate Software’s #PeopleFirst approach makes Human Resources human. Our unified HR solution, UltiPro, manages and solves your global HCM, payroll issues. At Ultimate Software, we believe that people are the most important ingredient of any business. That is why creating a culture based on trust, respect, and inclusion is a high priority for us.

Ultimate is ranked #1 in FORTUNE's Best Places to Work in Technology for 2017 and #7 for 100 “Best Places to Work For in 2017.” Ultimate is also ranked #5 on the inaugural list of “100 Best Workplaces for Millennials” and #8 on Forbes magazine’s 2016 list of the “Most Innovative Growth Companies.”

items.title: Lead Frontend Software Developer at 99chairs GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland) (allows remote)
items.content:
Lead Frontend Software Developer

99chairs GmbH

Job Description

Do you love coding? Are you looking for the next step in your career? Then join us.

We believe in creating the perfect places to enjoy unique moments in life. Everything we do is user friendly and beautifully designed. We are a highly motivated and dynamic team of young professionals, hungry for new ideas and striving for the great impact we’ll have on everyone’s life. Our spirit is to have fun while working together – our daily routine is not simply to go to work, but to push great ideas together as a group of friends.
Being a team is a main core value in our company culture as well as improving constantly through the big number of responsibilities each and everyone of us has. At heart, we are a tech company and simply love what we do.

Our mission is to transform our customer’s homes into places they love. Professional interior designers create individually adjusted design concepts across a portfolio of leading furniture brands. Then our customers conveniently order the items they like online at the regular price which will then be delivered to their homes by our merchants.
Receiving a professional interior design service does not cost a fortune anymore – we make it happen: Together we innovate the industry. Together we shape the future of everyone’s lifestyle.

Skills & Requirements

WHAT ARE YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES?

  • Work closely with product owners, designers & other engineering teams to roll out new features and improve existing ones
  • Implement great client side UI, with focus on clean and modular code
  • Mentoring other team members and interns
  • Testing of the front-end code using Javascript tests
  • Keeping our application and libraries updated and using best development practices

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • At least 3+ years of working as a front-end developer
  • You're an expert with JavaScript, with focus on good code quality and principles
  • You know how to scale web platforms, including optimizations and browser or device specific adjustments
  • Experience with JS frameworks such as React
  • Comfortable with Git, Unix and dealing with REST-APIs
  • Our tech stack includes: Ruby on Rails, React, Angular etc.  Experience in these technologies (although not mandatory) is highly desirable.
  • Focused on building responsive interfaces
  • Always up-to-date with latest trends, tools and technologies in the front-end world
  • Experience with front-end testing using Jasmine, Karma etc.
  • Familiar with SEO principles
  • Hands-on experience working with backend tools and technologies such as Node.js or Ruby on Rails is a plus

About 99chairs GmbH

MORE REASONS TO WORK AT 99CHAIRS

  • A dynamic start-up environment with flat hierarchies, short decision-making processes in which everyone makes a difference and significantly contributes to our product and growth
  • The unique chance to experience the growth of a newly founded business by implementing your own ideas
  • Being a member of a young, dynamic and passionate team of professionals with the drive to re-invent the way people live
  • A steep learning curve through exciting and challenging projects with great responsibilities
  • The possibility to furnish your home with our discount rates
  • The adequate equipment you need for your daily work
  • A well-equipped office in the heart of the vibrant start-up hub Berlin provided with everything you need – including fresh fruits, cereals, all kinds of drinks like tasty coffee, tea, juice and water to keep energy levels high


Do you love coding and can you prove it? Do you want to innovate living with us? Then apply by using the link below.

items.title: C/C++ Robot Brain Engineer at Aeolus Robotics, Inc (Palo Alto, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
C/C++ Robot Brain Engineer

Aeolus Robotics, Inc

Job Description

Job Responsibilities

Work with experts developing, iterating and testing robot algorithms, in one or more of these areas:

- Robot motion planning and control

- Visual modeling and perception

- Language understanding

- Grasp planning

- Firmware programming for HW/SW systems

- Other amazing robotics-based challenges!

About you

You are looking for the place to stretch yourself, able to work within a senior, highly performant product team, and aren’t afraid of a challenge.  You are a self-starter with the motivation and skills needed to effectively operate on your own time in your own way while being responsive to the needs of your teammates and the team as a whole.

You love working on the metal and/or deep in low-level or scaled algorithmic code.  You are effective at quickly understanding and operating on algorithms taken from research in AI, Robotics, and Vision, or you have have experience with sensors, motors, and other devices.  You are comfortable working alongside experts in these areas, or are an expert yourself. You have a proven track record of delivering ideas into working prototypes at high velocity.  You have commercial/agile development teaming experience.  You've architected some serious systems and may have even been a team lead.

Flexible Hours & 100% Remote Work

These roles permit flexible working hours and are 100% remote.  You will work in a scrum-based agile development cycle. Whether you prefer contract work or a permanent position, we can accommodate you. You will be working alongside founders, researchers, and engineers to design and build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption.

Skills & Requirements

Required experience:

- 3+ years of professional C

- 2+ years of professional C++

- 5+ years commercial software development

Bonus if you have experience with any of the following:

- Robotics

- Real-time programming and writing control loops

- Writing device drivers or complex algorithmic work

- An understanding of electronics

- Designing and implementing either hardware or software APIs

About Aeolus Robotics, Inc

Aeolus Robotics was founded to bring the first generation of household robot assistants to life, and to market.  Integrating Taiwanese manufacturing prowess and Silicon Valley AI genius, we are breaking ground in general-purpose consumer robotics with capability in unstructured “human” spaces.  Our CTO, an expert in AI and machine learning, was a member of the DARPA team that conceived and managed the Watson AI project. Still operating largely in stealth mode, we’ve got additional key members and breakthrough technological approaches to ensure success in this challenging field.

items.title: Lead Web App Developer in Tropical Agriculture Start-Up at Climate Edge Limited (London Borough of Hackney, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
Lead Web App Developer in Tropical Agriculture Start-Up

£24k - 30k | Equity
Climate Edge Limited

Job Description

We are looking for a talented web app developer to help us deliver scalable solutions to some of agriculture's biggest problems.

By working with us you will start by applying your skill set to the complex world of Tropical Agriculture, creating a web app to visualise environmental data to help coffee farmers battle Climate Change.

You will be working within a multi-disciplinary team and directly communicate with your users. If you choose to continue with us you will also be encouraged to join us (all expense paid) during our work abroad with our users in the fields of Central America, Africa and Asia. 

The position would be initially for a contract with set deliverables, giving both parties an opportunity to get to know each other. However, we are also looking to employ on a longer term basis and, if desired, would look to extend into a longer term salaried position. 

We are flexible to both full-time and part-time applicants and happy for remote working (with regular communication), but we would prefer to work with you in person. 

Skills & Requirements

You will be required to deliver both the front-end and back-end of web app development. You must have strong communication skills and the ability to adapt your skills to the unique challenges faced in developing technology for use in Tropical Agriculture. You must have strong skills in ensuring database security.

With regards to specific technologies you will have the freedom and flexibility to choose what suits you as you will be the lead developer.

About Climate Edge Limited

Climate Edge is a young start up with some big ambitions. We use local data collection to offer
tailored information to farmers and organisations working within tropical agriculture. 

Technology forms the heart of this process, from our development of low-cost weather stations to the web applications we use to visualise this data. 

By working with us you will not just know that your code is making the difference but be able to travel to our where our users live and work in Nicaragua, Guatemala, Honduras, Rwanda, Tanzania and more.

You will truly shape the future of Climate Edge and the future of Tropical Agriculture.

items.title: Neugierig? Frontend Developer (w/m)? In Köln? Hej! at fejo.dk ApS (Köln, Germany) (allows remote)
items.content:
Neugierig? Frontend Developer (w/m)? In Köln? Hej!

€60k - 75k
fejo.dk ApS

Job Description

Wie Dein Job aussieht

  • Bei uns bekommst Du die Chance ein bestehendes, funktionierendes Produkt in Front- und Backend kontinuierlich zu verbessern und Deine Ideen umzusetzen. Die technische Konzeption, aber auch die handwerkliche Kompetenz haben bei uns die gleiche Priorität.
  • Unsere derzeit größte Herausforderung ist der vollständige Rewrite und die Migration der bestehenden Webanwendung im Hinblick auf responsive Design.
  • Im Daily Business konzentrierst du dich auf die Umsetzung von Themen, die zu Beginn der Woche mit dem Geschäftsführer und der Kundenbetreuung erarbeitet werden. Die konkrete Aufgabenteilung geschieht im Team.
  • Derzeit entwickeln wir u.A. eine neue WebUI das heißt Responsive Design und Web Performance sind sicher Themen mit denen Du Dich befassen wirst.

Was wir Dir bieten

  • Eine Rails 5 Anwendung mit modernem, modularem Frontend und genug Raum für Deine eigene Ideen.
  • Fejo.dk ist familienorientiert: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, 30 Tage Urlaub und Teilzeit (80%) möglich.
  • Du kannst entweder an den Standorten Köln (nur Entwickler im Büro), Hamburg und Düsseldorf (inkl. Obst und Getränke) oder aber von zu Hause aus arbeiten.
  • Deine Weiterbildung ist uns wichtig. Für Bücher, Konferenzen etc.pp haben wir ein Budget von ca. 3.000 EUR/Jahr eingeplant.
  • Dein Arbeitsgerät suchst Du Dir selbst aus, denn wir glauben, dass Du am besten weißt was Du benötigst.
  • Wenn Du für Deinen neuen Job umziehen musst, beteiligen wir uns gerne an den Kosten.
  • Und ja, wir zahlen ein marktübliches Gehalt und wenn Du Urlaub in Dänemark machen möchtest, gibt es natürlich Rabatte :)

Skills & Requirements

Was wir uns von Dir wünschen

  • Du konntest insbesondere Erfahrungen mit größeren Frontend-Projekten und Responsive Design sammeln. Wenn Du bereits bei Integrationen von Backend- und Frontend mitgearbeitet hast, umso besser.
  • Du bist fit in Rails-Anwendungen und hast Lust, diese auch weiterhin zu bauen.
  • Technologisch wünschen wir uns Kenntnisse in Ruby on Rails, mit PostgreSQL, DevOpsTooling & Continuous Integration, AWS, Vagrant, Ansible, Packer und Terraform.
  • Frontend-technisch arbeitest Du mit modernem CSS/SCSS, hast JavaScript (ES6) Kenntnisse und kennst Dich mit dem Ausnutzen von modernen Browser-APIs aus. Idealerweise hast Du schon von JavaScript-Tooling wie z.B. Webpack gehört.

Kleine Besonderheit: Da wir auf der Suche nach zwei Kollegen sind, freuen wir uns auch über Doppelbewerbungen. Wenn Du also jemanden kennst, mit dem Du bereits gut zusammengearbeitet hast: Nur zu, nicht jeder muss alles können ;)

Interesse? Fragen? Gleich Bewerben? Schick Deine Bewerbung (CV und ein paar Zeilen genügen) oder Deine Fragen bitte per E-Mail an anna@fejo.dk. Ein paar Fotos vom Office und Team kannst Du übrigens hier (http://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/fejodk-aps) finden. Wir freuen uns, von Dir zu hören.

About fejo.dk ApS

Seit über 20 Jahren finden Dänemark-Fans ihre Traumferienhäuser bei fejo.dk, einer der größten Plattformen für Urlaub in Dänemark. Über 40.000 Wochen Urlaub werden jährlich über fejo.dk gebucht. Neben unserer tollen Kundenbetreuung sind wir auch technisch gut aufgestellt. Und ja – auch wir lösen gerade Alt- durch Neusystemen ab und modernisieren unsere Website und Backendsysteme kontinuierlich.

Das Entwicklungsteam besteht derzeit aus vier langjährigen Freelancern und eingespielten Consultants, die auch weiter mitarbeiten werden. Darüber hinaus sind wir auf der Suche nach zwei festen Frontend Entwicklern (m/w), die unser Team noch runder machen. Auch unser Geschäftsführer hat einen technischen Hintergrund - so dass es Dir nicht an Sparringspartnern und einer anständigen Einarbeitung mangeln wird.

The Joel Test is a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

items.title: Senior Frontend Developer - Ruby & Javascript (50/50 London & Remote) at Purepoint () (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Frontend Developer - Ruby & Javascript (50/50 London & Remote)

Purepoint

Job Description

Want to work on a web application used by hundreds of thousands of customers? We're looking for a senior frontend developer to join us from mid-April. You would join our existing team of 8 developers. This role requires you to be in Central London for 3 days a week and remote for the remaining 2 days. This is a contract role and will run for a minimum of 6 months. Based upon performance, this can be extended. Please note, no travel expenses are paid for this contract.

Every other week we conduct sprint planning with our client. Your input on frontend here would be vital. Tickets are then assigned and the coding commences. Designs are provided by the client’s in-house design team. We then peer review our commits and hand it over to the client’s in-house QA team.

Mediating between the client’s requests and desired timelines will be important in this role. For example, imagine that you spotted some simple changes to a proposed design which could reduce the delivery time. That’s the sort of input we’d be looking for.

On a typical day you might:

  • Take part in morning standup with the development team
  • Implement designs based upon user feedback to improve the checkout flow
  • Implement temporary changes to the application based upon seasonal sales
  • Conduct application wide reviews to determine iterative improvements to the overall user experience

Role responsibilities

  1. Work in an agile team, taking part in standups, and retrospectives (Via Google Hangouts)
  2. Understand the structure of existing applications and how to work with them
  3. Interact regularly with our client’s team
  4. Review commits of other team members

What we look for

Our ideal candidate has a great and demonstrable track record of delivering exceptional user experiences. Your very strong interpersonal skills would enable you to confidently interact with the client. When you think a better approach could be taken, you'd share that knowledge and your reasoning with the rest of the team. You would be autonomous and by that, we mean that when you encounter problems, you gather the relevant information to make an informed choice and then move ahead with the optimal decision.

As a Purepoint developer you would work in a small and close-knit group. Our mindset is focused on constant iteration and improvement. Above all, we deliver quality over quantity.

Team & tools

As part of our team, we will give you all of the tools necessary to excel at your role. We use:

  1. Zeplin
  2. InVision
  3. Github
  4. Jira
  5. Trello
  6. Slack
  7. Google Hangouts

What we offer

  • Competitive pay
  • Work remotely
  • Flexibility with your working hours
  • A minimal approach to meetings

Skills & Requirements

  • HTML5 & CSS3
  • Javascript
  • Experience with modern web frameworks (Javascript & CSS)
  • Experience with version control (Git)
  • Capable of building with web performance in mind
  • Strong cross-browser compatibility understanding
  • An inclusive approach to web accessibility

About Purepoint

Purepoint is a remote-first software development agency. We help businesses build better bespoke software. Clients range from rising startups to household brand names.

The projects we do are incredibly varied but they share one overarching theme – putting great minds together to build better software. You’ll have the opportunity to help businesses embrace the newest technology and bring better services to market.

If you like the idea of continuously improving, working at Purepoint is a great decision. We provide everything you need to excel at your role and we’ll do our best to keep interruptions and meetings to a minimum.

Rappi

items.title: Lead Javascript Developer at Planity (Paris, France) (allows remote)
items.content:
Lead Javascript Developer

€40k - 60k
Planity

Job Description

Do you feel like working with cutting-edge technologies and having a decisive impact on how we organize, test and ship our code ?

We are looking for an autonomous and adaptable full-stack software engineer to work on all our projects : our Android React Native app, our end-user web-platform and our microservices. 

Our online booking platform raises really nice technical challenges: delivering to our end-users real-time availabilities based on business rules that can be arbitrarily complex, handle concurrent bookings conflicts, offer salons a fast, reliable, real-time app that works offline to organize their planning.

You will have a chance to participate in the overall architecture decisions and in the choice of the tooling/languages in order to build a product that is reliable, scalable and adapted to quick evolutions.

Your first responsibility will be our end-user web-platform, which includes our booking microservices, and the organization of our testing/continuous deployment process for it.

Please do not apply if you are not located in our timezone (Central European Time)

Skills & Requirements

Basic requirements

  • 3+ years of programming experience in front-end and back-end development
  • Modern web technologies: HTML5, CSS3, NPM, Webpack, Babel,...
  • Solid experience with React and Redux
  • Practical knowledge of shell scripting and at least one scripting language
  • Interest in data structures, algorithms and software design

Not required but would be a plus

  • experience with redux-saga
  • experience with immutableJS
  • experience with React Native
  • experience with Android development
  • experience with AWS
  • experience with Firebase

About Planity

Planity is an online booking platform for beauty, hair, nail salons and spas. We have raised €1M in VC funding and are located in the heart Paris. Join a team of young yet experienced entrepreneurs and take part in revolutionizing the market of beauty services!

Make sure you check our company page on StackOverflow!

items.title: PHP Full Stack Entwickler (m/w) in Hamburg gesucht! at DI UNTERNEHMER - Digitalagentur GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland) (allows remote)
items.content:
PHP Full Stack Entwickler (m/w) in Hamburg gesucht!

DI UNTERNEHMER - Digitalagentur GmbH

Job Description

Als DI UNTERNEHMER sind wir auf die Entwicklung von prozess- und datenorientierten Applikationen spezialisiert. An zwei Standorten entwickeln wir mit 70 Mitarbeitern individuelle Kundenlösungen oder integrieren Lösungen von Partnern.

_Wanted
Unser Systemteam wächst und benötigt einen erfahrenen Entwickler als Stütze und Impulsgeber. Gerade sind wir in einer Phase, in der die Projekte größer werden und an verschiedenen Stellen Hilfe benötigt wird. Wenn du es liebst, deine eigenen Themen zu bearbeiten und zwischendurch anderen zu helfen, dann bist du bei uns richtig und solltest mit uns sprechen!

_Doings

  • Anwendungen mit der Spezialisierung auf Process/Workflow Management
  • Entwicklung von Applikationen & Hilfestellung für andere Entwickler
  • Du berätst Produktmanager und Kunden bzgl. Machbarkeit, Aufwandsschätzungen, Qualitätskontrolle

Skills & Requirements

_KnowHow

  • Du hast Erfahrung in der Software-Entwicklung
  • Du verfügst über sehr gute Kenntnisse der Backend Technologien PHP und SQL (ev. auch Java)
  • Du bringst Erfahrung bei der Entwicklung größerer Web-Applikationen mit
  • Du hast Wissen über die gängigen Frontend-Technologien – HTML5, CSS3 und Javascript

About DI UNTERNEHMER - Digitalagentur GmbH

_DI U for your brain

Bei DI U besetzen wir nicht Stellen, sondern wir suchen nach Menschen mit Leidenschaft für ihr Fachgebiet. Wir verstehen uns als Plattform für ein Team aus Menschen, die ihre Leidenschaft mit anderen teilen oder in Projekte einbringen möchten. Den Rahmen für diese Arbeit schaffen wir mit:

  • Friday-Talks mit Vorträgen zu Fachthemen
  • Deinem eigenen Weiterbildungs-Budget (Tage und Finanzunterstützung)
  • Einer agilen Unternehmensorganisation
  • Einer guten Fehler- und Gesprächskultur
  • Einbeziehung tiefer fachlicher Themen in Management-Entscheidungen

_DI U Spirit

Wir sind nicht laut - sondern nachhaltig und unaufgeregt. Wir überdecken wichtige Fragestellungen nicht mit Spaß, sondern gehen sie lieber an und bieten langfristige Lebens- und Karriere-Chancen:

  • Sehr durchmischte Altersstrukturen
  • Eine gute und geregelte Gehaltsstruktur
  • Moderne technische Infrastruktur und Tools
  • Teilzeitmodelle unterschiedlicher Art
  • Lockerer Teamspirit und -events

_Get in
Wir haben dein Interesse geweckt? Dann melde dich, wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung. Nach einer Erstauswahl vereinbaren wir ein Telefonat zur Klärung von Fragen, bevor es dann weiter an das persönliche Kennenlernen geht.

Wir freuen uns auch auf deine Bewerbung, selbst wenn dein Profil nicht exakt auf die Beschreibung passt.

>Ina Kathrin Pfirrmann
>jobs-hh@di-unternehmer.com

(Bewerbungen bearbeiten wir nur digital. Danke für Dein Verständnis)

items.title: Full Stack Developer - eCommerce at O'Reilly Auto Parts (Springfield, MO) (allows remote)
items.content:
Full Stack Developer - eCommerce

O'Reilly Auto Parts

Job Description

Our team works on Business-to-Consumer & Business-to-Business eCommerce projects adding directly to the O’Reilly Auto Parts bottom line and we are looking for exceptional developers to help us succeed! One of our projects has been the re-platform of oreillyauto.com. We are combining the latest in development technologies with an improved customer experience to produce a site that both increases eCommerce sales and gives the O’Reilly customer the world-class service they receive in our retail stores. Another project has been the refactoring of our existing Business-to-Business site to utilize responsive web design for better support of the changing mobile device needs of our professional installer customers. Some of the tools we use to implement our projects are Java, JavaScript & CSS, PostgreSQL, Eclipse, Intellij, SublimeText, Axure, & Balsamiq for development. We utilize Atlassian tools such as Jira, Confluence, Fisheye, & Crucible for developer productivity.

What we look for in our developers:

  • Love solving complex problems related to serving our customers better – both internal & external customers
  • Enjoy working with teams – our team has around 30 Developers & Business Systems Analysts, most projects consist of teams of five to ten people but larger projects could involve the whole team
  • Senior level experience with Java, HTML5, CSS/preprocessers, and JavaScript/JS Frameworks
  • Experience with Grunt, Gulp, & GIT is a plus
  • Ability & desire to interface with business stakeholders and users to define and refine requirements when appropriate

About our team:

  • We create and customize 90% of our applications in house
  • We are a “work family”! We have fun together and support each other
  • We respect a healthy work-life balance
  • The team keeps open communication through different outlets – video conferencing, team messaging applications, and daily scrums/stand-up meetings
  • Our managers really value collaboration between team members and encourage developers to bring forth creative problem-solving ideas from both a technical and functional aspect

Growth with eCommerce at O’Reilly Auto Parts:

  • We have several career paths, whether you want to be a manager, project manager, or stay technical – there’s a documented growth plan to help you follow the path you choose
  • We want to grow our people – we help to make you better by providing training for both technical and professional development
  • We look to promote from within – O’Reilly is diligent to promote from within our organization with qualified team members

About O'Reilly Auto Parts

O'Reilly Auto Parts is a Fortune 500 company with 59 straight years of continuous growth and over 73,000 team members at more than 4,600 stores and 26 distribution centers in 44 states. We are determined to be the leader in the auto parts industry and believe that our team members are the most important asset in our business.

items.title: JavaScript Web Development Bootcamp Mentor at Thinkful Inc. () (allows remote)
items.content:
JavaScript Web Development Bootcamp Mentor

Thinkful Inc.

Job Description

Mentor Thinkful's most engaged students as they learn the industry practices and programming skills they need to break into and succeed as a web developer!

Our intensive and top rated (across all 5 categories) 4-6 month web development bootcamp uses the power of one-on-one mentor to mold students into self-sufficient programmers capable of advancing their skills as they grow in their careers for years to come. As a Mentor, you will share best practices with the next generation of developers and teach them how to think like an engineer so that they can continue their growth beyond the program. You will help students master computer science fundamentals while building projects using full stack JavaScript.

We've ranked as the number one bootcamp on Course Report (across all 5 categories) for over 6 months! Join our incredible community of 320 developers, designers and data scientists focused on 

Thinkful mentors work remotely and set their own hours. The role is a great fit for experts who genuinely love their work and want to share their expertise, experience, and themselves with awesome students and fellow mentors from around the globe.

Skills & Requirements

  • Skills & Requirements

    • Demonstrated expertise in using front end technologies at an industry level
    • Advanced understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery
    • Professional Experience with Node.JS
    • Professional Experience with React.JS and Redux (or willingness to learn)
    • Experience with Git and GitHub
    • Previous corporate training or teaching experience is a plus

    Great mentors have:

    • A desire to keep your skills sharp by teaching others
    • A passion for sharing best practices
    • Excellent communication skills
    • Infectious enthusiasm for development and for sharing your craft with others
    • Reflect upon and develop their teaching strategies for each learner

About Thinkful Inc.

Thinkful if the top ranked bootcamp according to student reviews on Course Report, the bootcamp industry's leading review publication. While we claimed the top spot in all five of their categories, what excites me most is that we have the #1 instructor team. Read what one of our awesome mentors says about mentoring with Thinkful, here: https://www.coursereport.com/schools/thinkful#/news/mentor-spotlight-jason-humphrey-of-thinkful.
