items.title: Full Stack Developer / Senior Developer at The Washington Post (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
items.content:
Full Stack Developer / Senior Developer

The Washington Post

Job Description

The Full Stack Developer / Senior Developer will work on a variety of projects to support our Story Tools, Metered Paywall and Identity Arc Suite of applications including building out new features, making improvements to existing features and functionality and maintaining and improving our AWS infrastructure.

The ideal candidate has a demonstrated history, and passion for, solving complex technical challenges with a particular focus on efficiency and performance. Our development team is an energetic and forward-thinking team which uses rapid agile development in an open-source, devops cloud-based environment.

Responsibilities include:

  • Developing new, and contributing to existing, platforms that have a critical role in the digital landscape that supports washingtonpost.com.
  • Leading and participating in major architectural decisions, helping to review code and implementations, and bring in new and emerging technologies into the organization.
  • Promoting an agile - prototype first - culture that prizes continuous learning and growth, while maintaining a high regard for quality.
  • Owning the end to end technical requirements and roadmap for major engineering products.
  • Working in tandem with editorial and business partners to build leading edge media products that have a material impact on The Washington Post and the industry.
Requirements include:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or related technical field
  • 5+ years of relevant technical professional experience required (including 2+ years in a software development role) - familiar with both front end and back end technologies
  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum. Experience with JIRA desired.
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate methodologies and their applications to non-technical individuals
  • Openness to working with new frameworks \ languages, a passion to learn emerging technologies & paradigms, and ability to handle occasional ambiguity.
  • Excellent judgment, both in technical and organizational problem solving.

About The Washington Post

The Washington Post was named the #1 Most Innovative Media Company of 2015 by Fast Company – an award reflective of our dedication to transformation, integrity and quality. We are combining our agile, high-performance engineering team with 138 years of world-class journalism to deliver quality content and innovative experiences. We offer an array of products and services including The Washington Post newspaper, The Washington Post app, Washington Post Classic app, washingtonpost.com, WP BrandConnect, Washington Post Live events and Post TV, yet our approach is always the same– shape ideas, redefine speed and take ownership. Every employee, every project, every day.

items.title: Full Stack Javascript Developer at Email on Acid (Greenwood Village, CO) (allows remote)
items.content:
Full Stack Javascript Developer

Email on Acid

Job Description

Email on Acid is dedicated to building an industry leading SaaS application using the most up-to-date and current technologies available. We have a team of world-class engineers who are constantly pushing the envelope. The team is in the midst of a number of site-wide initiatives and we need your help to shape the future of our platform!

We are a looking for a talented software engineer to assist in developing and upgrading our web platform from a LAMP stack to a MEAN stack. In this role, expect to be involved in migrating current features to Node.js while also expanding our product. The right candidate understands modern software design and can break down complex tasks in clear and concise ways. They should have a strict attention to detail and be comfortable learning and applying the newest development methodologies. Candidates should be able to quickly jump into our tech stack (Node.js / NoSQL / Redis / PHP / MySQL) and make a difference. We work with many different programming languages and thrive on the cutting edge of technology. There are no manuals or blogs written to build our product and the right engineer will help define the path of innovation.

Skills & Requirements

Required Skills:

  • 2+ years of experience developing data-driven web applications
  • Experience with Relational and NoSQL databases
  • Experience with application frameworks / libraries (Express / Angular / CodeIgniter etc.)
  • Experience in using event-driven design and JavaScript Promises
  • Experience with back-end performance optimization techniques and a general understanding of algorithms
  • A general understanding of how websites and browsers work under the hood (HTML semantics / DOM API / CSS fundamentals / HTTP(S))
  • Desire to continuously learn new languages, platforms and skills

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deploy new features and enhancements on emailonacid.com
  • Migrate PHP/MySQL modules to Node.js/NoSQL
  • Work with image manipulation and processing technologies
  • Propose and advocate for clean, functional design systems
  • Write clean, maintainable, and testable code
  • Produce responsive and cross-platform features
  • Build reusable components and scalable architecture
  • Introduce and understand development best practices, usability, and semantics

About Email on Acid

About Email on Acid

Email on Acid was born in July of 2009 and is 100% bootstrapped. We are the industry leading provider in email message quality. There are over 100,000 worldwide customers using our platform. When we started this company, email development was anything but easy. The internet was full of resources for web developers, but we could hardly find anything to help email developers. So we set out to create a service that would make it easy to find and fix email problems, and give developers and marketers a place to talk about email. We love email (obviously), and are dedicated to making email testing and marketing as simple as possible.

Benefits:

  • Great People to work with
  • Open PTO
  • Flexible Work Hours
  • 401K with Matching
  • Medical/Vision/Dental
  • Weekly Catered Lunches
  • Company sponsored Happy Hours
  • Company Outings

items.title: Fullstack Developer at AhaWorld (Uppsala, Sweden) (allows remote)
items.content:
Fullstack Developer

AhaWorld

Job Description

Vill DU vara med och skapa aha-upplevelser?

Vi söker nu en fullstack utvecklare att stärka vårt team med. Du kommer delta i utvecklingen av våra spelplattformar vilket inkluderar både backend och frontend. Arbetsuppgifterna kan variera mellan allt från att skapa nya backofficeverktyg, integrera mot en ny samarbetspartner, skapa nya funktioner eller underhålla och förbättra existerande kodbas. Vi bygger ofta för webben, men också appar för både Android, iOS och Windows Phone. För oss spelar det ingen roll vilket av dessa du är mest intresserad av. Vi letar ständigt efter duktiga utvecklare och för dem kan vi erbjuda spännande uppdrag inom de flesta områden.

Personen vi söker har ett brinnande intresse för programmering, är inte rädd att tackla problem och lära sig nya saker. Du som person är nyfiken och driven i ditt arbete, jobbar bra både i team och individuellt, och trivs med frihet under ansvar. 

Beredskap ingår i tjänsten samt möjligheter att över tid även få arbeta utomlands. 

Ditt ansvar

  • Utveckling av/inom backend plattform som innehåller extremt mycket transaktioner
  • API design för back-end services
  • Utveckla våra produkter bingo och casino samt utveckla nya spelvertikaler
  • Säkerställa hög kvalitet och leveranssäkerhet
  • Kompetensförsörjning/förmedling
  • Högst involverad i alla nyutveckling

Skills & Requirements

Kvalifikationer

  • Erfarenhet av utveckling inom högintensivt transaktionssystem
  • Goda erfarenheter av flera programmeringsspråk, design, best practices
  • Erfarenhet av RESTful APIs design
  • Färdigheter inom SQL och design av databaser
  • Erfarenhet av versionshanteringssystem som GIT och SVN
  • Kunskaper inom frontend utvecklare som HTML5, PHP, Javascript, Scala, Java
  • Administration av Linux-servrar
  • Du måste ha befintligt arbetstillstånd för EU/SE

Meriterande

  • Casino domain kompetens
  • Stark analytisk förmåga och utpräglad lösningsorienterare
  • Fullstack kompetens
  • Verbal kompetens
  • Genomförare
  • Noggrann och metodisk

About AhaWorld

ahaWorld AB är moderbolaget i koncernen, Bolaget grundades i slutet av 2007 och investerar inom internetbaserat spel. Kärninvesteringarna är nätcasinot ahaCasino.com, MoboCasino.com, SwedenCasino.com och ahaBingo.com som levererar den bästa spelunderhållningen på nätet i en unik paketering, aha-upplevelsen. Våra kunder spelar casino, slots och bingo med en aha-upplevelse.

ahaWorld's affärsidé är att via sina dotterbolag bedriva internetbaserat spel, och investera i nätbaserade spelföretag som har en lönsamhetspotential och skapa ett långsiktigt aktieägarvärde

Koncernens operatörer drivs av Malta-baserade Aha Limited och dess dotterbolag med licens från Malta Gaming Authority (MGA) och Curaçao eGaming.

Influenster

The more that users communicate with the brands, the more free product, exclusive access, and special offers they receive. We address current marketplace needs by helping brands connect with targeted consumer groups and providing both with an outlet to voice their feedback.

Equity
Supermercato24

items.title: Backend Developer at Christian Care Ministry (Melbourne, FL) (allows remote)
items.content:
Backend Developer

Christian Care Ministry

Job Description

Christian Care Ministry is committed to serving the Lord and our membership with excellence. Christian Care Ministry is a community of believers committed to connecting and equipping Christian’s to share their lives, faith, talents and resources with others, much like the early church did in Acts (Acts 2:42-47).

This position serves on the New Product Engineering Team. That small sub-department of our IT team (under 10 people) is mostly remote.  Their main focus has been making some dreams of the leadership team come true [well, at least the problems that can be solved with code ;-) ]. 

The ideal candidate either has a college degree in computer science, or if not, 5+ years of recent, solid professional programming experience. Our especially ideal candidate has experience with Ruby on Rails. Having only done that in your free time is fine. That tells us you are curious enough to learn on your own.

Our stack contains a very healthy Isomorphic JavaScript client utilizing Heroku, NodeJS, ReactJS, and a few others.  For our mobile apps we’re using React Native, because, well, basically, it’s awesome (and we really think our philosophies of “API First” and “Learn Once, Code Everywhere” are going to be the norm in the near future).  Our backend and API servers use Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Redis and, again, a few others.

Skills & Requirements

Essential Duties:

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code
  • Integrate user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server-side logic.
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs and devise elegant solutions.
  • Make strategic technical decisions related to new products and functionality.
  • Help maintain code quality with self-commenting code.

 
Skills we’re looking for:

  • Appreciate non-precise requirements, even if that means re-work
  • Because of our team dynamics, equally enjoy both working independently or cooperatively
  • Transparency with “work in progress” and time tracking
  • Enjoy writing self-documenting code
  • A very thorough person, who enjoys smart risks
  • Comfortable with iterative and incremental development.

PERKS:

  • Work alongside believers who are passionate about serving one another with the gifts and talents God has given to us.
  • As an employee of CCM, you’ll have many opportunities to pray with fellow co-workers and members. Prayer is a vital part of the ministry here at CCM (James 5:13-16), and each employee must be comfortable participating in or leading prayer on a regular basis.

States we employ in:

  • Colorado
  • Florida
  • Georgia
  • Illinois
  • Indiana
  • Kentucky
  • Ohio
  • Tennessee
  • Texas

items.title: Software Engineer: Web at Open Robotics (Mountain View, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Software Engineer: Web

Open Robotics

Job Description

Develop user friendly, cross platform, lightweight, and mobile interfaces to robotic and autonomous systems. Join our team to help build the next generation of web applications for robotic systems.

Our team has a deep background in embedded devices, robot simulation, and control software. This experience will combine with your knowledge of web technolgies to create a seamless ecosystem of software for robot control, planning, analysis, and simulation.

Skills & Requirements

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop web applications to control and coordinate robot simulation for use in competitions, research, development, and testing.
  • Design and prototype web technologies, such as visualization and anaylsis, for use with physical and simulation robotic systems.
  • Support, maintenance, and documentation of sotware functionality.
  • Software testing and quality assurance.

SKILLS / JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • BS, MS, or PhD in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related field (recent graduates welcome).
  • Knowledge of distributed databases, scaling services, high throughput and low latency solutions.
  • Knowledge of testing and deploying web applications through cloud providers.
  • Experience designing and developing web applications with public REST interfaces.

NICE TO HAVE’S

  • Experience using common web oriented technologies such as Polymer, Go language, AngularJS, Javascript, or Node.
  • Experience connecting web applications with hardware devices, such as IoT devices and robots.
  • Experience developing and maintaining open-source software.
  • Experience writing Android and/or iOS applications.
  • Experience using open source libraries.
  • Experience with ROS, Gazebo, and/or other robotics software.
  • Several years of professional software development experience.

APPLICATION MATERIAL

  • Cover letter, in which you introduce yourself and explain your interest in joining our team
  • Resume/CV
  • Link(s) to code sample(s), ideally in a publicly accessible repository
  • Two references and/or two letters of recommendation

About Open Robotics

Open Source Robotics is a subsidiary of the Open Source Robotics Foundation located in Mountain View, California. We work with industry to support the development, distribution, and adoption of open source software for use in robotics research, education, and product development.

Looking for a lead developer with experience writing Native Mobile apps on iOS platform.

items.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at Invitae (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Full Stack Software Engineer

Equity
Invitae

Job Description

We're looking for strong full stack (python, django, javascript) engineers who will help us create and maintain state ­of­ the­ art applications of highly complex genetic data. Candidates should be well ­rounded in current­ generation front-­end technologies and comfortable working in an agile environment.

At Invitae, we're using genetics to improve healthcare for everyone. Working with us will give you an opportunity to use your technical skills to do real and tangible good -- impacting the lives of patients, families, and future generations to come!

Skills & Requirements

  • 3-7+ years experience with Java, Python, C/C++, or other object-oriented programming languages
  • 3+ year experience with Javascript and well­ established MV* frameworks (ex., react.js, backbone.js, node.js etc.)
  • 3+ years experience with databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.)
  • Familiarity with UNIX environments and scripting
  • Experience with consumer facing, high traffic web applications desired
  • Interest in science and medicine, experience with web analytics,
  • UX design chops are all interesting and a bonus!
  • Self-starter, independent thinker

About Invitae

Invitae envisions a world in which genomic sequencing routinely informs lifelong health care decisions. We provide comprehensive, rapid, and affordable genome sequencing and clinically relevant interpretations of genomic data. We are committed to enabling the utilization of genomic data in order to improve health, catalyze scientific and medical research, and contribute to improved outcomes for everyone.

Invitae is an open, title­-free company that operates as a meritocracy. We focus intently on our ability to deliver reliable solutions that contribute to improving people's lives. We ruthlessly eliminate overhead and policies that interfere with productivity. We have excellent benefits (flexible work environment, flexible vacation policy, flexible expense accounts).

Our San Francisco location is in the Design District, close to Mission/Potrero Hill area.  We also have offices in Palo Alto and Oakland near public transportation too.

items.title: Developers for healthcare software platform at CareEvolution (Ann Arbor, MI) (allows remote)
items.content:
Developers for healthcare software platform

$90k - 125k
CareEvolution

Job Description

Note: this job is open to US Residents only.  Foreign nationals can apply but only if you live within the US.

-

What we do actually matters. CareEvolution's HIEBus platform creates better patient outcomes.

Simply stated, we make web and mobile applications for healthcare. Under the covers, though, a lot more is going on - we have developed a robust software platform that ingresses data, programmatically links that data across institutions on a per-patient basis, and supplies APIs to consume, project, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and useful ways.  Please read our company page for a more detailed explanation of what we do and who we are.

We are looking for software people to help us build out the platform, write data adapters (drivers) to automatically ingress data from hundreds of data sources - in realtime, and to create the next generation of healthcare apps.

At CareEvolution, we don't tell you what to do. Part of the work at CareEvolution is determining what to do. We've designed our organization specifically to promote creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the most difficult problems in healthcare.

Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us (resume@careevolution.com) - and we'll explain what CareEvolution is all about.

Skills & Requirements

Must haves

  • High programming expertise
    • expert knowledge of object-oriented design and design patterns.
  • Solid relational database chops
  • A willingness and ability to actively help define the scope of our work
  • Clinical IT expertise, including one or more of the following:
    • HL7
    • Claims formats
    • IHE profiles
    • CCDs
    • EMRs/EHRs
  • Strategic thinking
    • In terms of helping us be competitive in the marketplace, yes - but more importantly, strategic in helping us deliver on our mission of creating better patient outcomes.  We're serious about this.

Nice-to-haves

  • Expertise with one or more of the following
    • Python
    • ASP.NET
    • MVC 3/4/5
    • MS SQL Server
      • General (light) DBA-type competencies (rebuilding indexes, etc.)
      • Debugging queries, diagnostics with execution plans, SQL Profiler, etc.
    • ETL
    • WCF
  • 2+ years of experience writing and maintaining automated UI or end-to-end tests using tools such as Selenium a strong plus
  • iOS
  • EC2 configuration and administration
  • Interest in and ability to interact with clients as design partners
  • DevOps

About CareEvolution

CareEvolution is the maker of HIEBus - a Health Information Exchange (HIE) software platform - as well as the applications that sit atop that platform. Our software allows healthcare providers and patients to make better decisions faster - and ultimately, create better patient outcomes. We're looking for talented software engineers to join our team in solving some of the most difficult problems in HIE.

CareEvolution's stack has been selected as the technical infrastructure for several statewide exchanges, RHIOs, Providers, and Payers in the US. We also have other large public and private exchange networks, as well as health plan exchanges in active deployment.

Our team is small - still under 100 people - and it is comprised entirely of technical people: perhaps 80 devs, a few clinical experts (including several with medical or nursing degrees), health IT technical documentation specialists, etc. We are self-funded, profitable and have been in operation since 2003. We have a strong start-up culture in that we innovate quickly and in a focused manner with small teams - but without the 80-hour work weeks (see our company page for more details). We partner with a few large companies who have relationships with hospitals and practices in all 50 states - and beyond - to supply the lion's share of our sales and marketing efforts.

CareEvolution's stack is recognized by leading HIE industry analysts as the most technologically sophisticated HIE on the market - by a significant margin.

We are focused and execute very quickly. But we also have a lot of fun - frequent visits to the bar, daily ping pong/darts games in the office, hackathons every eight weeks, biannual company-wide get-togethers, board game nights, rock climbing nights, disc golf days... etc. We are also a very family-friendly organization. We have constant, active teleconference for all of our remote employees (US residents only) - which comprise about two-thirds of the CareEvolution team.

• Fabrique (Amsterdam, The Netherlands)

    • Developer

    We’re looking for a creative developer who sees programming as an art form

    Revitalising. Making the difference. At Fabrique we create work that means something. For ourselves, our customers and also, whenever possible, for society. We call this ‘work with impact’. What do you bring to make this possible?

items.title: Senior ReactJS Developer - Netlify - (San Francisco, Remote) - FullTime
items.content:
• Netlify (San Francisco, Remote)
  • Fulltime Job

    • Senior ReactJS Developer

    We’re looking for an experienced front-end developer who loves working on open-source projects, enjoys interacting with a community, and is capable of being the driving force behind some of our key open-source projects at Netlify.

    You should love building tools for other developers, and enjoy the balance between polishing every little piece of UI on the one hand, and shipping at startup speed on the other.

    Our core tools at Netlify are React and Redux with a dash of Webpack and a whiff of Babel, but it’s more important that you have a solid foundation as a developer and a good sense of architecture and clean code. Frameworks and tools come and go, but the fundamentals stay the same.

    Our Ideal Candidate

    • Has a strong grasp of multiple programming languages, with a focus on modern JavaScript and its ecosystem
    • Has experience with React and Redux
    • Loves a Git-centric workflow with continuous deployment and solid tooling
    • Understands the internals of Git (how trees, commits, blobs, and references work and relate to one another)
    • Is unafraid of digging into new tools, frameworks, and platforms
    • Thrives in an environment where experimentation and failure are celebrated
    • Gives and receives feedback with regard for both emotional and technical concerns

    We Offer

    • Equity
    • Competitive salary
    • Benefits for you and your dependents
    • Lunch, snacks, and drinks at the office
    • Your choice of equipment
    • A strong founding team with backgrounds at GitHub, Docker, Yelp, and more
    • A great office space in San Francisco’s Dogpatch
    • The opportunity to help us change the fundamental way sites have been made for the last 15 years

    About the Company

    The traditional approach to making websites is being disrupted by new technologies. Static site generators, build automation tools, and Git are leading the way.

    Netlify has rolled all the services needed to take your code, build it, and host it on our CDN into a single automated platform. Creating modern, high-performance websites and applications is simpler, cheaper, and more secure than ever.

    We are devoted to building a team of people with different backgrounds and lifestyles. We eagerly invite applications from people of all kinds. We don’t discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, race, citizenship, pregnancy status, or any other differences whatsoever that folks imagine discriminating against one another. If you have a disability, please do let us know what we can do to better accommodate you in our hiring process.

    We’re based in San Francisco and are looking for someone local, but we’re also open to remote employment for the right candidate.

    How to apply

items.title: Roku Developer @ Black Pixel
items.content:
Roku Developer @ Black Pixel

2017-04-30 00:27

Description

Black Pixel is a creative digital products agency. We design and develop beautiful and powerful apps for iOS, tvOS, watchOS, Mac, Android, and the web. We’re headquartered in Seattle, with team members based around the world.

At Black Pixel, team members benefit from policies that promote a healthy work/life balance (generous PTO, flextime, remote working, and full healthcare coverage), create apps used by millions of people, and collaborate with some of the most innovative people in the industry.

Role

We’re looking for an experienced Roku Developer to help build amazing apps using the latest tools and technologies. The ideal candidate comes from a background in app development and has spent at least 1 year building apps for Roku.

Duties

  • Build and maintain Roku apps and BrightScript libraries that can be shared across apps.
  • Write high-quality code, ensuring excellence with unit tests when appropriate.
  • Collaborate with developers, testers, project managers, product managers, and project sponsors.

  • Able to work during North American business hours.
  • Fluency with BrightScript SDK 6 and 7.
  • Experience with Scene Graph.
  • Strong debugging skills using command line tools.
  • Thorough knowledge of multimedia formats and video codecs.
  • At least 4 years of professional software development experience. B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science may be considered toward professional experience.
  • Penchant for learning new technologies, balanced with strong pragmatic thinking.
  • Proficiency with version control and effective collaborative development workflows.
  • Experience with JavaScript tooling (npm, Gulp, etc.) considered an asset.

Black Pixel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Able to work during North American business hours.

items.title: QA Lead @ Waldo
items.content:
QA Lead @ Waldo

2017-04-19 03:08

Description

DESCRIPTION

Waldo Photos is a photo finding platform empowering consumers to toss their selfie sticks, put their phones back in their pockets and live in the moment. Waldo is the only platform that removes all of the friction in getting photos of you taken by others and creates new opportunities for photographers to market and sell their photos. Users can enjoy life’s most precious events and automatically receive images taken of them right on their phones or share images of others they’ve taken without having to lift a finger – whether between friends and family or a professional photographer.

We're looking for an independent problem-solver who values learning, keeps current on technology trends, and enjoys the ownership and accountability that is expected from early-stage team members. Your mission will be to drive the quality of our mobile and web apps and services to the next level, while improving our process.

While we're based in Austin, Texas we have team members across the globe. We are open to remote, international, contract. But we do need full-time commitment.

Responsibilities:

  • Institute, lead and scale the Waldo’s QA department.
  • Formulate test requirements, define and implement test process, create test plans.
  • Create and execute test plans and scenarios, define regression checklists, report bugs, track, and verify their resolution.
  • Help the dev team reproducing and isolating complex issues.
  • Setup, configure, and maintain all test environments and tools, needed to successfully accomplish your mission.
  • Leverage production data to test how our systems perform in the real world
  • Promote best practices for creating and maintaining high-quality software

REQUIREMENTS

Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in software QA with at least 2 years using automated testing for both web and mobile platforms
  • Strong engineering background, have written apps and scripts, which were deployed to the actual users or integrated into production systems.
  • Reliable, detail and results oriented.
  • You communicate well. Your writing is clear and concise, you listen, and you speak up when you sense that there might be a problem or you need help.
  • Expert user of Linux, OSX, Android, and iOS.
  • Prepared and excited to work on your own with minimal supervision.
  • Up to date understanding of the JavaScript ecosystem (ES6/7, babel, webpack, etc)
  • Experience with GraphQL a plus

BENEFITS

  • East Austin office (dog-friendly).
  • Flexible vacation.
  • Competitive benefits
  • Topo Chico and/or La Croix for days.
  • Unlimited high fives.

Details

  • Type: Full time
  • Location: Austin or remote
  • Annual salary: $40,000 - $60,000
  • Equity: 0.0% - 0.20%

Country

Anywhere

Dekeo, a new venture spun out of an ecommerce company, is creating a global online marketplace for customizable apparel with logos or emblems. As we're in a growth mode disrupting a highly fragmented $20B market, there's a huge number of challenges to be solved, exciting ideas to pursue, and value to build.

Are you driven to build problem-solving applications? Do you get energized by collaborating and learning alongside high-caliber team? Are you passionate and pragmatic about the craft of writing code? Your primary focus is to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Some of the responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works. Ultimately, you should be able to create a functional and attractive website to navigate through.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Write clean, maintainable and efficient code
  • Build and maintain critical features and functionality
  • Design robust, scalable and secure features
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle
  • Work cross-functionally with Product Managers and Product Designers
  • Disciplines to come up with simple, elegant solutions that balances everyone’s needs
  • The ability to work well with others in pursuit of a collective and common goal
  • Willing to set up others for success and personally step up to achieve results

REQUIREMENTS

  • BS in Computer Science or relevent background
  • Minimum 3+ years of experience with a track record of building high-visibility ecommerce websites
  • Expert in front-end technologies Javascript/HTML/CSS/AJAX
  • Knowledge of server-side templating languages (ERB)
  • Knowledge of server-side CSS preprocessors (SCSS)
  • Experience with Bootstrap and cutting-edge JavaScript libraries

items.title: Senior Ruby Engineer @ EMEX
items.content:
Senior Ruby Engineer @ EMEX

2017-03-03 22:25

Description

About EMEX

EMEX, a rapidly growing online energy broker, helps customers procure the best electricity and natural gas rates. We're building a revolutionary platform that is changing the way energy is bought and sold in the US. Our unparalleled broker management system powers our internal operations, as well as that of our many partners.

We are looking for a full-time senior software engineer with a focus on Ruby and RoR. We would prefer a candidate near Houston, TX or Portland, OR, but are also open to remote work anywhere in the US for the right person.

Our Team

Our development team works on a variety of systems, all part of our auction platform and broker management system. There is no shortage of challenging problems to tackle, and team members have broad experience across the platform.

We care first and foremost about delivering value in a sustainable way. Quality is incredibly important to us, and we strive for excellence.

Our process revolves around a Kanban board and Github PRs. In a typical day, our developers talk with the business team, write code, review & discuss pull requests with other devs, and deploy to the live site (usually several times a day.) We have evolved a development process that enables us to respond quickly to market opportunities.

Our team is split between onsite and remote. Throughout the day, we primarily communicate over Slack and Google Hangouts. At least once a year, we gather as a full team in the Houston office.

Tech Stack

  • Ruby, Rails
  • MySQL, Redis & ElasticSearch
  • React and Redux
  • RSpec, Capybara and Continuous Integration
  • Chef for infrastructure automation
  • Style: SCSS and Bootstrap

Why work for us?

  • We offer competitive salary and benefits
  • We build things that have an immediate impact
  • We respect your life outside of work
  • We foster a culture of mutual respect

What we're looking for in you:

  • Strong OO design and development skills
  • Expertise in Ruby and RoR
  • Curiosity and desire to learn
  • Excellent communication skills
  • A focus on delivering value
  • The ability to see projects through to completion

This position is only open to individuals with the ability to take a full-time position. No agencies, please.

Country

United States

items.title: Junior Software Architect
items.content:
Do people often come to you for advice when solving challenging programming or infrastructure problems? Do you love designing simple yet robust solutions for complex problems? If so, we may have the perfect opportunity for you here at BriteCore. We're currently looking for a Junior Software Architect to join our team. In this position, you will be working across globally distributed teams and companies to help define, design, and guide the development of solutions for complex problems. You'll also help develop overarching architectural paradigms for use across teams and projects. Additionally, you'll serve as the glue between technical and non-technical team members and clients to help ensure well designed solutions are produced every time. The ideal candidate has an extremely analytical mind, great programming skills, a broad knowledge of available technologies, excellent people and writing skills, and several years prior experience in designing, developing, and maintaining complex web applications.


You Will:



  • Work closely with team members and clients of varying degrees of technical skill

  • Help develop architectural paradigms within BriteCore

  • Identify requirement and dependencies prior to development

  • Create complete and feasible architectural solutions consistently

  • Learn about and assess existing and emerging technological solutions

  • Learn about and apply established software architecture practices


Additional Benefits:



  • Comprehensive health insurance coverage including medical, dental, and vision

  • Retirement plan with company match

  • Remote work available and encouraged

  • Equity Purchase Opportunities

  • Open PTO

  • Use of a regularly upgraded, company provided MacBook Pro

  • Safari Online Subscription

  • Flexible learning time - explore your ideas and new technologies on the clock

  • Flexible schedule

  • Relaxed work environment

Priority will be given to those within approximately 200 miles of Springfield or those willing to relocate. For the right candidate, relocation assistance may be available.

items.content:

Do you want want to make a difference? Do you love interesting challenges? Do you want to influence the direction of your career? Do you love open source technologies? Do you program for fun? If you answered 'Yes' to all of those questions then you might be the great fit for BriteCore. Work with fantastic engineers to develop solutions to complex problems using a variety of cutting-edge technologies, libraries, and software. 


We are currently looking for full stack developers to work in new product development, enterprise support, and data integrity. If you have the skill, attitude, and determination to become a great member of our engineering team, send us an application.

    • Flexible schedule

items.title: QA Lead
items.content: __DESCRIPTION__Waldo Photos is a photo finding platform empowering consumers to toss their selfie sticks, put their phones back in their pockets and live in the moment. Waldo is the only platform that removes all of the friction in getting photos of you taken by others and creates new opportunities for photographers to market and sell their photos. Users can enjoy lifeÃ¢Â Â s most precious events and automatically receive images taken of them right on their phones or share images of others theyÃ¢Â Â ve taken without having to lift a finger Ã¢Â Â  whether between friends and family or a professional photographer.We're looking for an independent problem-solver who values learning, keeps current on technology trends, and enjoys the ownership and accountability that is expected from early-stage team members. Your mission will be to drive the quality of our mobile and web apps and services to the next level, while improving our process.While we're based in Austin, Texas we have team members across the globe. We are open to remote, international, contract. But we do need full-time commitment.__Responsibilities:__* Institute, lead and scale the WaldoÃ¢Â Â s QA department.* Formulate test requirements, define and implement test process, create test plans.* Create and execute test plans and scenarios, define regression checklists, report bugs, track, and verify their resolution.* Help the dev team reproducing and isolating complex issues.* Setup, configure, and maintain all test environments and tools, needed to successfully accomplish your mission.* Leverage production data to test how our systems perform in the real world* Promote best practices for creating and maintaining high-quality software----__REQUIREMENTS____Qualifications:__* 4+ years of experience in software QA with at least 2 years using automated testing for both web and mobile platforms* Strong engineering background, have written apps and scripts, which were deployed to the actual users or integrated into production systems.* Reliable, detail and results oriented.* You communicate well. Your writing is clear and concise, you listen, and you speak up when you sense that there might be a problem or you need help.* Expert user of Linux, OSX, Android, and iOS.* Prepared and excited to work on your own with minimal supervision.* Up to date understanding of the JavaScript ecosystem (ES6/7, babel, webpack, etc)* Experience with GraphQL a plus----__BENEFITS__* East Austin office (dog-friendly).* Flexible vacation.* Competitive benefits* Topo Chico and/or La Croix for days.* Unlimited high fives.__Details__* Type: Full time* Location: Austin or remote* Annual salary: $40,000 - $60,000* Equity: 0.0% - 0.20%

items.title: Senior Frontend Developer
items.content:
Imagine to develop software you believe in, with people you believe in and a leadership that believes in you and your capabilities. Think of a company that enables you to work with the most up-to-date technology and provides you with the development opportunities and challenges you are looking for. Hard to believe? Well, just stop dreaming and come to us.

Who we are

We are Digistore24, an online-reseller and affiliate marketing platform. Everything we do comes down to one simple mission: Help as many enterprises as possible, small and large ones, to have success online, by making their business as simple and automated as possible. We build everything to match this mission. No dogmas, no borders, no-nonsense.

Who you are

Optimizing user experience and creating beautiful interfaces that are easy to use is the most satisfying thing for you. You simply think and act through the eyes of your user. While your focus is on the frontend, you are able to connect it to the backend, too. After several years of experience you want an engaging role where you can directly influence a thriving company’s new products from scratch.

Job description

You’ll be the key frontend developer with a strong focus on turning creative designs into highly functional, pixel perfect web interfaces. You are going to work in a small team with a flat hierarchy, so you will have a lot of creative freedom and responsibility to implement elegant, maintainable, and usable solutions. With your knowledge you will contribute to building a strong frontend foundation for all our web projects. 

We want you to:



  • Develop all user-facing features of our new web projects

  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UX/UI designs

  • Collaborate with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability

  • Create quality mockups and prototypes

  • Write functional requirement documents and guides

  • Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Support back-end developers with coding and troubleshooting

items.title: Expert Ionic 2 Developer
items.content:
We need an expert Ionic 2 engineer for an up and coming project. The project is expected to last for a couple of months. There is an existing backend but all Ionic development will be from the ground up. It will support all common platforms, iOS, Android, and Desktop.

We are looking for someone
  • with in-depth knowledge Ionic 2 and Angular
  • located in North America
  • excellent written and spoken english
  • who is familiar with contracting

About
We are Northern Logic. A small software development agency that enjoys taking clients ideas, helping shape them and making them reality. We love Progressive Web Apps and apply PWA concepts appropriately in order to deliver a solid end product that clients and users alike will be delighted to use. We work on a variety of projects that require the composition of many, sometimes bleeding-edge, technologies.

How we work
We are a 100% distributed team which means we understand and trust contributors to manage their own schedule which gives flexibility most companies can not offer. Adhering to the Remote principles we do require some overlap with the rest of the team during business hours. Also we only work with engineers based in the United States and Canada in order to help ensure consistent overlap.

To apply: Email careers@wearenorthern.com with your resume and a short introduction. Links to previous projects, github profiles, or anything else that you are proud of or excited to share are appreciated but not required.

items.content:

Our platform allows customers to book, manage and keep track of their international freight as well as use analytics to drive intelligent supply chain decisions that help their businesses thrive.

Our goal is to build a smarter supply chain.

We're eager to work with people who are:
- Excellent to others and believe in building healthy relationships through open and honest communication
- Scrappy, initiative-taking with a figure-it-out-for-yourself attitude, and a desire to get things done
- Enjoy teaching others and are proactive
- Naturally empathetic for our end users and have an ability to translate that empathy into delightful online experiences
- Excited by having their work validated by qualitative and quantitative A/B testing

Expected Skills:
- Write code in Ruby
- CQRS & EventSourcing
- Develop RESTful APIs
- Integrate with JSON and SOAP based APIs
- Write background processes
- Develop a web application using the Ruby on Rails

- 1 or 2 month freelancer work with an excellent team of 4 developers (3 back end, 1 front end)

To apply: Send a resume to artur@zencargo.com or jan@zencargo.com

items.title: Senior Web Developer (Remote)
items.content:
DESCRIPTION
Our company is growing! We're looking for an awesome full-stack senior developer to work on PayrollPanda - Malaysia's fastest growing cloud Payroll app. It's an exciting time to join a proven group of entrepreneurs and developers. Get a share in a start-up and awesome benefits.

REQUIREMENTS
  1. At least 5 years of commercial development experience or you're some kind of genius coder straight out of university.
  2. Extensive experience with web development technologies including Javascript frameworks (preferably Backbone), NodeJS, MongoDB
  3. Agile (Kanban) software development

BENEFITS
  1. REMOTE working: Literally work anywhere within Asean, our only requirement is that you work during/close to Malaysian working times, 9am to 6pm and have fast Internet access. If you live outside of Asean it probably won't be suitable for you unless you want to move to Malaysia!
  2. Live in Malaysia (Optional): If you want to move to Malaysia you are encouraged to apply. We have an international team that all love living here. We will also provide you with a working visa.
  3. Work-life balance: Typically work only 35 hours. Many of us have burnt out before and we want to prevent it happening again to any of our team.
  4. Competitive salary and earn EQUITY. Work with us not for us!

To apply: We only accept applications done via WorkAble: https://payrollpanda.workable.com/jobs/459001

items.title: Senior Full Stack Magician
items.content:
We are looking for a developer well versed in HTML, CSS, Javascript, and PHP. While these are required as foundational languages, being the first and primary developer for the projects you will be working on, you can enjoy the flexibility of working with any framework. We’re flexible, so even if you primarily work with C# or any other languages, but have experience developing web applications, send us your CV! :)


Although based in Australia, Avant8 has presence in the US and leverages it to deal with domestic brands and investors, specializing in turning around their distressed digital assets. Our team creates innovative solutions that work well under pressure allowing for new business models to tested rapidly in any market.


We’re looking for A-players, and part of that involves autonomy. You will be assigned tasks, both small and large, and a general time frame, but given the autonomy and freedom to schedule your own daily tasks as long as you complete what needs to get done. We understand and respect that you know development better than we do and it’s not our place to call unnecessarily strict or irrational deadlines and ways of completing tasks. This may be a good place to add that you should, when applying, mention your favorite food and, if you’re feeling ambitious, include a picture: this is to weed out applicants who mindlessly apply en masse to listings.


Given the above mentioned autonomy and freedom, you will be expected to debrief with a daily summary of what was accomplished, problems you ran into, what’s planned for the coming days, and maybe a joke or two. :)


We are a fun, friendly, and closely knit team, and although geographically distant, we have a strong work ethos and communicate regularly allowing for a very friendly and efficient work environment. Being a part of a new division within an established company, you get the best of both worlds in terms of job security and company culture. We work hard and expect the same from all of our team members.


We work hard, but we also play hard. You should come with a great sense of humor and a smile on your face, because you’ll have a few laughs and enjoy your time working with us. We reward hard work with a variety of perks incorporated in our flexible working environment.

items.title: Senior Ruby Engineer
items.content:
HotDoc is venture backed by AirTree Ventures. Check out their newest opportunity below!


HotDoc is a Series-A funded software startup that helps promote better health outcomes for all Australians by improving the way that patients and doctors communicate. We’re passionate about building products that have real impact on patient health outcomes and delivering services that support the sustainability of Australian healthcare.

Over the past twelve months, our team has tripled in size, and we’re really excited about the growth that is still ahead of us. We’re on the lookout for a Senior Ruby Engineer who will contribute to HotDoc’s platform that helps hundreds of thousands Australians every year gain better access to healthcare.

A day in your life as a member of our Melbourne-based team will involve developing key new features from inception to production and integrating them with cutting edge health technologies. You’ll also have the opportunity to take ownership of new products and actively turning ambitious ideas into elegant tools that directly impact patient outcomes across the country.

In return, you’ll have the chance to work as part of a results-driven team that recognises great work, offers flexible work hours, encourages ongoing learning, and provides plenty of development opportunities on projects that actually excite you. You’ll also be joining an early stage Australian startup that has the potential to grow into something huge within the SaaS industry, work within an amazing culture that values collaboration, a sense of humour, and loves to celebrate success.
