items.title: FULL STACK RUBY ON RAILS DEVELOPER
items.content:
NO AGENCIES, DIRECT CANDIDATES ONLY

Yogassential is an exciting new concept that will revolutionise how yoga is practiced across the UK. We provide a mobile and web-based platform for clients to find and book local yoga teachers at their home or office.

We’ve just launched our app to our private testers and we're very excited to be releasing to the public in June. We truly believe that Yogassential has a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional yoga studio model, changing how people practice yoga and the type of people who do!

THE ROLE

We are seeking an energetic, committed and passionate junior Rails developer to join our small, dedicated team. You will have fluent technical and business English. You will have demonstrable real-world experience in Ruby, RoR, JS, HTML and CSS.

You will work closely with our CTO maintaining our existing Rails back-end as well as adding new features as required. You will also be creating our new customer-facing web app from scratch using technologies of your choice.

IDEAL SKILLS
Javascript, jQuery, CSS, Sass, HTML, Haml
Ruby, RoR, Rspec, Sidekiq,
Postgresql or MySQL
Heroku, AWS, GC or similar cloud experience
TDD / BDD
Providing web APIs for mobile clients
iOS or Android experience a plus
Able to manage your own work and collaborate remotely on features through Trello, Github, Slack etc.
An entrepreneurial, get-it-done attitude

WHAT WE OFFER
Flexibility of remote work and hours, with an expectation to be on-site at least part time
Remuneration matching experience
Play a key lead role the leisure sector’s tech revolution and gain valuable dev experience whilst doing so

Our growing team is based in the North West. We are interviewing locally and nationwide in order to find the best fit for Yogassential, although proximity to Manchester would be a big plus.

Salary - up to £30,000 per annum

items.title: Software Engineer (Front End)
items.content:
THE ROLE

We're looking for a Front End Engineer to help us continue to build our amazing product. You'll join a talented and friendly engineering team who pride themselves on delivering great code in an industry where privacy, security and reliability are crucial.

This role is a unique opportunity to work with new Javascript frameworks with a strong focus in React and other modern packages in Javascript’s ecosystem as we continue to scale and optimise our ID verification solution. Using best practice engineering methods, this role would work closely with our Product and UX teams to understand our users and optimise our user experience.

As our Software Engineer (Front End) you will be responsible for:

Feature Ownership: end to end coding from architecture to testing, for new features prioritised in our product roadmap
Product Design: Working closely with our Design and Product teams to help design and build intuitive solutions
Improving stability: Reviewing architecture to ensure code quality is robust
Experimenting with new frameworks in the Javascript ecosystem to optimise code and application quality.
Our Stack:

We primarily build in Ruby (with Rails), Javascript (with React) and Elixir (with Phoenix). Our ML engineers work with Python, Torch and TensorFlow - and we run our services on top of Kubernetes and AWS.

Learn more about our engineering team and projects by following our blogs on Medium

REQUIREMENTS

Good knowledge in at least one JavaScript framework (Ember, Angular, Backbone, React) and ES2015
Enthusiastic and technically curious about the Javascript Ecosystem
You are passionate about designing and creating rich user experiences and usability

Nice to have's:
Working knowledge of at least one other language (e.g. Ruby, PHP, Python)
Experience with testing via technologies like Jasmine, QUNIT, Mocha
Launching graphic editors does not scare you

To be a great fit with the Onfido team, and to really enjoy working with us, you'll be:

A person passionate about their work and also their wide ranging personal interests, we like people who are interesting and interested!
An innovative thinker - the kind of person who is always experimenting with new tools/ systems/ approaches to do things better and faster
A caring and sensitive team member - generous with your own time and highly considerate of your colleagues'
Able to manage time and prioritise tasks effectively, ability to multi-task is a must
Able to think critically, draw upon previous experience to make decisions independently, and exercise good judgment

BENEFITS

We're committed to making Onfido a fantastic place to work, so we go to great lengths to give you what you need to succeed. You will receive:

Share options
25 days holiday, plus bank holidays
Health Cash Plan
Subsidised gym membership or home cleaning
Free yoga classes, 5-a-side football bookings
Unlimited budget for any software or books you need
Free languages classes (currently Spanish, French and English)
A fully stocked kitchen with unlimited breakfast, drinks, snacks and fresh fruit every day
Clubs: Coding, Running, Theatre, Games, Poker, Movies and many more!
Cycle to work scheme
Season ticket loan
Monthly company dinners
Quarterly socials (e.g. cookery classes, go-karting and private cinema trips)
Friday afternoon drinks
Relaxed and informal office environment

items.title: Lead QA Tester
items.content:
Location: London

Salary: £48-52K

Fancy getting involved with one of London’s most exciting start-ups?

We’re looking for a Leader for our QA Testing team who’s not afraid to get stuck in. We’re passionate about what we do. We want someone who can share that passion.

We can’t promise a quiet life – in fact, we promise quite the opposite. We have over 450,000 members now and we’ve got UK and global expansion on the brain. It’ll always be exciting, and you shouldn’t be afraid of a challenge.

Things move fast at Perkbox; we need someone who can keep up and who enjoys working in an environment a million miles away from the sharp suits and boredom of Canary Wharf.

Can you picture yourself working for an innovative and disruptive start-up that ranks #2 on the list of Best UK Startups?

http://startups.co.uk/startups-100/2016/2-perkbox/

We have just become the second fastest funded company on Seedrs.

You can see more about our culture here:-

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QG-X026SXoU&feature=youtu.be


We are looking for

Superb leadership skills and experience applying them in an agile environment
Excellent level of knowledge with Selenium Webdriver - should be able to build automated frameworks using selenium from scratch and integrate them with CI and Sauce Labs
Experience with API testing
Experience in setting up QA processes
Knowledge of performance testing would be a big plus!


Join our team

We’re a dedicated bunch of people from a range of backgrounds. Working here can be hard, but we think it’s always fun. The support team’s music choices can be a real challenge for new starters.

We’re constantly dreaming up new and better ways to do what we do. We’re making a name for ourselves as a disruptive presence in the market with a knack for driving high quality users and revenues.

We’re succeeding in our vision and we’re looking for great people to join in and drive that success.

items.title: Javascript Engineer
items.content:
*DESCRIPTION*

We believe the world would be a better place if we all talked about money a little earlier on in life. In fact, research by Cambridge University and the Money Advice Service shows that many of our habits to do with money are formed by the age of seven. That’s a pretty amazing opportunity to help give kids a head-start in learning the value of money.

RoosterMoney are busy transforming the way families learn about money, starting with a pocket money tracking app for 4 -14 year olds. We aren’t doing too badly for a company that is only a year old either, with families in over 20 countries and our mission is to teach children the value of money on every continent. You can see how some of our families have been using us here.

*THE ROLE:*

We are looking for a product centric Front End Engineer to join our team. You will be working with the rest of our team to build the very best application to help parents teach children the value of money around the world. You have a passion for UX and UI, best practice development and building a product that delights users on a daily basis.

*KEY RESPONSIBILITIES*

* Play a critical role in designing and developing our app.
* Ship and taking ownership of impactful new features and functionality.
* Develop robust deployment and testing processes.
* Working closely with a small group of determined, like-minded people to reshape the way families talk and engage with money.

*REQUIREMENTS*

*Essential:*

* You have built and shipped Single Page Web Apps.
* You enjoy building products that delight users and focus on their needs, as well as business objectives.
* You have excellent pure javascript skills.
* Worked with JSON web-services.
* Are confident with Node.
* Utilised Less CSS.
* Appreciate great UX and UI and best practice development.

*Desirable:*

* Knowledge of architectural patterns such as MVC, MVV* (Backbone).
* Knowledge of a centralised state management pattern such as Flux, Redux or Vuex.
* Experience with Cordova/PhoneGap.
* Experience with React.
* Experience with Webpack.
* Experience with Multi-lingual User Interfaces.

*BENEFITS*

We are offering a competitive salary and options for the right candidate.

You will be joining a small team passionate about changing the way families engage with savings and the value of money. We will consider remote working for this role but you will need to be able to spend a percentage of your time in London.

items.title: Full Stack Developer / Technical Co-Founder
items.content:
The Company
We’re an early stage fully funded technology startup, founded by professionals from the hospitality sector, with a clear vision to change the way the local takeaway delivery market operates. Our aim is to connect customers with their local restaurants in a community-based deal, offering reward services to customers and a new fairer process for independent restaurant owners.

Job Description
We’re looking for an experienced full stack developer with a passion for technology and software to join our startup. Working in a small entrepreneurial team you’ll have the opportunity to develop our tech platform from the ground up, taking ownership of the project from day one to lay down the infrastructure for our online and mobile presence. Once we’ve got the main nuts and bolts in place we’ll be looking to expand, so good people skills and the ability to lead a development team will be a plus. If you’re an individual who likes a challenge, thinking outside the box whilst working in a multi-discipline dynamic environment, keep reading.

Responsibilities (To name a few...)
• Developing our web presence and mobile apps in a full stack environment
• Integrating third party partners and services
• Product design and strategy
• Testing, optimising and scaling product platforms

Skills and Qualifications
• Problem solver who gets things done
• A demonstrable passion for technology and software
• Ideally 2+ years of commercial experience building customer facing products
• A degree in computer science or a related subject
• Strong command of HTML, CSS, Javascript
• Backend programming experience (Python, PHP or similar)
• Clear understanding of database management systems such as MySQL or equivalent
• Knowledge of design tools such as Photoshop or Illustrator
• Ability to write readable well-structured code
• Experience developing Android applications (experience with iOS apps a plus)
• Good communication skills and a friendly team player
• Ability to “translate” technical language into layman’s terms to ensure stakeholders understand your work
• Legal right to work in the UK

Benefits
• Flexible work arrangements
• Choice of new work laptop
• Equity participation
• We’re an early stage startup, help us decide what other perks you’d like
• If you’ve read this far, you’ll realise this role is offering a unique opportunity to ultimately help develop a platform from day one in your own style. Something which if you’re passionate about programming, we hope will excite you.

items.title: Graduate Software Engineer
items.content:
_Company Description_

Anomali delivers earlier detection and identification of adversaries in your organization’s network by making it possible to correlate tens of millions of threat indicators against your real time network activity logs and up to a year or more of forensic log data. Anomali’s approach enables detection at every point along the kill chain, making it possible to mitigate threats before any material damage to your organization has occurred.

_Responsibilities_

* Design, implement and maintain solutions in Anomali’s product portfolio
* Work with Product Management, Anomali Labs, and QA teams to help scale our platform and advance our integrations.
* Create and support data processing pipelines and storage systems for threat intelligence data.
* Verify, identify root causes, and correct customer issues.
* Occasionally develop bi-directional integrations with outside security products.

_Qualifications_

* BSc/BEng in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience
* 1+ years of Linux/Unix software development proficiency in any of the following languages; Python, Java, C++
* Experience with relational databases e.g. PostgreSQL
* Exposure to continuous integration processes and platforms such Jenkins, Bamboo
* Source control experience e.g. git
* Works well in an agile team environment

_Desired Skills/Experience_

* Experience with NoSQL database technologies e.g. MongoDB, Redis
* Knowledge of full-text search engines such as Elasticsearch
* Understanding of Cloud / SaaS based infrastructure and virtualized environments e.g. AWS, VMWare, Docker

_Medical_

* Private Healthcare Plan
* Dental Plan
* Optical Plan

_Work-Life Balance_

* Paid Public Holidays
* Accrued Paid Time Off – 25 days
* Quarterly event with your Geographic Team

items.title: Senior Android Engineer
items.content:
Overview
Popsa is an e-Commerce startup that uses data to automatically create personalised prints such as photobooks, calendars, posters, canvases, and postcards.

Our vision is to generate beautiful keep-sake mementos and personal photo-diaries entirely in the background – selecting the best user-generated content via machine learning algorithms before programmatically designing an appropriate layout.

We print from the best facilities in Europe and deliver direct to your door within days.

Our aim is to build a subscription service to your memories; your best photos carefully curated and lovingly presented, printed and shipped to you each month – all without lifting a finger.


You and the Role
Small screen and an SDK: The possibilities are endless!

We’re after a Google Fan-[boy | girl] who’s on top of the latest UI design and interaction techniques. You’ve probably already mastered Material Design.

We’re a mobile-first business and we are committed to getting our app experiences right. This is a role for for a brave and ambitious Android dev who can lead this project to completion.

In March last year, we launched on iOS to prove a concept. We’ve been single-platform for over a year, and now it’s time to fix that!

We’re expecting a lot from the person who fills this role. You’ll be responsible for how a whole new audience interacts with Popsa and we’d expect you to use best practices, but that responsibility comes with a highly-flexibile working environment and a mandate to design and build the best solution as you see fit – the ideal candidate will thrive here.


A Growing Team
We’re recently funded and ready to grow; you’ll be the first Android developer but we don’t expect you to work on your own for long. You’ll help us grow this part of the business and we’ll strengthen the crew together.

This team is ego-less, caring, hungry to learn, collegiate and eager to experiment. These philosophies should be shared by anyone applying for this role. If you’re up for the challenge, read on, I’d love to hear from you.


Education & Experience
Education is everything, but we recognise there are many ways to get it. You could have a BSc/MSc in Computer Science (or a related subject) but you might be a self-taught superstar. We don’t discrimnate on education, it’s the results that matter.


Expertise
Android SDK – you know this like the back of your hand
Testing frameworks – we’ll be happy as long as we get good coverage
RESTful APIs – working with core APIs will be essential
Common SDKs – Facebook and Firebase should be familiar to you
Analytics Packages – we’re fans of MixPanel
Git – we’re big on branching workflows, pull requests and code reviews
Code deployment – like Jenkins or AWS CodeDeploy
Terminal – your shell choice says a lot about you
Using a Professional IDE like Android Studio

If you have a few years of commercial experience under your belt (freelance or employed) that’s a definite bonus. Make sure you tell us about it when you apply.

Ideally
You’ll have dabbled with the dark side and know what your iOS counterpart is going through
Know your way around an SQL database
Be familiar with AWS Services like EC2 & AutoScaling, Lambda, CloudFront, Route53 — these are core part of the Popsa stack

Expectations
We’re a close and hard-working team; happy to share workloads and work late at crunch time, you’ll need to be a team-player.
We’re sticklers for neat, maintainable, well-documented code that follows the conventions for the language or framework you’re working with. We’ll expect you to feel the same way.
We work in an Agile team with quick iterations, regular deployments, weekly sprints; it helps if you’ve experienced these working patterns.
We’re driving towards increased automation so we expect everyone to contribute to this DevOps culture with high-visibility of application performance.


Rewards
You’ll receive a competitive salary, but most importantly, you will also get to own part of the business.
Popsa has an share options scheme that is open to all employees.
We’ll tell you all about it as part of the interview process

items.title: Front-end Developer (JavaScript/HTML/CSS)
items.content:
Front-end Developer required to join exciting FinTech business backed by serial entrepreneurs. You will be leading the front-end development, building state-of-the-art web applications that help small businesses access the finance they need for growth. You will be joining our team of experienced industry experts at our HQ in Bermondsey, London.

This is a rare opportunity to work on greenfield applications from the earliest stages. We work using agile practices in an environment where everyone is comfortable in owning their progress against delivery objectives. This role is primarily front-end though may also appeal to full-stack developers keen to focus on and refine their front-end skills.

*Responsibilities :*

Working as a key member of the product team, you will transform wireframes & UX prototypes into beautiful, rich user web-based experiences for our customers. You’ll also own our marketing micro-sites, email templates and landing pages.

You will be comfortable working across the full product lifecycle, from ideation through to launch, and beyond.

You will enjoy building new things, solving complex problems whilst understanding the scope and impact of your work.

*You’ll have :*

* Strong HTML5, jQuery, AngularJS, CSS, JavaScript skills
* Experience in integrating web apps into existing RESTful APIs
* An interest in design-for-testability and TDD
* A real passion for design with an eye for detail
* Experience of git, continuous integration & agile delivery approaches
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills

*Helpful but not essential :*
* Design skills (including Illustrator, Photoshop etc) and experience of design for print

*In return, we offer :*
* The ability to truly craft and influence our product offerings both technically & operationally
* Competitive salary (+ share options) and 28 days’ holiday per year
* Flexible working in a cool working environment with on-site gym & restaurant
* Your own Macbook
* Regular company socials, lunches & meetups
* Access to our conference/training budget
* Ability to collaborate with an inspiring group of serial entrepreneurs in building a groundbreaking venture-backed business

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We’re able to offer flexible working arrangements including part-time, full-time, temporary, permanent plus temp-to-perm; just ask for details!

We welcome applications from all sections of the community irrespective of background. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability.

items.title: Back End Magento Developer
items.content:
Evode Group

Evode = Everything On Demand.

This encapsulates the Evode Group's principal mission to become one of the world's largest retailers of 'customised' consumer products by adopting the AirBnB, JustEat and Uber Business Model - operating a head office with no cost-heavy assets and zero warehouse inventory and delivering millions of customised consumer products on-demand.

Evode Group aims to disrupt the ‘Wholesale Model’ where customers have long since suffered at the hands of traditional wholesale companies.

Since inception, the company has developed two retail platforms - the first allows fans of major global brands to customise and create their own ‘officially licensed’ merchandise by selecting from thousands of artwork, design, quote and customisation options for Apparel, Accessories, Homeware products. The second is an online gift retailer with the world’s most advanced personalisation technology greeting cards.

We have already acquired the rights for multiple household brands. These include Liverpool FC, WWE, Star Trek, Quentin Tarantino (back catalogue), Thunderbirds, Power Rangers, Talking Tom, and we are in line to acquire 30+ more in the near future.

On our online gift retailer platform, we harness the world’s obsession with social video, our greeting cards aim to change the landscape of greetings and gifts forever with its innovative use of augmented reality technology. Our principal unique selling point is that each greeting card can be personalised with a video using our Choosey App. A physical card is sent to the recipient who scans a code to play a video embedded inside the card.


The Role

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Magento, PHP, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, MySQL Developer to unleash their creative flare at a innovative and forward thinking start up in Waterloo. The successful candidate will be responsible for the end to end delivery of the two websites.


You will be responsible for:

As Magento Developer, you will be responsible for developing new features and functionality to our websites whilst maintaining / optimising and eventually building a small team as the company grows.

Requirements:
3+ years experience of working with Magento 1.x
5 years experience of PHP5 and MySQL
HTML5, CSS3
Javascript & JQuery
Excellent communication and problem solving skills
Positive can-do attitude
Knowledge of Git and Agile processes
Magento Certification would be desirable but not essential

IN EXCHANGE YOU WILL BE GRANTED:
Equity
An incredible list of global brands to work with
Fast-paced, competitive and ambitious working environment
The promise that every time you deliver on targets, we will deliver on perks
No cap on what you can earn and achieve within the business
A chance to be a part of the team behind a possible £100m+ company exit
A chance to cement yourself as one of the industry’s rising talent as part of an already award-winning team
An exciting journey full of ups and downs but with a guarantee you will never be bored, undervalued, or ignored

items.title: Senior Dev Ops Engineer
items.content:
*DESCRIPTION*
Festicket is transforming the way music fans discover and book tickets and travel packages for festivals around the world. Our platform revolutionises the music festival industry by offering an end-to-end experience for music travellers through an efficient two-sided marketplace for 900+ music festivals across 50 different countries! In three short years, we have become Europe's largest music festival platform.

*YOUR ROLE*
We're looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer who specialises in all things AWS.

We've had a big funding round in the middle of last year and our technical team is growing rapidly (from 4 to 16 people so far). We need to bring our technology and infrastructure up-to-date to meet the business's ambitions for the next few years. This includes migration to the Cloud (currently in progress) and implementing a React SPA as our customer facing site (with all the architecture changes that come with this).

We are a team of 16 looking to grow to over 20 immediately. To do this we need a dedicated DevOps Engineer to manage our infrastructure and build the development, testing and deployment processes for our expanding technical team.

*THE STACK*
http://stackshare.io/festicket/festicket

*REQUIREMENTS*

*YOUR ATTITUDE*
You're someone who's smart, organised, motivated and gets things done. You want to work in a startup environment, because you like the idea of doing a bit of everything and taking ownership of what you work on. You have ideas about everything, and you're not afraid to argue your point (while respecting everyone else's of course). You're constantly thinking "how can we do this better?".

You're passionate about:

* creating robust, flexible and performant infrastructure using the latest technology and best practices
* making the development workflow as smooth and efficient as possible through automation and tooling
* creating and managing effective continuous integration & delivery/deployment processes
* being an integral part of the development process, not just a system administrator, and working in a collaborative technical team

*YOUR SKILL SET*

Must have:
* Expert in provisioning, operating and managing all things AWS (we make use of ELB, EC2, ECS and ECR, RDS, Redshift, CloudFormation and many more...), ideally 5+ years experience, minimum 3 years.
* Expert in Docker based systems
* GNU/Linux system administration and networking
* Git
* Expert in CI/CD workflows and tooling
* Experience with configuration management (ideally Ansible) and IaC (ideally CloudFormation)
* Excellent knowledge of Python, with development experience
* PostgreSQL
* Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g New Relic, Datadog, Sentry, Kibana)
* An excellent understanding of high availability, load balancing and service discovery concepts and technologies
* A computing or software engineering degree. In the absence of one we expect you to show that you've taken steps to fill this gap in your training/knowledge.

Nice to have experience with:

* Django
* React
* Node
* Celery
* ChatOps
* E-commerce websites

*BENEFITS*
We're a team of 70 located in an amazing converted piano factory and recording studio in Camden (NW1 8LH) a short stroll from Camden market and Primrose Hill. By joining us you will be part of one of the fastest growing music / travel start-up companies in Europe, where you will have ample opportunity for career progression as we continue to grow.

We have a company culture which is very idea orientated and driven but also very social. It's entirely normal at 6pm on a Friday for half the company to be drinking together in the office and then planning to head out for a night out.

Benefits also include:

* Cycle-to-work scheme
* Free tickets for music festivals worldwide
* Free breakfast - including cereals, bread, marmalade, etc.
* Weekly delivery of beers, food, snacks, fruits and drinks
* Weekly Friday drinks
* Fun monthly company events
* Regular internal Ping Pong tournaments
* Sales Trainings & budget for conferences
* 1 remote working day per month
* Regular team lunches
* Perks - free Festicket T-shirts, Jumpers and more
* Fun environment & great office next to Primrose Hill
* Value driven start-up culture.

items.title: Node.js Back-end Blockchain Developer - Award Winning Product
items.content:
*Node.js Back-end Blockchain Developer - Tallysticks.io*

Here at Tallysticks, we are revolutionising invoice financing through blockchain technology and are now looking for to grow the team.

Tallysticks is a young start up, around since 2015, and we have developed an exciting and industry-changing solution to a problem many SMEs that work in big supply chains face: cash flow and invoice financing. Our solution is a portal that SMEs, large corporates and financiers can access to help with this funding gap by utilising blockchain technology.

We have developed an award-winning product and now want to tweak the the product and further develop our portal based on user feedback.

*_We are looking for someone who:_*

* Wants to build an industry-changing blockchain product
* Can take ownership from the get-go and work with minimal guidance
* Ideally has experience of building enterprise applications in Financial Services
* Has experience and a proven track record building full-stack applications with JavaScript / Node.js

*_The details_*

* Immediate start but we’ll wait for the right person
* £35k-£60k & equity negotiable based on experience
* The position is London-based at Level 39, Canary Wharf with some travel required
* We offer flexi-time but cannot offer remote work

*_Responsibilities_*

* Server-side development of the product based on a revised technical architecture and current client feedback
* Work with the technical and commercial team to make technical decisions and consolidate product delivery
* Primarily, to deliver the product a number of clients ranging from SMEs to large corporates

*_Required Experience_*

* Min. 4 years experience with Node.jd
* Has understanding of security and cryptography
* Has experience of web paradigms such as REST, WebSockets
* Linux command line
* Good knowledge of modern JavaScript: ES6, Babel
* Build, testing and automation tools
* Cloud computing platforms: Azure, AWS
* ElasticSearch, Redis, SQL databases and NoSQL databases
* Experience in distributed ledgers, decentralized applications and blockchain platforms such as Ethereum and Hyperledger
* DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, Continuous integration & delivery, site reliability



_NO RECRUITERS_

items.title: Working Student JavaScript Developer (m/w)
items.content:
Do you already have experience in using Frontend JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React or Ember.js? You have a strong interest in working with Ember.js on Single Page Applications? And in addition you have a good knowledge of HTML/CSS? Then we are thrilled to get to know you!

About the job
You will work with an existing Ember application and be responsible for implementing new features, polishing existing features and improving frontend tests to integrate more closely with our RESTful API
You will work with modern browser APIs to record video across multiple browsers and platforms, and work closely with Node.js, Django and Flask applications in a Docker-driven environment
You will work in an agile team alongside an experienced Ember developer and 3 experienced Python developers

Requirements
Experience with single page applications using Angular, React, Ember.js or similar
Strong interest in working with Ember.js
A good feel for delivering great user experience and design using HTML5 and CSS3
Very good communication skills and business fluent English (German is not required, but would be an advantage)
Finally, we appreciate great team spirit, a sound business understanding and the motivation to build fantastic products

Our offer
Interesting and challenging work on market-proven products that already positively affect the future career decisions of tens of thousands of professionals in various countries
Nice, down-to-earth and experienced colleagues who have big ambitions to make a dent in the recruiting universe
Working in a nice and bright office in the middle of Berlin-Kreuzberg and all the latest equipment you need to be super productive
Several perks & benefits, such as free drinks and food in the office, Telekom hotspots, monthly travel pass (BVG ticket), regular team events (from basketball matches to TEDx conferences), lots of free (or heavily discounted) vouchers, leisure activities, etc.
And finally, after a probation period, every team member can participate in our stock ownership programme

About viasto

viasto is a Software-as-a-Service company, based in the center of Berlin. Our product, the interview suite, allows companies to get to know their job applicants via video in order to avoid wrong selection decisions, mainly in high-volume recruitment processes. Our service is used by large corporations, such as Beiersdorf, Microsoft and Telekom, as well as successful startups like Goodgame Studios, Lovoo and Trivago. If you want to make a difference in your work and are convinced that recruiting can be made a whole lot better, then you’re in the right place. We’re always looking for talented and motivated team members with a hands-on approach and an ambition to succeed.

Interested?

We look forward to receiving your application including your CV, your tech stack, references and if possible code samples or a link to your github profile. In case you cannot provide code samples we would happily invite you to a little challenge.

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
We are looking for a senior full stack developer to join our team and help us finish building, and then refine our suite of AdTech products.

There is a range of products that you will be working on across the adtech stack, from campaign tracking and reporting software, to a Demand Side Platform and Data Management Platform.

The work is pretty varied and we always try to keep ourselves working on something interesting. We have an open, collaborative culture and work within an agile project management methodology.

We mostly work in python and node at the moment but we are platform agnostic and happy to try out new technologies. Key Skills Required are:

- python

- nodejs

- HTML/CSS

- Backbone.js

Ideally you will have several years experience building for the web, preferably in an adTech environment. We have a relaxed culture, encouraging flexible working, regular team lunches, private health insurance, and EMI options.

The salary is between £40k and £50k depending on experience.

items.title: Statistics/Optimization Software Developer (m/f)
items.content:
We are looking for a Statistics/Optimization Software Developer (m/f)

Adspert was founded in Berlin in 2010 and our innovative technology launched just one year later. Based on trading systems used in banks to do stockmarket trading, Adspert automatically organizes and optimizes online advertising. Bertelsmann Digital Media Investment and the Bell Group's support Adspert as strategic partners and investors.

Today, around 20 Adspert employees are hard at work in the heart of Berlin, passionately Implementing the vision of developing bid management of the future.

We offer:
We develop our solutions with Python, Go, JavaScript and PostgreSQL and mainly work on Linux and Mac. Distributed version control, test-driven development and automated deployment processes are basic working methods. With us, you can expect a friendly atmosphere and a healthy attitude to the balance between work and leisure.


Your profile:
– Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline or equivalent practical experience.
– Professional knowledge of relational databases (ideally PostgreSQL).
– Experience in implementing solutions to statistical problems, preferably with Python and SciPy.
– Version control and automated tests are essential to any software project for you.
– You try to find simple solutions to complex problems and find ways to objectively assess the quality your approach.

Your tasks:
– Build statistical models for different effects in the online advertising market.
– Implement robust estimates that provide plausible results even in difficult cases.
– Evaluate the result quality of existing implementations.
– Use efficient algorithms to achieve results on large amounts of data without causing excessive resource consumption.
– Develop automated tests for complex optimization problems.

Have we sparked your interest?

Apply now! Send your application including your salary expectation as well as the possible starting date.

items.title: Web Developer/Designer
items.content:
Creative Cores is a small media company and brand consultancy firm, specialised in creating websites and apps for innovative clients, from ambitious startups to established corporations.

We’d like to expand our in-house development capacity so we’re looking for a skilled web developer/programmer to join the team. The role would especially suit someone with a few years experience who is now looking for a new challenge as part of an ambitious and fast-growing team.

Here are the things we’re looking for:

• Solid knowledge of HTML 5, CSS 3, PHP, Java Script/Ajax/JQuery, MySQL, and able to build static, responsive, dynamic, CMS based and e-commerce websites.
• Able to use ready solutions as well as frameworks (i.e WordPress (important), Magneto, Shopify, Bootstrap, Codeigniter, Laravel etc)
• Good knowledge of configuring web apps/websites in a production environment
• Able to integrate different known APIs
• Able to accurately translate designs into code (Pixel perfect).
• Excellent attention to design and layout details (Extremely important)
• Knowledge of UI/UX best practices.
• Willingness to work independently and take the lead on projects
• Good standard of written and spoken English
• Good eye for typography and layout
• Excellent problem-solver with an ability to learn quickly
• Entrepreneurial working style, comfortable with constantly changing priorities
• Has excellent time-management and organisational skills.
• Has an eye for detail, likes to do things right first time, and gets a real kick from solving a problem.


Any of these would be a bonus:
• Preparing web development proposals for clients
• iOS, Android, app development
• Knowledge of NOD and Angular
• Knowledge of Adobe Photoshop
• Search Engine Optimization skills
• Knowledge of social media based marketing solutions
• Sketching and wire-framing
• API development


What we offer
• Competitive Salary
• Small, tight-knit team so you’ll have a key role in the design/development of our products, and will have bright chance to become a team leader/manager because we will be expanding our team
• Fast-paced, varied work on websites and for a wide range of interesting clients
• If you work late, we buy your dinner and have it ordered to the office
• Coffee, tea, water
• Great location, 5 minute walk from Canons Park station. (Jubilee line)

Position available:
As soon as possible

How to apply:
Please send us your CV along with a covering email explaining why you’d like to come and work with us. Also, please add web links of some of your recent work if possible.

items.title: Front-End Developer – 1 month – London
items.content:
Front End Developer – 1 month – London
Location: London
Duration: 1 Month
Start Date: 25 April

Daily Rate: circa £325 (please quote expectations)

We are an art tech start-up looking for a front end developer to join our team on an exciting time in our journey.
We are looking for a front end developer to assist alongside the CTO on our existing web application, and on bringing a new SaaS product to the market.

To date we have:
* Assembled the largest database of art.
* Successfully participated at Ignite Accelerator.
* Closed three rounds of financing from respected angels.

Key Specifications

We use Git, version control and pivotal tracker. Please reach out to us with a brief resume and portfolio, and possible start date.

- In-person meeting

items.title: Senior Frontend Developer (50/50 London & Remote)
items.content:
Want to work on a web application used by hundreds of thousands of customers? We're looking for a senior frontend developer to join us from *mid-April*. You would join our existing team of 8 developers. *This role requires you to be in Central London for 3 days a week and remote for the remaining 2 days*. This is a *contract role and will run for a minimum of 6 months*. Based upon performance, this can be extended. Please note, no travel expenses are paid for this contract.

Every other week we conduct sprint planning with our client. Your input on frontend here would be vital. Tickets are then assigned and the coding commences. Designs are provided by the client’s in-house design team. We then peer review our commits and hand it over to the client’s in-house QA team.

Mediating between the client’s requests and desired timelines will be important in this role. For example, imagine that you spotted some simple changes to a proposed design which could reduce the delivery time. That’s the sort of input we’d be looking for.

On a typical day you might:

* Take part in morning standup with the development team
* Implement designs based upon user feedback to improve the checkout flow
* Implement temporary changes to the application based upon seasonal sales
* Conduct application wide reviews to determine iterative improvements to the overall user experience

*Role responsibilities*

* Work in an agile team, taking part in standups, and retrospectives (Via Google Hangouts)
* Understand the structure of existing applications and how to work with them
* Interact regularly with our client’s team
* Review commits of other team members

*What we look for*

Our ideal candidate has a great and demonstrable track record of delivering exceptional user experiences. Your very strong interpersonal skills would enable you to confidently interact with the client. When you think a better approach could be taken, you'd share that knowledge and your reasoning with the rest of the team. You would be autonomous and by that, we mean that when you encounter problems, you gather the relevant information to make an informed choice and then move ahead with the optimal decision.

As a Purepoint developer you would work in a small and close-knit group. Our mindset is focused on constant iteration and improvement. *Above all, we deliver quality over quantity.*

*Team & tools*

As part of our team, we will give you all of the tools necessary to excel at your role. We use:

* Zeplin
* InVision
* Github
* Jira
* Trello
* Slack
* Google Hangouts

*About Purepoint*

Purepoint is a remote-first software development agency. We help businesses build better bespoke software. Clients range from rising startups to household brand names.

The projects we do are incredibly varied but they share one overarching theme – putting great minds together to build better software. You’ll have the opportunity to help businesses embrace the newest technology and bring better services to market.

If you like the idea of continuously improving, working at Purepoint is a great decision. We provide everything you need to excel at your role and we’ll do our best to keep interruptions and meetings to a minimum.

*What we offer*

* Competitive pay
* Work remotely
* Flexibility with your working hours
* A minimal approach to meetings

*Requirements*

* *HTML5 & CSS3*
* *Javascript*
* Experience with modern web frameworks (Javascript & CSS)
* Experience with version control (Git)
* Capable of building with web performance in mind
* Strong cross-browser compatibility understanding
* An inclusive approach to web accessibility

items.title: Frontend Engineer (JavaScript with React.js)
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

**No recruiters please

We’re searching for a proactive Frontend Engineer who is able to write high quality web apps and that is passionate about delivering a great user experience in both desktop and mobile. You’ll take responsibility for building Zeelo’s consumer app which will be the main channel for our customer’s booking process.

This is an opportunity to be an integral part of a small team with huge ambition.

----------------------------------------------------------------

What you should know about Zeelo:

* We’re on a mission to build a global pop-up transport platform that will transform inter-urban travel, by intelligently using data to generate unscheduled and direct coach routes

* We’re a small young team of do-ers, finding a balance between thinking big and getting stuff done. Our team culture encourages people to be:
- Ambitious - anything is possible with a can-do attitude
- Empowered - make intelligent and informed decisions. Ask for forgiveness, not permission
- Cheeky - don’t accept anything because ‘that’s the way it’s always been’. Be cheeky and challenge the status quo

* We’re a well funded startup with transport and technology experience. We’ve identified a huge opportunity

----------------------------------------------------------------

REQUIREMENTS
You should be/have
* 6 months of work experience using React.js
* A proficient JavaScript developer, using existing frameworks to build dynamic data driven interactive web experiences
* Experience in working with Frontend technologies like HTML5, CSS3, DHTML, javascript

* Experience in using version control systems as GIT and comfortable working with branches
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
* Outgoing - able to communicate well externally and also with the rest of the team
* Creative, driven, proactive and motivated to try new things
* A versatile, practical, pragmatic worker capable of working autonomously and as a part of an interdisciplinary team

We'd really like it if you
* Send us projects that you feel proud of along with your CV
* Have worked in a startup or worked on your own projects

----------------------------------------------------------------

BENEFITS
* Great culture. Humble. Creative. Friendly. Talented. These are the people we hire and this is our working culture
* Flexible working hours
* 22 days holiday a year
* Zeelo team socials every couple of weeks
* Commitments to training and development opportunities every quarter - just ask for what you need and we’ll do our best to make it happen

items.title: Junior Front-End Developer
items.content:
*ABOUT US*

We are a diverse team of engineers, entrepreneurs and teachers, who believe that every child, irrespective of background, wealth or location, should have individual access to teaching that will inspire a love of learning and help them reach their potential.

We build intelligent technology that connects a global community of online tutors to thousands of students in schools across the UK, to provide extra help for children at risk of social or academic failure.

Having proven our model, raised £2.5m and worked with thousands of pupils delivering over 100,000 hours of 1-1 tutoring through our platform, we are pursuing very ambitious plans to expand both our scale and scope. We’re looking for top talent like you to join our team and help us achieve our vision.

*WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR*

We are looking for a true team player who is passionate about building great user experiences for our customers. This includes children so a creative nature is key!

We want a person who has a hunger for learning and is keen to make progress individually, and to improve team, product and business performance.

*REQUIREMENTS*

+ Expert in HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript
+ Strong interest in design, usability and UI
+ Excited to create products that customers/children love
+ Knowledge of technology and processes to build consumer facing high quality interactive web services & applications
+ Proactively research and take pragmatic technical decisions (framework selection, refactoring etc)

*BONUS EXPERIENCE*

+ Ruby on Rails
+ TDD & BDD
+ Previous background or academic training in design (degree, work experience etc)
+ Experience of mobile app development: iOS / Android / Cordvova
+ Experience/interest in building UIs for education and/or children
+ Contribution to OS projects

Mobile virtual classroom – Having built our own virtual classroom we are expanding this to fully support mobile touch based devices. We are exploring Native iOS/Andriod, web (HTML) and hybrid (Cordova etc) development options.

PaaS – we are moving our platform architecture toward micro-services to provide automated scaling, and a PaaS to support external clients

*BENEFITS*

+ Join one of the fastest growing ed tech social enterprises

items.title: Full Stack Ruby on Rails Developer
items.content:
*ABOUT US*

We are a diverse team of engineers, entrepreneurs and teachers, who believe that every child, irrespective of background, wealth or location, should have individual access to teaching that will inspire a love of learning and help them reach their potential.

We build intelligent technology that connects a global community of online tutors to thousands of students in schools across the UK, to provide extra help for children at risk of social or academic failure.

Having proven our model, raised £2.5m and worked with thousands of pupils delivering over 100,000 hours of 1-1 tutoring through our platform, we are pursuing very ambitious plans to expand both our scale and scope. We’re looking for top talent like you to join our team and help us achieve our vision.

*WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR*

We are looking for a true team player with experience of building consumer focused applications. We want a person who has a hunger for learning and is keen to make progress individually, and to improve team, product and business performance.
 
We constantly evaluate technologies, often with spike (prototyping) days (Node/Phoenix/Elixir current candidates) so your ability and desire to rapidly adopt and adapt, applying previous knowledge, is more important than specific language/framework experience.

*REQUIRED SKILLS*

- Ruby on Rails
- Javascript
- SQL
- Familiarity with MVC frameworks
- Understanding of Object-Oriented Design principles
- Automated testing

*PREFERRED SKILLS*

- TDD & BDD
- AWS knowledge
- Understanding and ability to implement SOLID principles
- 3+ years experience

*TECH CHALLENGES OVER THE NEXT 12-24 MONTHS*

Mobile virtual classroom - Having built our own virtual classroom we are expanding this to fully support mobile touch based devices. We are exploring Native iOS/Andriod, web (HTML) and hybrid (Cordova etc) development options.

Learning via Big Data - partnering with Institute of Education, UCL, and Edinburgh University to understand the interactions that take place within our classroom to automatically & intelligently determine best teaching practice. Includes data processing, AI, machine learning, voice analytics.

PaaS - we are moving our platform architecture toward micro-services to provide automated scaling, and a PaaS to support external clients

*SALARY:* £40,000 - £60,000 per annum

*BENEFITS*

+ Join one of the fastest growing ed tech social enterprises
+ Office in London’s tech hub
+ Beanbags, social events, beers every Friday
+ Perkbox; free tastecard, mobile phone insurance, discounts, cinema!
+ 25 days holiday

items.title: Full Stack Ruby Dev - Remote+Freelance
items.content:
NO AGENCIES, CANDIDATES DIRECT ONLY, PLEASE (not a joke).

Full stack ruby dev – Full time, freelance, remote, 9+mths work.

Seeking a talented full stack Ruby & JS developer for remote, full time, lead developer work to complete the front and back end build of a cleanly coded Rails 4 app.

Complete business & tech fluent English language skills essential. Multi year Ruby, RoR, JS, JQuery, Haml, HTML & CSS experience essential.

A 9 month full time work commitment is required, there will be more work available beyond this. Product owner (code literate) and business operates CET hours. Work together via Slack + Small team Agile Kanban Trello style + Skype. Possibility of additional remote developer partner to support. Fair remuneration commensurate with experience.

*We are looking for:*

A talented developer that lives and loves great code, creativity, innovation and building high quality applications and experiences. Someone back and front end fluent that appreciates good design, UI and UX.

_Key Skills:_
• Front End; Javascript, jQuery, Angular, CSS, Sass, HTML.
• Back end; Ruby, RoR, Rspec, Postgresql.
• Infrastructure; Heroku, AWS.
Front or back lean? Where are your strengths in the above?
• Good design and UX understanding, close design team engagement rqd.
• Agile, small team Kanban via Trello.
• Be honest, reasonable and fair as are we.
• Be able to communicate well.
• Have an entrepreneurial, get it done, attitude.

*We offer:*
• Flexibility of remote work and hours.
• Healthy remuneration matching experience.
• Work with industry leading minds, experienced entrepreneurs and bright passionate minds.
• Play a key lead role in a sector’s tech revolution and gain valuable dev experience whilst doing so.

If you’re interested please send us your CV and tell us all about you, your work and experience. We’d also like to see your github & stackoverflow profiles and any code work/portfolios that you can provide us with.

We look forward to hearing from you and thanks in advance.

The Human Benefits team.

*NO AGENCIES, CANDIDATES DIRECT ONLY PLEASE.*

items.title: Magento Back End Developer
items.content:
*DESCRIPTION*

ExpoCart is an ambitious tech start-up in the exhibition industry and we’re on a one-way mission to reinvent the way people discover and hire equipment online, for their exhibitions. We aim to make it quicker and easier than ever to organise equipment whilst providing an unrivalled customer experience.

Our curated marketplace with thousands of products from furniture and props to audio visual equipment and printing allows users to seamlessly order everything they need for their event from our trusted network of event suppliers.

It’s an exciting time to join us as we’re experiencing rapid growth and have recently transitioned to our brand new B2B booking platform.


*THE ROLE*

We are looking for a Magento developer who is truly passionate about building great products and who is hungry to make a huge difference to an industry that has not changed for years. You’ll want to make your mark and we will give you the opportunity to consistently push the boundaries of what is possible in order to make ExpoCart an industry leading platform.

You will thrive on building new features, iterating it until we get it right and working with a talented, close knit team. You will be at the heart of the product building it alongside our small tech team!

We’ll offer you the chance to have ownership of work and to not wait for opportunities to come, we’ll give you permission to use your own initiative and think outside of the box.

*REQUIREMENTS*

* 1+ years of professional Magento experience - Preferably Magento 1.9 but not essential
* Excellent knowledge of PHP 5.5+ and object oriented programming
* Design patterns
* Very good code quality and lots of passion!
* Version control with GIT
* Strong knowledge of JavaScript/jQuery
* Good understanding of CSS2/CSS3 and SCSS pre-processor
* Good knowledge of MySQL 5.6
* Good communication skills and time management

*BENEFITS*

* £30,000 - £55,000 competitive salary based on experience
* Your choice of kit and tech
* Vibrant, relaxed working office complete with sofas, coffee on tap, fully stocked beer fridge and team table tennis games!
* Challenging role with fantastic personal growth opportunities
* Office located in the Olympic Park, next to the canal with skyline views of central London.
* Discounted membership at the Olympic gym, swimming pool and velodrome.
* Friendly, close knit team – team lunches and Friday beers & drinks

If you are awesome and want to be part of a successful start up story, we would love to hear from you!

items.title: Full Stack Junior Developer at BNBHelper
items.content:
*Job Title:* Full Stack Junior Developer

*Hours*: Full Time (part-time can be considered on case-by-case basis)

*Joining*: Start Immediately

*Location*: Shoreditch, East London

h2. About the founder - Sam Ghosh

I am a city-based professional in my mid-30s. I co-founded a company called Earthmiles as a CTO, that focuses on health-rewards and incentives ("https://earthmiles.co.uk/":https://earthmiles.co.uk/) and now working on a new business that will be launched in summer 2017.

Prior to this, I have been working in banking/hedge fund for over 10 years, and then started a city-based fund with a couple of ex-colleagues ("www.voltairecap.com":http://www.voltairecap.com/).

I am well connected in the finance and startup scenes in London. I am also a property investor and focus on holiday-lets/short-term rentals and construction/conversion in certain areas in London.

Here is my Linkedin profile - "http://bit.ly/2hPRV1l":http://bit.ly/2hPRV1l

I have built production quality systems, supporting total users of more than 100,000, from scratch – ground up and with 80%+ of codebase written by myself.

As the CTO of Earthmiles, I built the entire backend and front-end Android codebase from scratch, in Python/Django and Android respectively and also the current website. It supports over 80,000 users
Fashbae – another site I built from scratch (Django Backend + React/Redux frontend) has over 20,000 users


h2. Technology Stack

Below is our tech-stack and we want someone who knows some of it, and has the enthusiasm and capacity to learn the others very fast

*DJango Framework and Python.*
Django Rest Framework
Python Social Auth – and integration with Facebook, Google+, Twitter
AWS EC2 deployment, using several AWS services
Celery; RabbitMQ or Redis Queue
Django testing framework - – unit, functional and integration testing (Jenkins)
Test driven Django
Logging systems – Logentries, sentry, opbeat
Django-viewflow – an esoteric package that is really useful and I have talked about in several Django conferences in UK
Scraping using python scrapy
Sample "txt":https://gist.github.com/somghosh/2e8e45cff86be22d30c0eea4791333b3 - "https://gist.github.com/somghosh/2e8e45cff86be22d30c0eea4791333b3":https://gist.github.com/somghosh/2e8e45cff86be22d30c0eea4791333b3


*React JS/ Redux framework*

React JS + React-redux framework
React-redux-router
Redux-saga
I use "https://github.com/react-boilerplate/react-boilerplate":https://github.com/react-boilerplate/react-boilerplate and adhere to general framework.
Sample "json":https://gist.github.com/somghosh/a65552923a631911e569264404cc52f9 - "https://gist.github.com/somghosh/a65552923a631911e569264404cc52f9":https://gist.github.com/somghosh/a65552923a631911e569264404cc52f9

*Java and Android programming* – with demonstrable apps on the Play Store if possible

REST API and asynchronous programming techniques, some working knowledge of backend systems that servers data to front end
Working with UX designers in the past – should have good UI/UX skills that can be used to continuously improve the product
Database – I use Realm.io
Integration with Facebook, Google+, Twitter SDK
Knowledge of various third-party packages that can be leveraged upon – we use Retrofit, GSON, Lombok, Parceler, Cardslib, Android Annotations, Picasso, OKHTTP,
Unit and Functional testing
Sample build.gradle dependencies - "https://gist.github.com/somghosh/2a081f42e1d59ed26a7519d8a5c25099":https://gist.github.com/somghosh/2a081f42e1d59ed26a7519d8a5c25099


*Objective-C and/or Swift iOS programming* with demonstrable apps on the App Store

REST API and asynchronous programming techniques, some working knowledge of backend systems that servers data to front end
Working with UX designers in the past – should have good UI/UX skills that can be used to continuously improve the product
Coredata/Restkit/AFNetworking
Integration with Facebook, Google+, Twitter SDK
Knowledge of various third-party packages that can be leveraged upon
Unit and Functional testing

*Knowledge of these technologies would be useful but not essential*

Git and continuous integration systems
Analytics platform like Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Keen.io, Segment.io
Push Notifications architecture (GCM and APNS)
Mailing systems – MailChimp, Mandrill and their integrations with Django
Helpdesk systems like Zendesk and integration with Django

h2. What will you be working on - BNBHelper

BNBHelper and its core product Zerlock is a suite of tools to help different players in the short-term holiday rental market streamline their business. The sharing-economy in real-estate has been a buzz word for the last few years and will only be increasing in its reach over the next 5 years and with increasing players in the market, there is a need for technological tools to help such market participants. BNBHelper is creating a suite of such tools

This startup comes out of my experience in the real-estate market for last 3 years to simplify pain points for hosts in the short-term rental market in UK and abroad. It is being backed by some high net-worth property investors in UK and by BOK Construction (http://www.bokconstruction.co.uk/) a London based construction company focussing on high-end construction

Different coding/development streams include:

* AI engine / chat bot for replying to guest enquiries and post-booking questions faster
* Scraping of quasi-open data to infer market competition analysis
* Home automation in several different ways to have total picture of when guests check in, which rooms they use and when, improved security and improved customer-service messaging. We will play around with various Internet of Things technologies available today and pick the best ones and integrate them in our project and improve upon them
* A guest-composite score analysis using heavy use of scraping, machine learning and other algorithms to separate good guests from bad guests.
* Scaling up all of the above to a production-ready level

There is existing code-base for all of these above but a lot of ongoing work is still necessary and in the business roadmap.


h2. Who a we looking for:

A junior developer with “stay hungry, stay foolish” mindset, who has proven track record of “hacking” from his bedroom/dorm-room for a considerable period of time.

You love knowing and learning new technologies and using them towards practical applications and solving real-life problems and making cool things

Solving that nagging bug, or learning that new intricate package to fit into your codebase keeps you up till late night.

You can think and build things from first-principles when necessary, but also know how to use existing packages and join their dots and integrate them well to the desired end.

College-programming degree is great, but not essential. I have mentored and helped junior developers in the past to the point that they single-handedly maintain full-stack (front end + backend) code bases for actual commercial apps for well-funded startups currently, and I will be helping you out in a similar manner and you will work very closely with me (at least 3-4 hours of face to face time each day)

You should be able pick up things fast as you will have a lot to learn. I encourage you having an aim to perhaps starting your startup within 2-3 year’s time from all the knowledge gained (tech/marketing/fund-raising) from this experience.

If you are keen, I will be happy to expand your role to more than a developer (to help in marketing/business/fund-raise) in the near future, given your enthusiasm and ability. It is in fact encouraged.

The job requires a good attitude towards problem-solving and debugging, and working under tight-schedule.

You should aim to work 5-5.5 days a week, sometimes under tight schedule but when there are no pressing needs, you are welcome to work on your own projects for 1 day a week – which I will happily work with you on/mentor/advise/invest into if appealing.

h2. Compensation - £27000 per annum equivalent

Probationary period: 2-5 months depending on your current experience – GBP 1000 / month (net in hand)
Post probation – GBP 1500 / month (net in hand)

You would have a probationary period of 3 months, post which we will have a longer term permanent engagement agreement.

Bonus – after completion of 1 year – GBP 3500 minimum contractual (and more depending on you performance and business performance)


You can expect periodic revisions in compensation every year at least (if not earlier) and being assigned stock options after the first fund-raise of BNBHelper. Also you can expect very healthy increase after the completion of 1st year.

If you have present commitments, for the right candidate a part-time agreement for an initial period (at a different compensation level) will also be considered till you free up to become full-time

items.title: Full Stack Developer (Python)
items.content:
*Loughborough based in-house role for our first full-stack software developer*

*Who are we*
We are the pioneers in cricket simulators for entertainment and training. We have developed the world’s first portable, IOT ready and fully automated machine that allows the batsmen to watch the bowler on the screen and also play the ball after it's delivered. We have gained significant traction in the past year with the English Cricket Board, Gary Kirsten's Coaching centres and several County cricket centres currently using our product. We also ran 65 events last year and we are on track to have our simulators installed in some of the high profile tournaments worldwide. We have made installations in Canada and South Africa with looking to expand to Asia and Australia. Our products have gathered great interest from both local and international markets allowing us to expand our core research and product development team.

We were founded by a pair of childhood friends from Kenya that were passionate about cricket. We have recently been backed by some of the world’s leading technology investors and entrepreneurs.

*Who we are looking for*
We are looking for our first full-time stack developer who is enthusiastic, self-motivated and is passionate about developing software for IOT enabled embedded devices. The successful candidate will part-take in research and development activities within the cricket simulator and other sports technologies we have in the pipeline.

*Job Details*
Refine existing cricket simulator software and address bugs and UI/UX issues. Work with a contractor to develop the next generation UI/UX interface. Work with the simulator team to develop the next generation in the family of cricket simulators.

Part-take in Design, test and build of a novel scoring system working with electrical engineers on-site and independent contractors. Develop control algorithms to be deployed on off-the-shelf or custom embedded hardware.

Key accountabilities will include:
* Maintain and improve existing software (C/C++, Python, HTML, Jquery, CSS)
* Provide remote software support to international clients
* Integrate UI/UX interface for next generation of our B1 cricket simulator
* Undertake basic electrical prototyping of embedded hardware
* Source system components
* Manage software repositories and deployment/update schedules
* Develop robust software architectures in C/C++, Python, HTML
* Develop signal detection algorithms
* Develop cloud-based and local SQL databases
* Develop custom products for clients

*Benefits*
* Work in a highly dynamic and innovative environment within the Loughborough Science Parks
* Great career progression opportunities
* Flexible working hours
* Competitive salary and meaningful equity options

We are happy to accept applications from anyone who has a right to work in the UK (i.e. EU nationals).

N.B. Please No 3rd party recruiters

items.title: Javascript Developer
items.content:
Who we are

Altus Analytics, a business of Altus Group, is the leading global technology partner to the commercial real estate industry and is poised for significant growth and expansion over the next three years.

Altus Analytics brings together the collective expertise of ARGUS and Voyanta as the leading provider of Commercial Real Estate (CRE) solutions worldwide. Our technology and industry expertise empower CRE clients and partners to work collaboratively to enhance decision making, drive performance and optimize transactional efficiency. From property budgeting, making strategic decisions about acquisitions or working with different teams, different organizations and different data, we can bring it all together.

Our tech, our stack.

Voyanta is a revolutionary software platform that gives real estate investors and lenders effective tools to capture, validate and analyse commercial real estate information.

The system is built on Amazon AWS cloud infrastructure, using Agile processes, Java, Angular 2 and PHP alongside specialist data and BI technologies running on primarily Linux platforms. It combines carefully crafted advanced user experience with in depth data modelling and manipulation and advanced business information and data analysis tools.

The opportunity

To stay at the top of our game, Voyanta is consistently exploring new technologies to improve our products - and our customers’ experience of those products. To that end, we need a new creative and dedicated Javascript Developer who wants to use Angular 2 and CSS with SASS or LESS to implement our front-end product experience.

We need a Javascript Developer who is seeking a meaningful and challenging change. Someone who wants to jump into a virtual playground, get to know our products and rebuild them in a way they envision it. This is a move for someone who wants to have the freedom to make design choices and introduce modern, responsive user-friendly processes and models.

What’s in it for you?

You want to be part of a team that is involved in project direction and has a chance to bring their ideas to fruition. A team that is respected and highly valued as having insights into what users need and want. You are seeking a chance to increase your expertise in Angular 2 and you are excited by the opportunity to rewrite existing code; rebuilding the front-end in new and modern ways.

This is a chance to work closely with the rest of the Development team and the Product team. To collaborate with Systems Architect, BAs, UI/UX, QA and the CTO to improve the customer space and push forward the customer-focused experience and engagement with our Voyanta product.

Where are you now?

You are working as a Front End Developer for a small-to-mid-sized organization using Angular 2 and Javascript. You might be in the early days of your career there and you want a chance to prove yourself. Or, you might be more experienced but stuck working in older technologies, siloed off from what the architects, backend and product teams are working on. You are enthusiastic about the user experience and excited to try new ideas and concepts. You want to join a team that will allow you the freedom to take risks, learn as you so and drive your own deliverables.

What will your career path look like?

The experience you gain here, working independently yet as part of a tightly knit scrum team will result in greater exposure to new technologies, processes and people across the greater organization.

As we grow, your role will be pivotal to the product suite we are working on. It is a chance to directly impact the design and the direction of our product front end and to grow with a rapidly developing team.

Here’s what our Javascript Developer will do:

- Build. You will work as part of a scrum team on full lifecycle front-end development for the Voyanta product.
- Champion. You will introduce original ideas and best practices to Improve the front-end functionality and user experience.
- Quality. You will conduct code review and testing
- Create. You will be responsible for estimation and design of new front end features and upgrading existing ones.
- Collaborate. You will be part of an Agile team and work closely with Development and Product team.

How do we know that’s you? You have:

- A Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related numerate discipline.
- Three years experience as a Front End Developer as part of an Agile scrum team.
- Hands-on experience using one or more of the following:
- Angular 2
- Backbone.js with Marionette.js and Require.js
- Wijmo
- CSS using Sass or LESS
- An innovative approach. You insist on keeping up with industry standards and trends. You are adept at thinking of all possible answers.
- A strong sense of ownership. You thrive in an autonomous yet collaborative environment. You are committed to doing your best work.
- Enthusiasm. You have a GitHub account or other personal projects on the go.
Initiative. You are highly capable of meeting deadlines. You are customer-focused and self-motivated.
- Outstanding communication skills. You are able to clearly present ideas and concepts within and across a multi-functional team.

Need any more reasons to want to work with us?

As we continue to grow, the possibilities for the people that join Altus Analytics are huge. From professional growth to innovation to collaboration we are committed to continuing to foster the right environment to help our people realize their full potential. We give our people the freedom and responsibility to take charge of their career path, bring new ideas to the forefront and work on critical projects that will shape the success of our clients.

We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus Analytics a great place to grow your career and do some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what’s new by following us on LinkedIn.

items.title: Backend Software Engineer (PHP)
items.content:
We’re looking for a backend engineer to join our team in London. You’ll have a track record of solving difficult engineering problems across all parts of the business. You should be as at home performing regressions across complex cohort models as building and designing APIs for our front-end team.

You’ll work as part of a talented team responsible for innovation with the freedom to research and implement solutions using cutting-edge technologies. We spend our time split between working with PHP (Symfony2, Magento, Laravel and Lumen) and Python (particularly the ERP system Odoo). Prior experience with these technologies would be ideal, but we’ll also consider candidates with all strong programming backgrounds that want a new challenge. We’re a small, dynamic, language agnostic team that’s looking to revolutionise a $100 billion industry.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Developing solutions for key business issues in relation to demand prediction, LTV modelling and cohort analysis
* Helping us scale traffic and revenue, and improve business processes through innovative use of technology
* Contributing ideas on how to solve the complex issues that the team face
* Building scalable solutions capable of quickly processing large amounts of data
* Deploying production systems on Amazon EC2

REQUIREMENTS:

* You are capable of building web applications using LAMP architecture. This will require knowledge of PHP5+ & OOP, and MySQL5 and its surrounding technologies.
* You have API experience, including integration and API design
* You understand server-side MVC frameworks (Synfony2 / Laravel)
* You can develop applications in Python
* You are able to dig deep into business requirements and having a sense of ownership over your work
* You have a desire to learn and share new practices
* You’re a really nice person

You'll score bonus points if:
* You understand Open Source technologies and are an active participant in the Open Source community
* You have a broad interest and knowledge of other programming languages, including Python and Ruby

items.title: Frontend Developer D3JS
items.content:
We are looking for Frontend Developer to come in and joining our rapidly growing team. A Frontend developer to come in alongside the designers and back-end developers to be involved in a really exciting project, to start as soon as possible.

The key factor would be to work on an Data Visualisation project using D3.JS.

1. HTML5, CSS3
2. JavaScript - Angular 1.5 - 2.0 and D3.JS (must).

items.content:

We are seeking a senior-level front-end software engineer who can independently implement complex front end features by writing clean, simple code. Join us as we create software that helps customers design and purchase custom products with ease. You'll be part of a small team of engineers who are passionate about building a great product and constantly challenging themselves to improve. Our lean approach to software development means your work will have a large impact on the business.

Collage.com is a 100% employee-owned, profitable, bootstrapped company with about 50 employees that has rapidly grown from $0 to $25 million in annual revenue since 2013. We're different from other companies: our innovative all-remote work culture was featured in a Harvard Business School case study last year. We're looking for ambitious, nice people to join us in our quest to bring great custom photo products to the world.

Learn more about our company, this role, and our interview process – and apply at: http://jobs.collage.com/apply/yyUKsMdrxR/Senior-Frontend-Sof...

items.title: Deliveroo | Software Engineer (Backend) Mid or Senior Level | London | Visa Sponsorship | http://deliveroo.engineering Deliveroo, one of Europe's fastest ...
items.content:
Deliveroo | Software Engineer (Backend) Mid or Senior Level | London | Visa Sponsorship | http://deliveroo.engineering

Deliveroo, one of Europe's fastest growing startups, are looking for Software Engineers to join us full time in our London office. Our tech stack is Ruby-on-Rails and React, although we're happy to look at candidates from all over.

We're revolutionising the food industry and making poor quality takeaways a thing of the past, allowing you to enjoy restaurant quality meals at home, in the office, or wherever you'd like to enjoy good food!

We're a startup, we work collaboratively and in feature driven product teams. We do our best to make sure our environment suits the people in it, so flexible working, occasional remote work, childcare vouchers, subsidised gym membership are just a few of the things we have in place to make sure working here is convenient for all.

Link to vacancy - https://deliveroo.workable.com/jobs/29743

Engineering Blog - http://deliveroo.engineering

Interview Process: 15 minute phone screen (not in the least bit technical), a task is then sent out for you to kick off in your own time whilst we schedule an onsite. You'll talk us through your method and do some pairing (2 hours) and then on the same day have a chat with a senior member of the team (30 minutes) to find out if we work in a way that's suitable for you.
